title: SUSANNA L. GOLDMAN
description: Susanna L. Goldman, who was completing her junior year at the Trumbull College of Yale University, died Saturday at the Yale New Haven Hospital of injuries suffered in an automobile accident near New Haven on April 26, She was 20 years old and lived with her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Martin R. R. Goldman, at 144 East 84th Street. Mr. Goldman is a senior editor of Time magazine.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Attorney Stresses Business Crime
description: Investigations of whitecollar crimes will be emphasized by Robert B. Fiske Jr. in his key post as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

title: Forego First in Metropolitan; Jersey Derby to Life's Hope
description: The mighty Forego, making his first stakes appearance of the 1976 season, was up to his old tricks yesterday. Conceding weightfrom 4 to 24 pounds to his five rivalsthe talented son of Forli captured the $111,100 Metropolitan Handicap at Belmont Park.

title: In Memoriam
description: BRUNO. James V.10th Anniversary. Miss yon. Your daughter, Tina.

title: State Vault Record Bettered by Arietta
description: Lance Arietta upset Bill Hartley in the pole vault with a New York State and meet record of 15 feet 7P1 inches and Christian Brothers Academy of Lincroft. N.J.. surprised Bishop Loughlin in the distance medley yesterday at the Eastern States schoolboy outdoor track and field championships.

title: Ballet: Rialto
description: This scruffy Aquarian age has so little glamour that one eagerly luxuriates in the reflected glow from another glittering era. The term em: ployed to cover such longing and sense of loss is nostalgia. and it bathed Rialto. Rodney Griffin's new ballet given by the Theater Dance Collection Sunday evening at Cnorcoground.

title: Synthetic Motor Oil Reported Gaining In Sales Despite Its Sharply Higher Cost
description: As the nation's drivers took to the road over the Memorial Day weekend, more cars than ever before were using synthetic motor oil, rather than a conventional engine lubricant refined directly from crude oil.

title: Humphrey And Kennedy?
description: LOS ANGELES, May 30Barring some stunning reversal, California's enigmatic but ambitious Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. should win the biggest bloc of this state's 280 delegates to the Democratic National Convention. Senator Frank Church, a Westerner and a Stanford man, should run well here, too. But here is an example of just how hard it is going to be for the ABCAnybody But Carter movement to stop the frontrunner from Georgia:

title: FORD IS PLANNING 7NATION PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 President Ford is planning an economic conference with six other nations this summer, White House spokesman announced today.

title: Unbranded Supermarket Products Are Stirring Debate in France
description: PARIS, May 28Though the public seems to like it so far, retailers and advertisers have been thrown into an uproar by a campaign of France's largest supermarket chain to sell unbranded products at prices below those with brand names.

title: Greenwich Polo Victor
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 31 Butch Butterworth scored four goals and led Greenwich to a 65 victory over Fairfield today in the opening game of the 52d polo season at the Fairfield County Hunt Club. The other Greenwich goals were scored by Craig Heatley.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 31The new state budget is about ready for a vote in the Legislature, but it may be an exercise in futility because no one knows yet how to finance it.

title: Giles, Siderowf Advance In British Amateur Golf
description: ST. ANDREWS. Scotland, May 31 (AP)Vinny Giles and Dick Siderowf, top American contenders for the British Amateur golf championship, won their firstround matches today under contrasting weather conditions on the St. Andrews Old Course.

title: ISRAEL DENIES ROLE IN AFRICAN ARMIES
description: TEL AVIV, May 31Marcia Friedman, an Opposition member of Parliament, asserted toclay that hundreds of Israeli soldiers were attached to South African Army units as instructors.

title: TUITION AT CITY U. UP FOR APPROVAL BY BOARD TONIGHT
description: New York City, which has offered a free college education to its citizens since 1847, is expected to bow to fiscal pressures and impose tuition in the City University by a vote tonight of a reluctant Board of Higher Education.

title: Advertising
description: The Buckingham Corporation, importer of Cutty Sark Scotch, will begin today its promotion in certain major markets of Cutty 12 by taking on Chivas Regal, Seagram's dominant entry in the deluxe Scotch field.

title: Union Chief Backs Merger
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) Sol Stetin, general president of the Textile Workers Union of America, said today that the proposed merger of his union with the clothing workers union is a practical step. Tha Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, with 350,000 members, and the textile workers, with 160,000 members, announced in March that they had agreed to merge, subject to ratification by union members.

title: ... France's Proliferation
description: In the annals of American relations with its oldest ally, Valery Giscard d'Estaing will be recorded as the French President who reversed the deterioration that began almost two decades ago with the return to power of Gen. Charles de Gaulle. The improved atmosphere was evident throughout his recent Bicentennial visit.

title: Two Views of ChicagoSchool Architects
description: CHICAGOHere, where it has always been said that architects would rather build than talk, the architects have begun to talk. And they are not only talking, they are also arguing.

title: Manila Upsets Airline Rule
description: MANILA, May 31 (UPI)The policy of Philippine Air Lines of hiring only unmarried women as stewardesses is illegal and unconstitutional, the Labor Department ruled today. In ordering the airline to reinstate a stewardess dismissed because she was married, Labor Secretary Blas Ople said that the security of marriage could make some women more beautiful.

title: Jacques Monod, Nobel Biologist, Dies; Thought Existence Is Based on Chance
description: Jacques Monod, the Nobel Prizewinning French biologist and director of the Pasteur Institute in Paris, died yesterday at his home in Cannes, France. He was 66 years old.

title: Vic Ghezzi, 65, Dies
description: Vic Ghezzi, who beat Byron Nelson to win the Professional Golfers Association title in 1941, died Sunday night in Miami Beach. He was 65 years old. Details, page 38.

title: A School Laboratory All at Sea
description: GROTON, Conn.When Dr. Howard Weiss was in high school, he recalled the other day, The teacher said, Bic): life; logy: study. Biology: the study of life. We were shown lots of plastic models and preserved dead creatures, but we never saw living thine the whole year.

description: CRANSTON, R.I., May 31The frontrunning and lateblooming Democratic Presidential candidates made their final efforts to reach the voters of this smallest state today on the eve of three smallstate primaries.

description: Analysts Suggest Market, in January and February, Gat Ahead of Recovery

title: DR. LEONARD HALLOCK
description: Dr. Leonard A. Hallock, a urologist died Sunday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 2 East 86th Street.

title: Ford's Economic Efforts Yield Few Political Gains
description: WASHINGTON. May 31 President Ford uses one catchline about the performance of the economy under his leaders:lip so often in his stump speeches that reporters and other members of his traveling party have taken to mouthing it silently.

title: Martha Mitchell, 57, Dies Of BoneMarrow Cancer
description: Martha Mitchell, the outspoken estranged wife of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, died early yesterday at the Memorial SloaneKettering Cancer Center. She was 57 years old.

title: Spy Commander Victor In Jump at Devon Show
description: DEVON, Pa., May 31Robin Ann Rost, a 19yearold rider from Branchville, N. J.. rode Spy Commander to victory today in the first intermediate jumper class at the Devon Horse Show..

title: But Will They Think Mink in June?
description: Revillon's blockbuster of a show left the audience reeling. In what seemed to be a move to catch the retail customer early (but will she think mink in June?). Saks Fifth Avenue invited several hundred customers, along with buyers from other stores and the press the other day.

title: Malawi Picks New Cabinet With 4 Fewer Ministries
description: ZOMBA, Malawi, May 31 (Reuters)President Kazumu Banda of Malawi announced today a new 12man Cabinet with four ministers fewer than his previous one.

title: State Monitor Calls Most New York City Budget Cuts Uncertain
description: The state's chief monitor for New York City's costcutting program said yesterday that the city could not be sure of $240 million worth of savings in its $360 million economy plan for 1977.

title: Irate Riders, Delayed 7 Hours, Delay Their Charter Jet for 36
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 31 (AP)After giving the charter airline a taste of its own medicine, a county judge today dropped a legal action that had ;grounded a World Airways jet for more than 36 hours.

title: McGovern Drops 2 Staff Aides Active in a StopCarter Move
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) Senator George McGovern dismissed two of his staff aides for becoming publicly involved in a reported movement among Democrats to stop Jimmy Carter from winning the party's Presidential nomination. The dismissal followed a New York Times article yesterday in which Jack Quinn and Alan Baron were identified as being among leaders of a loose and shifting alliance of people opposing Mr. Carter's nomination.

title: P. & G. IS PLANNING NEIN UNIT IN JAPAN
description: TOKYOProcter & Gamble, the giant American soap, paper and food manufacturer, will formally apply to the Japanese Government soon to establish a wholly owned subsidiary here.

title: 3 Killed in Upstate Crash
description: HAMBURG, N.Y., May 31 (UPI)A headon crash in this Erie County town this afternoon killed three personsincluding an infant delivered prematurely shortly after the accidentand critically injured a fourth. Authorities identified the dead as Sylvia Kulak, 33 years old of Niagara Falls; her infant daughter, and Sara Scamorra, 67, of Cheektowaga, Mrs. Scamorra's husband, Anthony, 78, was in critical condition at Buffalo Mercy Hospital. The police said the Kulak and Scamorra cars collided after one of the vehicles aoparently went out of control.

title: Bubonic Plague Victim Out
description: PUEBLO, Colo., May 31 (AP) A 22yearold woman etas been released from a hospital following treatment for bubonic plague, the Colorado Department of Health said today. The woman was the seventh confirmed human case of plague in Colorado since the disease was first found in this stale in 1941, the department said.

title: Benitez Retains Title
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico. May 31 (UPI)Wilfredo Benitez of Puerto Rico defended his World Boxing Association junior welterweight title tonight in a unanimous decision against Colombian challenger Eminano Villa, of Colombia. Benitez, a 17yearold high school junior, is the youngest professional boxer to hold a world title and is unbeaten in 27 fights.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Fort Lee (N.J.) Rent Leveling Board has filed suit in Federal District Court in Newark in an attempt to overturn a decision by the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development to end local rent controls at a highrise apartment building. The owners of the building, Mediterranean Towers West, had complained they were denied a hardship rent increase provided for in the borough rent law and could not be assured of sufficient cash flow to meet their obligations, including payment on a federally insured $18.4 million mortgage. Under regulations adopted last year, the H.U.D. can preempt local rent controls when they jeopardize Federal financial interests in a property. The pre  emption took effect on Feb. 20.

description: New York City has commit ted $3.5 million of its own funds to reconstruct a fourblock dilapidated section of the Henry Hudson Parkway along Riverside Park at the 96th Street interchange.

title: EGYPTIANS APPROVE LIQUOR RESTRICTION
description: CAIRO, May 31The General Assembly approved a bill yesterday prohibiting the sale of alcohol except in tourist areas.

title: Blacks Gaining Politically But Still Feel Frustrated
description: CLEVELANDWhen Carl B. Stokes ran for mayor of Cleveland in the mid1960's. William and Lucy Dorsey and their daughter, Myrna, became wrapped up in the campaign, actively and emotionally.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: The Hackensack River was reopened to commercial traffic yesterday, five days after it was closed following a massive oil spill. The Coast Guard said most of the 160,000 gallons of heavy industrial oil that seeped out a Wellen Oil Company tank into the river had been cleaned up to the Route 46 bridge at Ridgefield Park and that would take about a month to remove all the oil clinging to marshland grass and shorelines. Federal and state authorities are still attempting to assess the total efiect of the spill on wildlife.

title: Red Sox Bow to Hunter
description: BOSTON, May you were wondering how some Boston fans would react tonight to the Red Sox's brawl with the Yankees earlier this month in New York, here's the answer: They threw things, such as exploding bombs, rocks, golf balls and the like.

title: L. J. Baroody Marries Linda A. Christensen
description: Linda Ann Christensen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Aage Theodor Christensen of Brooklyn, was married yesterday afternoon to Lloyd Jamil Baroody, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jamil Murad Baroody of Lakeville, Conn., And New York. The bridegroom's father is Saudi Arabian chief delegate to the United Nations.

description: WASHINGTON, May 31Congress and the Federal Election Commission, whose relations have been uneasy at best for more than a year, are heading toward another confrontation over a massive 244page code of campaign regulations the agency has drafted.

title: 75Foot Flag Is Flown
description: NORWALK, Ohio, May 31 (AP)  Norwalk Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 2743 showed its colors today with what members contend is one of the largest flags ever flown. The 13star flag, fashioned for a specially built, 160foot tower, measures 46 by 75 feet.

description: WELLFLEET, Mass., May 31 (UPI)A 16th century Wampanoag Indian woman was reburied yesterday because of increasing concern for the traditions and feelings of native Americans.

description: Sunday was a glorious day for the New York City Ballet. In a way, it could, unfairly but with a certain accuracy, be characterized as a Peter Martins festival.

title: 18 Soldiers Reported Slain In May in Rhodesian War
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 31 (UPI)  Rhodesia's accelerated monthold antiguerrila offensive has claimed the lives of 18 Rhodesian soldiers, four more than in all of 1975, according to official figures released today.

title: Bastogne Opens Museum Honoring'
description: BASTOGNE, Belgium, May 31  With military bands, marching children and a unit of American soldiers in Bicentennial garb. Bastogne today inaugurated a museum dedicated to the heroic American defense of the town during the Battle of the Bulge.

title: Dyer, in Porsche, WinsatLime Rock
description: LIME ROCK, Conn., May 31  George Dyer of Woodside, Calif., is a 27yearold Porsche Carrera driver who never had led a professional race since he began racing three years ago. Yet, at Lime Rock Park today, he slipped past an astounded Michael Keyser on the last lap, and won the International Motor Sports Association's Camel GT race by a thousandth of a second.

title: Egypt Bids Arab League Make P.L.O. Full Member
description: CAIRO, May 31 (Reuters)Egypt has formally asked they Arab League to admit the Palestine Liberation Organization as a full member of the league, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said today.

title: People in Sports
description: Rosi Mittermaier, West Germany's champion Alpine skier, made it official yesterday. In Starnberg, West Germany, she announced her retirement from the sport and said she was joining an American firm to design sports clothes.

description: NEW HAVEN, May 31Brazil captured the American Bicentennial Soccer Cup by defeating Italy, 41, in a bitterly fought game at Yale Bowl today before 36,096 fans, including Secretary of State Henry Kissinger.

title: Italian Business Escalates Role In AntiCommunist Party Fight

description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) President Ford paid tribute to the nation's war dead today, exhorted campaign workers in Rhode Island by telephone and caught up on staff work.

title: Two Singers Back Brown
description: LOS ANGELES, My 31 (UPI) The singers Dionne Warwick and Helen Reddy have been named to a national committee of prominent women endorsing Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.'s campaign for President. The committee is headed by Representative Yvonne Brathwaite Burke of California.

title: Grand Street Boys Put Clubhouse Up for Sale
description: The Grand Street Boys Association, the philanthropic organization that originated on the Lower East Side 56 years ago, has put its sevenyearold midtown clubhouse up for sale for $2 million and opened talks with several fraternal anti otner groups here for rental of new headnuarters.

title: The Associated Press Is Developing Broader Perception of What Is News
description: The computers and dazzling, highspeed printers of The Associated Press relentlessly spill; out something like three million words a day. Within hours, news from these dispatches apt pears in up to 1,300 newspapers; and is read over 3,500 radloi and television stations through1 out the country. At the same time, the news is rewritten, re edited and transmitted to millions more people in 100, foreign countries.

title: Hope Rises for Vaccine Against Malaria
description: GENEVA, May 31Rockefeller University has found a way to culture the most lethal form of malaria parasite, rais ing hopes at the World Health Organization here that the long  sought vaccine against that disease may become a reality.

title: Martha Mitchell, 57, Dies Of BoneMarrow Cancer
description: Martha Mitchell, the outspoken estranged wife of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, died early yesterday at the Memorial SloaneKettering Cancer Center. She was 57 years old.

title: A Militant Antibusing Group Sought in Boston Violence
description: BOSTON, May 31 (UPI) The police said Cuddy they were hunting for members of an underground militant antibusing group that said it was responsible for smashing windows in the city's downtown business district and a $75,000 fire at the Boston Tea Party Museum.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Waterfowl Habitat Aid
description: During the past decade, wetlands waterfowl habitat in the United States had disappeared at an alarming rate, giving way to agriculture, housing projects, highways and industry.

title: Notes on People
description: Christopher Columbus represented Spain when he claimed the New World almost 500 years ago, but King Juan Carlos I yesterday became the first reigning Spanish monarch to visit the Western Hemisphere. Following by plane the path of Columbus's ocean voyage, he and Queen Sofia stopped for a 30hour visit in Santo Domingo the Dominican Republic, where the explorer landed and where his remains are believed to be buried.

title: Holiday Closings
description: All banks in the New York, New Jersey and Connecticut area were closed yesterday for the Memorial Day holiday. Securities and commodities markets were also closed.

title: JaiAlai Fronton Ready
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., May 31 (UPI)Connecticut's second jaialai fronton will open here tomorrow night at 7 o'clock. There will be a 12game program and parimutuel wagering on all 12 games, including several forms of exotic betting.

title: Liberties Union Booklet Lists What Street Protesters Can and Cannot Legally
description: In %iew of the likelihood of demonstrations when the Democratic National Convention vets here next month, the New York Civil Liberties Union Foundation has published an eightpage leaflet on free speech called Your Rights on the Street.

title: Long Process Seen in Revising Economic Order to Aid Poor Lands
description: PARIS, May 31Thirdworld countries want a new international economic order and industrial countries of the West concede that some changes in economic structures may be necessary. All agree that there is a need for greater stability and more predictability and that the poor countries must be helped to help themselves.

title: Cojak Dropped to 2d on Foul
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., May 31If horse racing had the same rules as football, Cojak probably would have won the $133,700 Jersey Derby today at Garden State Park.

title: Dr. Ralph Tocher, Headed State Board for Optometry
description: Ralph B. Tocher, a past president of the State Board for Optometry and an optomestrist in Malverne, LI., died of cancer Sunday in South Nassau Communities Hospital in Oceanside, L.I. He was 67 years old.

title: Birch Society Members Tied to Smuggling of Illegal Drug
description: SAN DIEGO. May 31Leaders of an alleged international smuggling conspiracy say that members of the John Birch Society have been prominent in spearheading the promotion and distribution of the illegal drug Laetrile to American cancer sufferers and their doctors.

title: The New York Times/Paul Hosefros MEMORIAL DAY in New York brought out Army veterans like John Partridge, who marched in the parade up Riverside Drive, and youngsters like Paul Katzer, 6, who used occasion to wear Christmas gift, a uniform. Page 39.
description: In honor of Memorial Day, 100 New York veterans marched up Riverside Drive, laid a wreath of red and white carnations at the Soldiers and Sailors Monument, sang God Bless America and listened to a speech proclaiming that to be remembered is never to have died; to be forgotten is never to have lived. A crowd of several hundred was on hand at the monument, at 89th Street, to listen to that speech by Nicholas Van Eck of the United War Veterans and to hear band music.

title: Waldheim, at Habitat Parley, Cites Growing Poverty
description: VANCOUVER, Canada, May 31Opening a United Nations conference on the problems of the world's communities, Secretary General Kurt Waldheim said today that a century of misdirected technological progress had left the world with larger number of impoverished people than ever.

title: Marco's Minions
description: SATELLITE BEACH, Fla. Thank the good Lord for the Corps of Army Engineers, which has denied the huge Deltona Corporation dredgeandfill permits needed for 4,300 additional canal homes on Marco Island, south of Tampa Bay. Let it be proclaimed throughout the land that leftleaning ecologists have a new champion.

title: Food Stamp Suit
description: Agriculture Secretary Earl Butz is at it again. He has characterized the plaintiffs in a lawsuit brought to enjoin the Administration's new food stamp regulations as bleeding hearts in search of a softheaded judge who will allow affluent students to take advantage the program.

title: Veterans Celebrate The Holiday
description: In honor of Memorial Day, 100 New York veterans marched up Riverside Drive, laid a wreath of red and white carnations at the Soldiers and Sailors Monument. sang God Bless America and listened to a speech proclaiming that to be remembered is never to have died; to be forgotten is never to have lived. A crowd of several hundred was on hand at the monument, at 89th Street, to listen to that speech and others and to hear band music.

title: Rockefeller Acting As If He's Running
description: Although there is considerable evidence pointing to the retirement of Vice President Rockefeller from government service at the end of this year, the irrepressible Mr. Rockefeller, who will be 68 in July, is acting like a politician running for something.

title: Mrs. Abzug Seeks Evidence From Moynihan on U.N. Graft
description: Daniel Patrick Moynihan, who has not yet formally declared his candidacy for United States Senator from New York, should testify before Congress about his charges of bribery at the United Nations, one of the declared candidates. Representative Bella S. Abzug, said yesterday.

title: For Young Urban Nomads, Home Is the Streets
description: You couldn't see Rosa at first. She was sitting in the shadows, behind the three motorcycles, in the back of the gang's clubhouse. When the gang leader nodded, she told her story to a syinpathetic social worker.

title: TALKS AT IMPASSE ON STAVISKY LAW
description: The Mayor's office, the New York City Board of Education and the sponsors of the state's StaviskyGoodman Law have reached an impasse in their attempts to negotiate a cornpromise that might soften the effect of the law, which requires the city to allocate 21 percent of its expense budget to the Board of Education.

title: Senator Stennis Favored In Primary Race Today
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 31 (UPI)Senator John C. Stennis, seeking his fifth full term, faces E. Michael Marks, a Jackson attorney who is a newcomer to statewide politics, in a Democratic primary election tomorrow. Senator Stennis is heavily favored.

title: Albany Agrees on a Plan to Consolidate Construction Agencies Into One Unit
description: ALRANY, May 31Republicans and Democrats in the Assembly and Senate have reached agreement on a measure to consolidate all the state's construction agencies into one unita step they contend would bring use of state borrowing under more control by the Governor and the Legislature.

title: ADM. HERBERT RAYNER
description: OTTAWA, May 31 (AP) Vice Admiral Herbert S. Rayner, former Canadian Chief of Naval Staff, died of leukemia in a hcspital here last night. He was 65 years old.

description: Dr. Mayer E. Ross, a general surgeon, died Sunday at Caledonian Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 75 years old and a resident of Brooklyn.

title: Cyril W. Beaumont Dies at 85; Ballet Historian and Bookseller
description: Cyril William Beaumont, the noted ballet historian and bookseller, died May 24 in London hospital. He was 85 years old.

description: WASHINGTON. May 31 With a lack of fanfare, the Pentagon has relaxed its seculity for the first time in four years to let Bicentennial tourists visit the famous office building.

description: PARIS, May 31 (UPI)Seven United States players, including Tom Gorman, were eliminated today at a controversial start of the 5210,000 French open tennis championships at Roland Garros Stadium.

title: Books of The Times
description: The tragicomedy of their upper classes in this century has fascinated quite a few English writers. The pathos of fighting hopeless battle against homogenization, of insisting on ceremony in an unceremonious time, of defending style when authenticity is all the ragethese rearguard actions may be the British equivalent of America's nostalgia.

title: Bonn Expects Brezhnev Visit
description: BONN, May 31 (AP)Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, is expected to pay an official visit to Bonn after the West German national elections of Oct. 3, the Government said today.

title: An Often Overlooked Jaw Condition Is Blamed for Some Head and Neck Pains
description: Nagging pain and other symptoms in the head, ear. neck and shoulder can be caused by an often overlooked, condition in the jaw, according to an article in the issue of the Journal of the American Medical. Association published yesterday.

title: Discrimination in Mortgages Is Reported by a Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON. May 31 (UPI) The Senate Banking Committee said today race and sex discrimination by money lenders was widespread despite a law that forbade such practices when making home mortgage loans.

title: Helping New York

title: Main Singapore Party Quits The Socialist International
description: LONDON. May 31 (Reuters)  Singapore's governing People Action Party hoc resigned from the Socialist International following an accusaLion hv Prime Minister T eel Kuan Yew that same of the, member parties had told him how to govern.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: 13 FOOD BUSINESSES CITED ON VIOLATIONS
description: The Health Department has cited 13 more food businesses for failing a health code inspection and has warned that they could be ordered closed if the violations persisted on second and final visit by its inspectors. The establishments named were:

title: Syria Says It Is Willing To Meet Iraq and Egypt
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 31 (Reuters)Information Minister Ahmed Iskander said today that Syria was ready to discuss any plans that would help settle differences with Egypt and Iraq.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Among the public services New York City, in its critical financial state, apparently can no longer afford are those provided by its broadcasting stations. Even with their operating budgets cut to the bone, the three stations of the Municipal Broadcasting SystemWNYCAM, WNYCFM and WNYCTV (Channel 31)cost $2.1 million a year to overate.

title: Key West Water Problem
description: KEY WEST. Fla., Max 31 (AP)  With tourists crowding the Florida Keys on the long Memorial Day holiday, the desalination plant supplying drinking water to the Key West area has broken down. Residents and revelers are being asked to cut back and officials said it may Se a couple of weeks before the water plant can be repaired.

title: German Ethnic Emigrants From Poland Increasing
description: WARSAW, May 31 (Reuters) The number of exit permits granted to people wishing to emigrate to West Germany has risen sharply since ratification of the WarsawBonn agreement on payments and emigration in March, West German sources said here today.

title: Iran and British Steel In $1 Billion Mill Deal
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 31 (AP)Iran and the British Steel Corporation have signed a $1 billion deal for construction of a steel mill at Isfahan in central Iran. The fiveyear project to build the country's third mill will be financed by Iran, a communique issued yesterday after the signing ceremony said.

title: ATOM POWER PLANTS NEAR CITIES OPPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) A collection of public interest groups asked the Government today to ban construction of (nuclear power plants near heavily populated cities.

title: Indonesia Completes Takeover Of Portuguese Colony of Timor
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 3 Indonesia today completed its takeover of East Timor, end ing 400 years of Portuguese rule.

title: Party Names Keynoter
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 31 (AP)An author and lecturer associated with the John Birch Society has been named keynote speaker for the national American Party Convention. The Utah party chairman, Hal Massey, announced today that Scott Stanley Jr. of the American Opinion Speakers Bureau will speak at the convention June 17 to 19 in the Salt Lake City Salt Palace.

title: Dahlia First In $200,000 Coast Race
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 31 (AP)Dahlia, winner of most of her big races in England and France, added a major American trophy today in taking the $200,000 Hollywood Invitational Turf Handicap at Hollywood Park.

title: Elsie Kipling Bambridge, 80, The Author's Only Daughter
description: Elsie Kipling Bambridge, only daughter of Rudyard Kipling and widow of Capt. George St. Clair Bambridge, an Irish Guards officer in World War who was later an attache at British embassies in Madrid, Brussels and Paris, died in England on May 23. She was 80 years old and lived at Witnpole Hall, her husband's estate near Cambridge.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 1, 1976

title: West Point's Dilemma
description: The charges of widespread cheating at West Point can no longer be sensibly discussed merely in terms of the actual number of cadets involved in the scandal. The claim of the 48 accused cadets that hundreds others have been guilty of similar transgressions may prove to be an exaggeration. But it is evident that the honor code around which the charges revolve has not been working for some time. The real question is whether that code can or should be salvaged in its traditional form.

title: Raytheon to Get a Saudi Missile Order
description: The Raytheon Company will announce today that it has received a $1.14 billion order from Saudi Arabia for its Hawk missile system, related equipment, training and emplacement construction work, a spokesman for the diversified electronics concern said yesterday.

title: Surinam Seeking Return Of OneThird Who Fled
description: PARAMARIBO, Surinam Visitors to this former Dutch colony are often handed Government brochures containing a speech made by Prime Minister Henck Arron on the occasion of independence last year.

title: Blacks Gaining Politically But Still Feel Frustrated
description: CLEVELANDWhen Carl B. Stokes ran for mayor of Cleveland in the mid1960's, William and Lucy Dorsey and their daughter, Myrna, became wrapped up in the campaign, actively and emotionally

title: ANNE REID, EXAIDE TO ROCKEFELLERS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 31 Anne de BailletLatour Reid, wife of Fergus. Reid 3d, an investment adviser to the Rockefeller family, died suddenly in Concord, N. H., Sunday. She was 39 years old and lived at 124 Glenwood Drive in Greenwich.

title: L'etat C'est Us
description: Ever since Life magazine published a photograph of Ted Sorensen walking up the path from the northwest gate to the White House in 1960 with caption quoting him as saying, I will be concerned with the programs and the policies of President John F. Kennedy, other young mere in other years have dreamed of making that walk and exercising that power for a President of their own. Today scores of such people are circling and serving the candidate of their choice, and few of them will someday walk through the gate and settle into an office somewhere near the President's.

title: Fort Lee Suing to Prevent An Apartment Rent Rise
description: NEWARK, May 31The Fort Lee Rent Leveling Board has filed suit in Federal District Court here in an attempt to overturn a decision by the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development to end local rent controls in highrise apartment building.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: VW Confirms Pennsylvania Is Its Choice for Plant Site
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, May 31 (Reuters)New Stanton, Pa. is the site most favored by Volkswagen for establishing an American assembly plant in, a VW spokesman confirmed today.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Mrs. Meir Meets Kissinger For Friendly Conversation
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger and former Prime Minister Golda Meir of Israel talked privately for 90 minutes here yesterday in what she later described as just a frindly conversation.

title: A Partial Accord Reached In AnheuserBusch Dispute
description: ST. LOUIS, May 31 (UPI)A partial settlement was reached today in the complex union dispute that has kept 4,000 employees out of work since they ended their 13week strike at. the headquarters plant of AnheuserBusch Inc.

title: R. C. Liebman Weds Elaine S. Friedman
description: Elaine Susan Friedman, a librarian with the University of Michigan, was married yesterday in Roslyn, L.I., to Robert Curtis Liebman, a graduate student at Michigan.

title: GEN. PAUL BAILLY
description: PARIS, May 31 (AP)Gen. Paul Bailly, who commanded Free French bombers based in Britctin during World War II, was killed in an automobile accident today. He was 73 years old.

title: Hope Rises for Vaccine Against Malaria
description: GENEVA. May 31Rockefeller University has found a way to culture the most lethal form of malaria parasite rais ing hopes at the World Health Organization here that the long  sought vaccine against that disease may become a reality.

title: CAROUTPUTPLANNED AT 30MONTH PEAK
description: DETROIT, May 31 (AP)Barring any shutdowns because of the lengthy rubber strike, the nation's automakers plan to assemble 849.000 new cars in June, the industry's highest output In 30 months.

title: SYRIANS REPORT MOVES TO PACIFY 2 LEBANON AREAS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Tuesday, June 1Syria said last night that it had intervened in northern Lebanon to stop the fighting around beleaguered Christian villages near the Syrian border that had been heavily shelled for several days.

title: CORRECTION
description: The address of the East Side Center, a methadone clinic, was listed incorrectly in The New York Times yesterday. The clinic is at 200 East 53d Street.

title: Wallace Denies Any Talks On Releasing His Delegates
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 31 (UPI)A spokesman for Gov. George C. Wallace denied today a report that Mr. Wallace had talked to .Jimmy Carter about the possibility of releasing his 163 Democratic convention delegates to the Presidential contender from Georgia.

title: For Young Urban Nomads, Home Is the Streets
description: You couldn't see Rosa at first. She was sitting in the shadows, behind the three motorcycles, in the back of the gang's clubhouse. When the gang leader nodded, she told her story to a sympathetic social worker.

title: FRENCH ASSAILING ATOM PLANT SALE
description: PARIS, May 31A controversy has arisen here over the announcement that South Africa is to obtain a nuclear power plant from France.

title: Reagan Will Go to Ohio For Weekend Campaigning
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31 (AP)Ronald Reagan, apparently convinced that he can !spare the time from his cam!paign in California, will spend next weekend seeking votes in the Ohio Presidential primary election.

title: OTTAWA HIGH COURT STUDIES WAGE CURB
description: OTTAWA, May 31Before an overflow crowd of spectators, the Supreme Court of Canada opened hearings today on a challenge to the legality of the Government's controversial wage and price controls. The case is considered one of the most important constitutional issues to come before the tribunal in many years.

title: Bridge:
description: Two young New York experts, Keith Garber and Carl Lindenman, won the Goldman pairs championship at the New York Hilton Hotel Sunday night, adding their names to a 46yearlist of champions that includes many of the greatest figures in the history of the game. Iii second position were Alan Sontag, one of the game's most formidable performers, and Harshad Shukla of New York City.

title: A World of Idiot Proof
description: CHICAGOFood well seasoned with mendacity seems to he the specialty of an everincreasing number of restaurants around the country. For while most of the public still naively assumes the food served in a restaurant was actually prepared on the premises by a resident chef or cook, more and more restaurateurs, eager to cut labor costs and to simplify their lives in general, are buying prepared convenience foods and palming them off as their own creations.

title: Leftistsand Florence Police Clash Near Rightist Meeting!
description: FLORENCE, Italy, May 31 (UPI)The police fired teargas! grenades tonight to disperse: leftist demonstrators who were barred from a political speech! by Giorgio Almirante, the lead er of the Italian Social MovementNational Right Wing. The demonstrators were throwing stones, the police said. Incendi ary missiles set several auto1 mobiles afire and many shops and bars lowered their shutters for hours until calm returned. The police said seven persons, including three policemen, were treated for injuries arrested.

title: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries
description: Buses listed In order of post positions Letter designates OTB Listing

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE. Va., May 31 (AP) Hobart, the National Collegiate champion, Roanoke and Cortland State each was represented by five players on the college division allAmerican lacrosse squads named today by the United States Intercollegiate Lacrosse Coaches Association.

title: Britain and Iceland Begin Fishery Negotiations
description: OSLO, May 31 (AP)Talks expected to end the dispute between Britain and Iceland over fishing rights opened today in this Norwegian capital.

title: DON C. KREGER
description: Don C. Kreger, a retired trust officer of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, died Sunday in Paul Kimball Hospital in Lakewood, N.J. He was 81 years old and lived in the Leisure Village Community in Lakewood. He formerly lived in ville Centre, LI., and Bedminster, N. J.

description: June 1, 1976 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Paris Opera Turns to TV To Help Pay Its Expenses
description: PARIS, May 31The first experimental transmission by closedcircuit television from the Paris Opera stage onto a giant cinema screen in an auditorium for 3.700 on the edge of the city proved a smashing success tonight. The transmission, of the first act of Mozart's Cosi fan torte. under Julius Rudel of the New York City Opera. was perfect in terms of sound and was almost perfect visually.

title: Possibility of Bomb Studied In Explosion Fatal to Three
description: VERNON, Calif., May 31 (AP) An explosion that killed three persons and injured 17 at meat packing plant may have been caused by refrigeration equipment, the authorities say. But they do not dismiss the possibility of a bomb.

title: Four Light Tremors Shake Area in Northeastern Italy
description: UDINE, Italy, May 31 (UPI) Four light earth tremors shook northeast Italy last night and today, seismological experts said, but no damage or injuries were reported.

title: On Beirut's Streets, Quick Bursts Of Killing Shatter Even Good
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 31 There is a rhythm to the cycle of violence in Lebanon. Some days are bad, some are relatively good. And there are had moments even on the best of days.

title: ArabU.S. Bank Joins City Influx
description: While manufacturing companies by the dozen have been fleeing New York City, foreign banks have been moving in the opposite direction, seeking to establish themselves in the city that more than ever is viewed as the world's financial capital.

title: SYRIANS REPORT MOVES TO PACIFY 2 LEBANON AREAS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Tuesday, June 1Syria said last night that it had intervened in northern Lebanon to stop the fighting around beleaguered Christian villages near the Syrian border that had been heavily shelled for several days.

title: Former Welfare Recipients Feel Career Ladder Leads Nowhere
description: TEANECK  For nearly four years, dozens of former welfare recipients from New York City have expended time, effort and money they can ill afford in a program aimed at moving them up the socalled career ladder to better jobs and fuller livesonly to find the ladder leading nowhere.

title: 17% of Nation Is Expected To Be Over 65 in Year 2030
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 If present birth trends continue an estimated 17 percent of the population will he 65 or older by the year 2030, compared with 10.5 percent today. a new Census Bureau shows.

title: Chess:
description: What is the ideal time allowance for a tournament game? Since the mid19th century, when such an innovative, but excessively careful, player as the American Louis Paulsen, would drive Paul Morphy to distraction by converting every encounter into an allday affair, it has been recognized that reflection time must be limited.

title: FORD IS PLANNING 7NATION PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 President Ford is planning an economic conference with six other nations this summer, a White House spokesman announced today.

title: Lawyer Weds Aviva Diamant
description: At the Oakland Jewish Center in Bayside, Queens, yesterday afternoon, Aviva Fruma Diamant and Steven Joel Kaufman, associates with the New York law firm of Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson, were married by Rabbi Joseph Schevelowitz.

title: Austrian Leader in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran May 31President Rudolf Krichschidger of Austria discussed bilateral cooperation and means or combatting global terrorism today in private talks with Shah Mohammad Riza Pahlavi. government sources said. 0:1 ministers of the Organizat,on of Petroleum Exporting Countries were the target of a bloody attack in Vienna last Dec. 20.

title: Mardge Cohen Wed To Gordon D. Schiff
description: Mardge Hillary Cohen and Gordon David Schiff, both of whom will graduate on June 12 from the Rush Medical College in Chicago, were married there yesterday in Temple Rodfei Zedek by Rabbi RaIph Simon.

title: PRISON PROGRAM CALLED A FAILURE
description: HARTFORDAfter six years at the head of one of the more advanced and innovative prison systems in the country, John R. Manson, Connecticut's Commissioner of Correction, has gradually and reluctantly come to the conclusion that the cause for rehabilitating prisoners is largely a lost one.

title: Pound's Drop Reflects Doubts About Labor Party and Economy
description: LONDON, May 31A stocky American businessman in a threepiece suit was standing in the lobby of the Stafford Hotel here a while ago. He was speaking loudly and authoritatively to three respectful, whitejacketed waiters.

title: CORRECTION
description: The address of the East Side Center, a methadone clinic, was listed incorrectly in The New York Times yesterday. The clinic is at 200 East 53d Street.

title: Japan's Nonproliferation
description: The longawaited approval by the Japanese Parliament of the Nonproliferation Treaty (NPT) was a significant advance in worldwide efforts to control the spread of nuclear weaponsjust as, in a different way, was the signing a few days later of the FordBrezhnev treaty restricting peaceful nuclear explosions.

title: Forest Fire in California Is Raging Out of Control
description: KING CITY, Calif., May 31 (UPI)Nearly 1,100 firefighters fought today to head off an outofcontrol threeday blaze that burned 14,000 acres and threatened ranches and summer cabins in the Los Padres National Forest.

title: Turkey and Greece Decide To Resume Aegean Talks
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 31 (Reuters)Turkey and Greece have decided to resume talks on dividing the oil and mineral riches of the. Aegean Sea and rights to air corridors over it, the Turkish Foreign Ministry said today.

title: Bevacqua Sent Down
description: MILWAUKEE, May 31 Kurt Bevacqua, a utility player, indicated today he might not report to the Milwaukee Brewers Spokane farm club after he was assigned there as the Brewers called up Jimmy Rosario, the Pacific Coast's League's leading hitter, to fill his spot on the roster. Bevacqua, who played as a pinchrunner in the Brewers game yesterday with Cleveland, had only one hit in seven trips to the plate this year.

title: Market Place
description: The performance of the bestrun mutual funds over the last 10 years hardly inspires confidence. The most one can say is that the best mutual funds have consistently outperformed the stock market in recent years.

title: Indianapolis 500 Earnings Set Record of $1,037,775
description: INDIANAPOLIS,. May 31 (UPI)The Indianapolis Motor Speedway distributed a record $1,037,775 tonight to the participants in the rainshortened 500mile auto race, with the winner, Johnny Rutherford, getting $256,121.

title: Dance Festival Extended to Newport
description: A variety of newly formed dance companies will be among the attractions at the 29th annual American Dance Festival at Connecticut College in New London this summer. For the first time, the festival will sponsor an extra week in another localion. Newport, R.I.

title: 7 U.C.L.A. Coeds Burned
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31 (UPI)Seven coeds at the University of California, Los Angeles, have been burned with a sulfuric acid solution either placed on chairs or sprayed onto the women by an unseen attacker this school year.

title: 5 Die in California Crash
description: WATSONVILLE, Calif., May 1 31 (UPI)Five persons were killed today when a speeding car plunged upside down into a 10foot embankment and exploded in flames. The dead driver was identified as Renaldo Ramirez Vazquez, 19 years old, of Castroville, Calif.

title: Elocutionist, Hurt, Is Out of Belmont
description: Eugene Cashman's Elocutionist, the winner of last month's Preakness, will not run in Saturddy's Belmont Stakes.

description: Lost Playoff in 46 U.S. Open After 3Way Tie for LedPhs on Ryder Cup Team

title: Frazier Regrets Umpire Row
description: For a moment, a fleeting moment, the Mets thought they had rediscoveredor perhaps just plain discovered an offense yesterday.

title: The Surrogate Watch
description: The maneuvering has started in the regular and reform ranks of the Democratic Party in Manhattan and Brooklyn for the patronageladen posts of Surrogatethe specialized court with jurisdiction over estates. The prospect of appointing lucrative guardianships has traditionally motivated the political machines to capture that spot for one of their trusted judges who can then spread the largesse among the party faithful.

title: Advertising
description: Almost without exception the major agencies, feeling the pinch for qualified account executives because of reduced training programs in recent years, are back on campus recruiting this year.

title: Dwight Lowell Dumond Dead; Historian Wrote About Slavery
description: Dwight Lowell Dumond, professor emeritus of American history at the University of Michigan. who was best known for authoritative works on the history of slavery, died Sunday at his home in Ann Arbor. He was 80 years old:

title: Kosygin Arrives in Damascus on Mideast Tour
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 1Prime Minister Aleksei N. Kosygin arrived here from Iraq today on a mission apparently intended to shore up the Soviet Union's uncertain position in the Middle East.

title: National Gallery Party Conjures Jefferson Era
description: WASHINGTON, June 1They gave a party for Thomas Jefferson tonight at the National Gallery of Art, with a dinner that he might have eaten served at tables decorated with flowers that could have come from Monticello's gardens, and a fireworks display such as those he admired in Paris.

title: Two Drown Swimming River
description: SALISBURY, Md., June 1 (AP) James P. May, 30 years old, of Linkwood. Md., a patient at a halfway house for alcoholics, and Walter N. Long, 43, of Salisbury, drowned in an attempi to swim the 100foot wide. Wicomico. River today.

title: Steel Company of Canada Is Planning to Increase Prices of Bars
description: The Steel Company of Canada announced yesterday that it planned to raise its bar prices on June 28 by between S16 and $25 a ton, depending on quality. The increases range from 7 to 8 percent for merchant bars and up to 9 percent for alloy bars, industry sources in1 dictated.

title: 8 STUDENTS INJURED IN BRIDGEPORT FIGHT
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 1 A brawl with apparent racial overtones as classes were starting this morning at Central High School here resulted in injuries to eight white students and the arrest of three blacks, including two students who were suspended.

title: Moon Rally Draws 25,000, Half of Stadium Capacity
description: The Rev. Sun Myung Moon attracted 25.000 spectators to Yankee Stadium last night for a rally that his followers had predicted would fill the 54,000seat amphitheater to overflowing.

title: TUITION IMPOSED ATCITY 11.,ENDING A 129Y EAR POLICY; A 7TO1 APPROVAL. Kibbee Ordered to Set Fees Comparable With State U.'s
description: The New York City Board of Higher Education voted 7 to I last night to impose tuition at the City University next. fall. drawing the curtain on a unique era in American education.

title: Peking Says 2 Severe Quakes Struck in Yunnan on Saturday
description: TOKYO, June 1 (AP)Two severe earthquakes struck a western part of China's Yunnan Province on Saturday, the Peking radio reported today.

title: F.D.A.'s Integrity
description: The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has released a 500page report by a distinguished citizens panel which is essentially an analysis of an earlier 900page investigation by the Commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration into allegations of undue drug industry influence in the F.D.A.. The allegations were made in Senate hearings which began in August 1974. Now, 1,400 pages and 21 months later, H.E.W. has still not dealt effectively with the central issue raised in the hearings: the extent of the influence exercised by the drug industry in forcing approvals of new drugs.

title: Preparing Those Gossamer Ovals, Quenelles of Fish
description: There is one anecdote that invariably comes to mind whenever we think of or dine on quenelles of pike, shrimp or whatever. Quenelles are, of course, one of the greatest inventions of French chefdomgossamer, lighterthanair if properly made ovals of fish, seafood meat or poultry, delicately seasoned, poached briefly and served with any of a number of sauces.

title: TV: An Interesting Look at the Pennsylvania Ballet
description: The first season of WNET/13's Dance in America series is concluded this evening at 9 with a documentary portrait of the Pennsylvania Ballet. Excerpts from the company's repertory are mixed with interviews, glimpses of rehearsal classes and a rather detailed history of dancing in Pennsylvania, based on the theory that the history of American dancing is rooted there. That theory is, at the very least, arguable.

title: Israeli Family From Iraq Is Said to Return Home
description: TEL AVIV, June 1 (AP)An Iraqiborn Jewish family has returned to Baghdad after 25 years in Israel, a newspaper here reported today.

title: BOX Scores of Major League Games and Standings
Cunningham Takes A Leave of Absence
description: Patrick J. Cunningham took a leave of absence as Democratic state chairman yesterday until charges of bribery, conspiracy and tampering with evidence that had been brought against him are disposed of.

title: Sri Lanka Chief Renamed
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, June (AP)Prime Minister Sirimavo Bandaranaike has nominated William Gopallawa to another fouryear term as Sri Lanka's President, the Government announced today. Mr. Gopallawa, 78 years old, represented Queen Elizabeth II as Governor General from 1962 to 1972 and then became the first President of the nation, formerly called Ceylon. under the republican Constitution.

title: About Education
description: A new report on The States and Higher Education takes exception with the commonly held view that families have been assuming increasingly heavier burdens in sending their young people to college.

title: FEDERAL JOBS BAN FOR ALIENS UPSET
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Striking down a nearly 100yearold Government practice, the Supreme Court ruled 5 to 4 today that the Civil .Service Commission may not bar resident aliens from Federal Civil Service lobs.

title: William Tarrasch, 75, Dies; Conductor and Teacher
description: William Tarrasch, a conductor and music teacher, died Sunday in the De Witt Nursing Home, 211 East 79th Street. He was 75 years old and lived here.

title: YOUTH IS ARRESTED IN BROOKLYN KILLING
description: An 18yearold Brooklyn youth was arrested in the fatal beating of a 22yearold follower of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon.

title: CARTER IS VICTOR IN SOUTH DAKOTA; REAGAN LEADING; In Rhode Island, Ford Wins and Brown Registers a Psychological Triumph
description: Jimmy Carter won the South Dakota primary yesterday. In Rhode Island. Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California scored a psychological victory when the uncommitted slate for which he stumped finished first, while Mr. Carter appeared to have won the largest share of the state's delegates.

title: Pennsylvania Plans $100 Million in Aid For New VW Plant
description: The state of Pennsylvania and various agencies will provide nearly $100 million in loans and grants to help Volkswagen begin operations at the New Stanton assembly plant. Gov. Milton J. Shapp announced yesterday.

title: 442 Died in Car Crashes Over Memorial Holiday
description: CHICAGO, June 1 (AP)Traffic crashes across the nation during the Memorial Day weekend took 442 livs, exceeding the estimate of the National Safety Council.

title: Carter and Audiences
description: LOS ANGELES, June 1In a carefully prepared and ended! speech last week in Ohled Jimmy Carter said he had come a long way in the last 16 months but that his was still the same campaign he began with. What we learned from thousands and thousands of people, the former Georgia Governor said, we gave back to them in a political program that reflected what they wanted, not what we wanted for them.

title: Kissinger and Simon Irked By Rebuff at Trade Parley
description: WASHINGTON, JuneThe Secretaries of State and the Treasury expressed annoyance today at the lastminute rejection by the United Nations Cortference on Trade and Development in Nairobi, Kenya, of the United States proposal for a new international resources bank.

title: Monday's Fight
description: SEOUL. KoreaHong SooHwan, South Korea, outpointed Venice Borkorsor, Thailand, 12 rounds, bantamweights.

title: Food Prices Rise Slightly
description: Fewer meat specials and sales in food stores throughout the city pushed gracery prices up again last week, the Department of Consumer Affairs announced. vv.! cost of a market basket of food went from S70.92 for the week ending May 21 to $71 for the same groceries purchased during the week ends ing May 28. That represented a 0.1 percent increase.

title: People and Business
description: The directors of the New York Stock Exchange will be asked tomorrow, in keeping with a newly formulated exchange policy of stressing competition, to consider a plan to make it easier for outsiders to do business on the stock exchange.

title: Convicted Man to Be a Police Hero
description: A 23yearold Bronx man convicted of possessing Molotov cocktails and shooting a drug pusher and facing charges next week of possession of marijuana is to be honored soon by the Police Department.

title: Bomb Is Exploded At Pymouth Rock With Little Damage
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., June 1 A bomb exploded at the Plymouth Rock Shrine late tonight, but the police said that the monument to the Pilgrim landing in 1620 had not been damaged.

title: Steel Production, Up 1.1% in Week, Reaches a'76 Peak
description: Steel production continued to rise and, in the week ended May 29, hit its highest level for the year to date, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Europe's Socialists Put Off Parley Again
description: PARIS. June 1  European Socialists, bogged down in quarrels stemming from the issue of whether to cooperate with Communists, have again postponed their longdelayed international congress scheduled for this summer

title: Funding Legal Services
description: The nation's commitment to law and order is to be tested soon in a Senate appropriations subcommittee as it considers what might otherwise appear to be a routine money bill. The measure is the appropriation bill for the new Legal Services Corporation, which is attempting to rescue the program from its present stagnation.

title: Japan's Reserves Climb
description: TOKYO, June 1 (UPI)  Japan's foreign exchange reserves totaled $15.21 billion at the end of May, up $273 million from a month ago, the Finance Ministry announced today.

title: Colombian Rail Travel Up
description: BOGOTA, Colombia (UPI)Morepeople traveled by train in Colombia in 1975 than the previous year. The number of passengers on the national railI roads increased by 610,142 or 13 percent, the number of passengermiles increased 10 percent and rail income rose by 29.5 percent, according to the annual report of the stated company.

title: Backlogging
description: There never has been a greater need for professionally. trained American historians than today, and never has there been a time when so many historians were seeking employment.

title: Doctors and Hospitals Enter Insurance Field in Michigan
description: DETROIT, June 1 (AP) Michigan's doctors and hospitals, abandoned by commercial insurers, have announced that they are entering the insurance field themselves to provide pro tection against malpractice suits.

title: Two Cookbooks: Simple, And Sophisticated, Too
description: THE TASTE OF COUNTRY COOKING. By Edna Lewis. 256 pages. Knopf. $10 hardcover: $4.95 paperback.

title: Cgrty's .336 Keeps Lead Among DH's
description: Despite a .440 splurge by Billy Williams of the Oakland A's, Rico Carty of the Cleveland Indians continues to hold a commanding lead in the batting race among the:American League's designated hitters.

title: INDICTMENT LISTS 7 OIL COMPANIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) Seven ,independent oil companies were indicted. today on Federal charges of illegally fixing the price of gasoline they sell in Middle Atlantic states.

title: Politics And Policy
description: WASHINGTON, June 1President Ford and his principal aides are acting with increasing confidence that he can defeat former Gov. Ronald Reagan for the Presidential nomination, and go on to win the election in November.

title: Poll Shows Blacks Decisive for Carter In Lead Over Ford
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The major reason that Jimmy Car ter appears to be leading President Ford as the choice of the electorate at this point is the former Georgia Governor's overwhelming support among blacks, This conclusion, drawn from the latest national political survey conducted by The New York Times and CBS News, suggest that the black vote would be pivotal if the election for President were held today between President Ford and Mr. Carter. The Georgian was chosen by blacks in the survey by more than 5 to I.

title: Cunningham Takes A Leave of Absence
description: Patrick J. Cunningham took a leave of absence as Democratic state chairman yesterday until charges of bribery, conspiracy and tam pering with evidence that had been brought against him are disposed of.

title: Man Is Found. Wounded On Sidewalk in Queens
description: A man was found yesterday lying on a sidewalk in Elmhurst, Queens, with a bullet wound in his abdomen and with one of his fingers cut off.

title: NORTHEAST LAGGING IN NASA CONTRACTS
description: BOSTON, June 1 (AP)New ngland and the rest of the ???ortheast receive considerably less procurement funding from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration than the Sunbelt states, according to Library of Congress study.

title: Food Plant Is Struck
description: NORTH EAST, Pa., June (AP)About 340 teamsters' union members struck early today at the Welsh Food plant in this Erie County community.

title: Many Blacks Are Living In Dual World of Conflict
description: MEMPHISDedrick (Teddy) Withers was elected to the Tennessee House of Representatives in the fall of 1974, defeating a powerful, twoterm white incumbent and becoming, at 22, the second youngest representative in the history of the state.

title: Stage: Black Sisterhood Ntozake Shange's Tor Colored Girls Opens at Papp's Anspacher Theater
description: Black sisterhood. That is what Ntozake Shange's totally extraordinary and wonderful evening at Joseph Papp's Anspacher Theater, in the Lafayette Street Public Theater complex, is all about. It has those insights into life and that maks the theater such an incredible marketplace for the soul. And simply because it is about black womennot just blacks and not just womenit is very humbling but inspiring thing for a white man to experience.

title: Students Offer Some Convention Wisdom
description: New York isn't all fun and games, there's also politics.

description: It was Jack Nicklaus's intention to build a golf course where the world's best players have to work hard to score. He succeeded when he built the Muirfield Village

description: Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California spent a busy day in New York City yesterday seeking support for a beyondthe  first ballot Presidential, nomination at the Democratic National Convention here in Ju1 Iv.

Mr. Wise has campaigned since he was 15 for Gov. Carter. Above, workers for Morris K. Udall stuff envelopes at the home of Mary Farrell in Teaneck.

title: British Pound Sinks to New Low of $1.75
description: LONDON, Mule 1 (AP)The British pound today sank to $1.17543, a new low, while the Swiss franc continued a strong advance and the dollar had a mixed showing on European currency markets.

title: POLISH TEPLIKA CONVEYS MISERY
description: Out of his five years in German concentration camps, the Polish theater man Jozef Szaina has composed a series of choreographed vignettes that he has entitled Replika and which! was presented last night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music by the Slavic Cultural Center.

title: Man Killed in Tel Aviv Blast Identified by West Germans
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, June 1 (AP)West Germany's Federal Criminal Office said today it had identified the dead man whose suitcase bomb caused two deaths in a Tel Aviv airport explosion a week ago as a 25yearold West German, Ternd Hausmann.

title: Bank of Israel Chief Asks For Cuts in Most Spending
description: JERUSALEM, June 1 (Reu ters)The governor of the Bank of Israel has called for cuts in all spending except defense because of Israel's desperate economic situation.

title: N.H.L., Too, Besieged by Free Agents
description: Almost 15 percent of the National Hockey League players became free agents yesterday.

title: Times Co. Agrees to Sell 8 Magazines,
description: The New York Times Company said yesterday that it had agreed in principle to sell its group of professional magazines, headed by Modern Medicine, to Harcourt Brace Jovanovich Inc., a publishing concern. The terms of the cash transaction were not disclosed.

description: BASEBALL

description: PORTLAND, Ore., (UPI)The United Methodist General Conference, the church's highest governing body, has issued a call for a broad and unconditional amnesty for Vietnam war resisters.
