description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 2Ronald Reagan said today that Federal intervention in the classroom was responsible for much of the nation's educational deficiencies and he promised that if elected, President, he would issue instructions to Federal departments to get off the back of local school boards.

title: Martha Schlamme At Reno Sweeney With Alvin Epstein
description: Although women have been most prominent in performances of the Kurt WeillBertolt Brecht repertory and Martha Schlamme has been one of the most successful, Miss Schlamme's current partner at Reno Sweeney, Alvin Epstein, is striking a solid blow for male interpretations of these songs.

title: Dollar Oft In Europe
description: BRUSSELS, June 2 (UPI)The dollar lost some of its; recent gains on European markets yesterday and remained at a 16month low in Zurich.

title: ARNOLD I. GOLDBERG
description: Arnold I. Goldberg, a lawyer, died Tuesday in Danbury, (Conn.) Hospital. He was 53 years old and lived at 455 East. 57th Street.

title: Medley to Molloy
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., June 2 Archbishop Molloy finished first last night in the distance medley at the sixth annual Suffolk Officials relays. Molloy's Don Cotter (3 minutes 29 seconds), Joe Burke (55.0), Dennis Averill (1:54.7) and Frank Averill (4:00.7) won the 3,000meter event in 10 minutes 15.7 seconds. Other relay winners were Xaverian, 400meter hurdles (1:00.5); Chaminade, 3,200 meters (7:50.2); John Bowne, 800 meters (1:30.2); Great Neck South, 400 meters (0:45.6) and East New York, 1,600 meters (3:23.2).

title: The Quiet Comeback of Joe Torre
description: Joe Torre remembers his embarrassment last season when strangers, out of politeness or ignorance, told him what a good lob he was doing for the New York Mets. I couldn't, he recalls, even say thank you.

title: MORE CITY U. AID BARRED BY BEAME
description: ALBANY, June 2Mayor Beame today rejected a call by Governor Carey for the city to increase its planned support for the City University in 1977.

title: The New York Times/Edward Hausner AT WEST POINT GRADUATION, Cadet William Andersen, wearing cap, is congratulated by his classmen. Himself chairman of the cadet honor committee, Cadet Andersen has been accused of having violated honor code. Page
description: The cheating scandal that has rocked the United States Military Academy at West Point, prompting renewea calls for a modification of the tough cadet honor code, has produced, divergent reactions at the nation's two other major service academies.

title: Cunningham Recedes
description: With six weeks to go before the Democratic National Convention in Madison Square Garden, reality has turned into actuality for Patrick J. Cunningham of the Bronx. By taking a leave of absence as New York State Democratic Party chairman, he has effectively removed himself as a major power at the conventionand, at the same time, been removed as a symbolic albatross around the Empire State's delegation.

title: When Peacocks Quack
description: WASHINGTONThis city is tired, worn out in a way that is peculiar to its unique life cycle. For 1976 is Year Eightthe Year of the Lame Duck. We have so far been spared the doctoral theses and learned monographs on this phenomenon, but it exists, just like the stages of human growth.

title: Killing Is Common in Lewisburg Federal Prison, Freed Inmate Says
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 2 (AP) Francis Marziani, a former inmate at Lewisburg Federal prison who said he feared for his life because of evidence on inmate violence he gave to guards, was set free yesterday.

title: Yankees Defeat Red Sox by 72 As Figueroa Hurls FourHitter
description: BOSTON, June 2  The Boston Red Sox lay down, rolled over and played dead again tonight. And the New York Yankees, patting them gently and saying, Nice boy, tucked away their second straight victory, 72, in suddenly friendly Fenway.

title: Jersey Hospital Affirms Its Policy Regarding the Care of Karen Anne Quinlan
description: The attending physicians for Karen Anne Quinlan and officials of St. Clare's Hospital in Denville, N.J., broke their silence yesterday to say that prevailing medical practice and moral constraints would continue to dictate the level of care being given to the comatose woman.

title: CHEMICAL PRICE LIST RAISED BY CELANESE,
description: The Celanese Chemical Company announced yesterday price increases on several organic chemical products, effective July 1.

title: Drill Instructors Suspended
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) A Marine spokesman said today that a team of four drill instructors at the Parris Island camp had been suspended in investigation of an incident involving a recruit who was hospitalized with stomach injuries.

title: Mrs. McCormack Scores Repeated Visits to States
description: LOS ANGELES, June 2 (AP)The New York woman running for President on the antiabortion issue contends that other candidates insult th evoters inelligence by making repeated visits to states.

title: FORGERY STUDIED IN ENERGY MEMO
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 The Federal Bureau of Investigation has been looking into the apparent forgery within the Federal Energy Administration of a document that purports to urge stronger advocacy to the public of deregulation of natural gas prices.

title: Local School Election Results In Nassau and Suffolk Counties
description: Following are the results of local school elections in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: Vitas Takes Paris Match
description: PARIS, June 2The idea of the first round, the name players say, is to take it easy, play just hard enough to survive and save the big exertion for the end. The French open tennis championship is a long, tiring affair.

title: 8 RECEIVE HONORS OF PARKS COUNCIL
description: The Parks Council, a citizen watchdog group concerned with the city's open spaces, announced an annual award and seven citations yesterday for, community service.

title: 6Man U. S. Senate Race Gets Hotter as Primary Day Nears
description: TRENTON, JUNE 2Six candidates in the Democratic and Republican primaries next Tuesday stepped up their drives today for the United States Senate nominations.

title: New York Phone Seeking Rate Rise As Wages Increase
description: The New York Telephone Company asked the Public Service Commission yesterday for a $46.9 million rate increase to cover the cost of a 1976 wage increase for its employees.

title: House Approves New Aid Bill, Refuses to Limit Funds to Seoul
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The House of Representatives approved a new foreignaid bill today and refused by a decisive vote to put limits on American assistance to South Korea for its repressive policies.

title: CALLER CLAIMS ROLE IN PLYMOUTH BLAST
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., June 2 (AP)The Boston Globe reporti ed today that it had received a call from a man claiming responsibility for an explosion, last night at Plymouth Rock.

title: Pound Drops to $1.72 In one of its sharpest oneday declines in a yearlong descent, the British pound plunged to $1.72 in London yesterday, losing 31/2 cents of its value against the dollar. Page 55.
description: LONDON, June 2  The British pound tumbled to $1.72 here today in one of the sharpest oneday declines in a yearlong descent, and a worried Government seemed powerless to do anything about it.

title: Proposal for Border Talks Rejected by Greek Cypriots
description: NICOSIA. Cyprus. June 2 (Reuters)The Greek Cypriots have formally rejected Turkish Cypriot proposals made a week ago for talks on drawing a boundary between the two sides.

title: Indecisive Round
description: The primaries in Rhode Island, South Dakota and Montana produced indecisive results in both the Democratic and Republican Presidential contests.

title: Goals of Students At Hebrew Union Undergo Change
description: At graduation ceremonies for the three branches of Hebrew Union College Jewish Institute of Religion this year, the Hebrew names of the graduates were printed on the program as usual. But in a departure from custom, most of the candidates listed themselves as the offspring of both mother and father, instead of the conventional reference to father alone.

title: O'Neill Bids Hays Give Up His House Chairmanships,
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Representative Thomas P. O'Neil, majority leader of the House, demanded today that Representative Wayne L. Hays give up his key committee chairmanships temporarily, pending the outcome of Federal investigations of his activities.

title: CITY COUNCIL PANEL FAILSTOGET QUORUM
description: The Rules. Privileges and Elections Committee of the New York City Council met briefly yesterday to consider 16 rule changes, but adjourned without acting after it could not get a quorum. Seven members of the 14member committee gathered at 250 Broadway at 10 A.M., ready to act on the rule changes.

title: After Tuition
description: In 1847, when the Free Academy of New York, later to become City College, was founded, its prospectus promised to let the children of the rich and the poor take their seats together and know of no distinctions save that of industry, good conduct and intellect. language as in principle, the statement reflected the optimism of Horace Mann and his belief that education beyond all other devices of human origin, is the great equalizer of the conditions of menthe balancewheel of the social machinery.

title: CANADA ATTACKS SHORTAGE OF JOBS
description: OTTAWA, June 2The Canadian Government today announced a broad attack on unemployment, including measures to reduce abuses of the unemployment compensation system and to create incentives to work.

title: Ford to Woo the Uncommitted Convention Delegates
description: WASHINGTON, June 2President Ford, acting on the assumption that Ronald Reagan will win the California primary next Tuesday, is preparing a major effort to obtain the support of uncommitted delegates to the Republican National Convention.

title: Sheriff Is Acquitted
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., June 2 (AP)  Sheriff Malcolm Mayo, the first person impeached in Vermont in nearly two centuries, won acquittal today on all charges of maladministration when the Senate rejected a final House article by a margin, of two votes. Unconvinced that Mr. Mayo had acted in his official capacity in three barroom incidents, the Senate voted, 18 to 12, to acquit him on a charge of breach of duty as a peace officer.

title: A Girl May Move to Keep Her Dog
description: To 16yearold Margaret Thompson, a fox terrier called Star is more than a best friend.

title: U.S. FlowerBox Campaign Begins
description: A national campaign to beautify the country's streets with flower boxes for the Bicentennial began yesterday at the Columbia Grammar School in Manhattan.

title: Arilona Reporter Hurt Badly By a Bomb Under Car's Floor
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., June 2 (AP) Don Bolles, 42 years old, an investigative reporter for The Arizona Republic, was critically injured today when a bomb exploded in his car, the police said.

title: Montoya Wins 2 to 1
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., June 2 (AP)Senator Joseph M. Montoya won yesterday the Democratic nomination for a third sixyear term by a 2tomargin over Robert R. Sims. In November, he will face Harrison Schmitt, a former astronaut who easily won the Republican Senate primary.

title: Cancer Agency Amassing Clues on Disparity of the Disease in Various Regions of the World
description: LYONS. France, June 1A medical detective story of great potential importance in the fight against cancer is slowly unfolding, but while a mass of clues have been assembled, the final chapter remains to be written.

title: RICKOVER CHARGED BY CONTRACTS CHIEF
description: WASHLNGTON, June 2 (Reuters)Adm. Hyman Rickover, the man credited with introducing the nuclear submarine, was accused of insubordination by the Navy's civilian chief of contracts.

title: Oglivie, Horton Help Tigers to 4th in Row
description: Ben Oglivie, a pinchhitter, and Willie Horton, the designated hitter, supplied the batting power that carried the Detroit Tigers to their fourth straight victory, a 64 decision ever Milwaukee in Tiger Stadium last night.

title: Fireman Killed in Crash
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 2 (AP)Two fire trucks responding to a false alarm collided at an intersection here, killing one fireman and injuring six others. Fireman Joe E. Tarwater, 37 years old, died after he was catapulted through a fire truck windshield yesterday, said Clyde Parker, a deputy fire chief.

title: Syrian Troops Halt Drive In Lebanon East of Capital
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2Syrian troops who moved into eastern Lebanon yesterday stayed today in the positions they had reached.

title: Pound Drops to $1.72
description: In one of its sharpest oneday declines in a yearlong descent, the British pound plunged to $1.72 in London yesterday, losing 3 cents of its value, against the dollar. Page 55.

title: Ye Olde Apothecaries Offer Soothing Aids
description: New York is a city frequently accused of callousness toward Its past. Go away for a few days and when you come backit sometimes seems a building, store or restaurant long accepted as an unofficial neighborhood landmark has vanished, years before its time.

title: SovietU.S. Arms Parley In Geneva Ends Its Recess.
description: GENEVA, June 2The United. States and the Soviet Union resumed today their attempt to reach agreements expanding their 1972 accords that curb their arsenals of strategic nuclear weapons.

title: I.L.O. TALKS OPEN IN A BITTER MOOD
description: GENEVA, June 2The manual conference of the International Labor Organization opened today in an atmosphere of such political bitterness that a newly elected chairman, Labor Ministe Michael O'Leary of Ireland, warned that he might be presiding over the breakup of the organization.

title: Ethiopia,18 Months After Coup, Is in Turmoil
description: ADDIS. ABABA, Ethiopia, May 28More than 18 months after a group of radical soldiers deposed Emperor Haile Selassie, Ethiopia is in the grip of a political and social upheaval that has left it sliding into economic disarray, armed repression and a mood of disillusion and fear.

title: CENTRAL BANK AID IN EUROPE CLIMBED
description: Central bank intervention in the European currency markets swelled to massive pi portions earlier this year amid widespread fears of major readjustments in currency values the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: L.I. Youth Dies in Crash
description: DIX HILLS, L.I., June 2 (AP) A 16yearold Long Island youth was killed about midnight today when his car failed to make a turn and crashed into a tree. The youth, Brian A. Brent, of Dix Hills, was pronounced dead at the scene on Melrose Road at Carmen Drive.

title: Giants Start Orientation Week And Their No. 1 Rookie Feels It
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., June 2The Giants bill it Orientation Week, a pretraining camp. But today, in the little valley they use as a football practice field, it looked and sounded like fulldress rehearsals.

title: Las Palmas Man Kidnapped
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands, June 2 (AP)  Masked gunmen believed to be part of an independence movement in the Spanish Canary Islands kidnapped an industrialist today and demanded a $900,000 ransom. Eufemiano Fuentes, 65, was abducted from his bedroom in predawn darkness. The police declined to provide details or speculate on a political motive.

title: MUNICIPAL UNION TOED TO TAKE CUT
description: City Hall began negotiations with its largest employee union yesterday and demanded more work for less pay, while the union asked for higher wages and costofliving increases.

title: Ford Gives PBS $1 Million for News
description: The Ford Foundation announced yesterday that it would make a new grant of $1 million to the Public Broadcasting Service to be used exclusively for the production of news documentaries and publicaffairs programs next season.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Syrian troops stayed in the positions short of Beirut they took up Tuesday as Palestinian and Lebanese Moslems reiterated that their troops would resist any advance in that direction. For the first time in Lebanon's 14month civil war, a meeting of two leaders of the opposing factionsKamal Jumblat of the leftistMoslem alliance and Pierre Gemayel, son of the leader of the rightwing Christian military and political organization was publicly announced. It was arranged by a leader of Al Fatah, the main guerrilla group of the Palestine Liberation Organization. Page 1, Columns 12.1

title: Goals of Students At Hebrew Union Undergo Change
description: At graduation ceremonies for the three branches of Hebrew Union College Jewish Institute of Religion this year, the Hebrew names of the graduates were printed on the program as usual. But in a departure from custom, most of the candidates listed themselves as the offspring of both mother and father, instead of the conventional reference to father alone.

title: At the Movies
description: NOT far from the San Andreas Fault, where the earth bulges up inch by inch and scientists talk insistently about a coming earthquake, Carl Foreman is typing up his initial notes for The Day the World Ended.

title: Donald Feitel, Executive Of News Feature Service
description: Donald G. Feitel, editorial director of Metropolitan Sun day Newspapers Inc., died of cancer yesterday at his home in Pelham Manor, N.Y. He was 50 years old.

title: Alfredo's Hand Is A Winner at Settebello
description: To old Village hands, this site is still remembered as Nick's, while to parvenus of the last 15 years it is better known as Your Father's Mustache. But both names are about to be eclipsed by the latest incarnation: Alfredo's Settebello, the newly opened restaurantcabaret at 125 Seventh Avenue South, corner of 10th Street.

title: Lexington Avenue Mall Being Planned as a U.N. of Food
description: Les Halles closes, George Lang said yesterday over a lunch of thick ricotta, green chili peppers, strawberries and espresso. The Market opens.

title: Pound Falls to $1.71 Despite Support Buying
description: LONDON. JUNE 3 (UPI)The British pound battered by a new selling wave on world money markets, dropped 21 cents today to a low of $1.70 before it recovered a bit to close at $1.71125.

title: Picasso's Art by Picasso Is Valued at $260 Million
description: PARIS, June 3Pablo Picasso's collection of his own works, among them 1,185 paintings, has been valued by experts after more than a year's study at 5260 million.

title: Lexington Avenue Mall Being Planned as a U.N. of Food
description: Les Halles closes, George Lang said yesterday over lunch of thick ricotta, green chili peppers, strawberries and espresso. The Market opens.

title: Raquel Welch Stylish at Fair
description: Raquel Welch, who is appearing at the Westbury Music Fair through Sunday, seems to have contracted the Boogie Fever. Her new act begins with the Sylvers hit of the same name, and a number of her other selections are arranged to simulate black pop or disco music.

title: Man Who Saved Child On Tracks Gets Medal
description: The Carnegie Medal for heroism and $1,000 in cash from the Carnegie Fund were presented yesterday to a Manhattan man who leaped to the tracks to save a 4yearold girl last year.

title: Heinsohn Cries Foul Over Officiating as Celtics, Suns Brace for Game Tonight
description: PHOENIX. June 3Tom Heinsohn, the coach of the Boston Celtics, thinks he knows who the key men were in his team's two losses to Phoenix here that enabled the SUM to tie the National Basketball Association championship series at two games apiece.

title: 10 Dancers Who Light the Stage
description: In the course of a year an amazingly large proportion of the world's finest dancers perform in New York. Some of them are superstars, some of them practically unknown  but they all have a certain following which can be just as fervent, and almost as vocal, if far smaller, than that of a Nureyev or Baryshnikov. The dancers come from many and different disciplines; some are moderndancers, but probably most, if only because their companies are so much larger, tend to be classic.

title: Play About Casement
description: The Riverdale Contemporary Theater will present Sir Roger Casement, Traitor, a new play by George Hickenlooper, today and tomorrow, at the Riverdale Neighborhood House, 5521 Mosholu Parkway, the Bronx, at 8:30 P.M. Sidney Green directed a cast that includes Frank Copeland, Susan Habachy, Jeffrey J. Wallach and Philip Meranus.

title: Hasbrouck Hts. Fights Dump
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS. N. J.Not since a hometown boy. Arthur Godfrey, buzzed the Teterboro Airport control tower in his private plane. Nol since the funeral of mobster Willie Moretti drew hordes to Corpus Christi Church. Not since the borough outmaneuvered the State Highway Department.

title: Tuna Fishermen Win Delay
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals here is allowing fisherMen to continue catching porpoises in their nets while the ledgality of the method, which kills many porpoises, is tested in court. Three appellate judges agreed after hearing oral arguMents yesterday to delay the effect of an order Federal Disltict. Judge Charles R. Richey issued May 11 giving the fishermen until May 31 to halt the practice.

title: Purtzer, 24, Stuns Field, Leads at 65
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 3 (AP)Tom Purtzer, playing his first year on the American pro golf circuit, shot a sixunderpar 65, surged past a surprised Masters chainpion, Ray Floyd, and established a twostroke lead today in the first round of the $200,000 Bicentennial Classic, formerly known as the Philadelphia Classic.

title: Carey, at Opening, Recalls Other 76
description: The big barge was greeted at South Street yesterday afternoon with dedicatory ceremonies, including speeches, music and other appropriate fanfare.

title: Merged Union's Head
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 Murray Howard Finley, president of the newly merged Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union, is a stocky, darkhaired man with an intense manner and a dedicated trade union attitude. He is representative of a new generation of labor union leaders: young er at 54, formally educated, with a law degree, well seasoned in union administration, politically aware and active, aggressive and militant.

title: Weekend Events Shoreside
description: To celebrate the barge's arrival, the Seaport has scheduled a number of activities:

title: Events and Openings
description: THE CRUSADERS and GEORGE BENSON, jazz. Carnegie Hall, 8 and 11:30.

title: Ford Plans to Join Parley In Puerto Rico June 2728
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 President Ford announced offi cially today that he would join in an economic meeting with the leaders of six other major industrialized nations this month, to chart a course that will keep the recovery moving forward at a healthy, sustained pace.

title: Frenchification of Industry
description: PARISThere is a new word in FranceFrancisation. It means Frenchification of industry.

title: POLL SHOWS REAGAN AND BROWN GAINING
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3The hometown candidates, former Gov. Ronald Reagan, a Republican, and Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr., a Democrat, have strengthened their leads as the June 8 California Presidential primary nears, according to a poll released today.

title: Bill to Let Cities Restrict Beaches Gains in Albany
description: ALBANY, June 3The New York Senate passed a bill today giving cities the authority to adopt and enforce rules for the use of beaches within their jurisdiction.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: At 10:30 tonight, Channel 50 is offering something new with Mark of Jazz, a series of half hours produced by station WHYY in Philadelphia. The productions are modest (i.e., lowbudgeted) but rewarding (i.e., good talent). One featuring Chris Connor simply leaves the singer and her firstrate backup music trio to several very effective numbers, from the latest in pop to a Cole Porter medley. The series began with Maynard Ferguson. It includes Mabel Mercer. Tonight's guest is Ramsay Lewis. The mix, obviously, is odd, but the results are very pleasant.

title: Susan Watson, Ingenue, Solos
description: If Barbara Cook could turn successfully to nightclubs after a long career as a Broadway musical ingenue, why not Susan Watson, who succeeded Miss Cook as a perpetual Broadway ingenue? Startinz with Bye Bye Birdie in 1960, Miss Watson sang and smiled her way through a long string of musicals, including Carnival, Ben Franklin in Paris, Carousel, Oklahoma!, Celebration and most recently, No, No, Nanette.

title: B. P. PROFIT DOWN 61.9% IN QUARTER
Harnum Takes Old Job
description: SELINSGROVE, Pa., June 3 (AP)Dan Harnum was named basketball coach at Susquehanna University today, a position he held five years ago. Harnum resigned as basketball coach at the University of Delaware to return to Susquehanna, where he compiled a 2323 wonlost record over two seasons, 196971. Harnum had a 6957 record in five seasons at Delaware.

title: White House Aide Accuses A. T. & T. On Lobbying Drive
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The acting director of the White House office of telecommunications policy accused the Bell Telephone System today of trying to push Congress into passing what he said was a deceptively labeled communications, bill based on a premise of sheer folly.

title: NEW UNION AIMS AT J. P. STEVENS CO.
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The newly constituted Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union set as its first major goal today the organization of 44,000 employees of J. P. Stevens & Company, the giant Southern textile chain.

title: Bridge
description: One of the world's most famous bridge clubs moved to a new home earlier this week. The Mayfair, which was long the preserve of the late Harry Fishbein, has been transferred by its present proprietor, Alvin Roth, to 220 East 57th Street, where he has provided luxurious accommodations for bridge and backgammon on a membership basis. He promises a series of activities tailormade for the requirements of his members.

title: West Indies Leads England in Cricket
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 3 (Reuters)The West Indies batsmen dispelled any thoughts today they might still be shellshocked following their 51 series defeat in Australia, by hammering 274 for two against England. It was the opening day of the first cricket test at Trent Bridge.

title: Alton A. Lessard Is Dead; Headed Democrats in Maine
description: FALMOUTH, Me., June 3Alton A. Lessard, a retired Superior Court justice who was one of the architects in the rejuvenation of the Democratic Party in Maine, died in his sleep here early today. He was 66 years old.

title: Sculpture Show Set in Greenwich
description: An outdoor exhibition of sculpture by prominent American artists will go on view tomorrow in Greenwich, Conn. Alexander Calder, Claes Oldenburg, Willem de Kooning and Tony Smith are among those whose works will be displayed in the parks and plazas of the town through October.

title: Who's Afraid of Bold Forbes? 11 Entered in Belmont Stakes
description: Angel Cordero wrapped up the disbelief in one word of Spanish yesterday when Laz Barrera told him how many horses had been entered for tomorrow's 108th Belmont Stakes.

title: Opera: Macbeth A la Caldwell
description: VERDI'S Macbeth received the inimitable Sarah Caldwell touch Wednesday night in the Opera Company of Boston's final production of the season. Miss Caidwell's staging of the 1865 revised version of the opera was full of her customary vivid theatrical ideas, some of them strong and effective, others arbitrary and infuriating.

title: Past and Present Meet in Murray Hill Celebration
description: What is perhaps the finest sort of Bicentennial celebrationa mixture of contemporary block party and remembrances of Murray Hill and its brief, somewhat spicy moment in Revolutionary War historywill take place tomorrow along 35th Street between Madison and Lexington Avenues.

title: Purchase To Hold Rustic Fair
description: Purchase, N.Y., an affluent Westchester community that has been fighting a running battle with urbanization, will invoke the memory of a more rustic past tomorrow when it holds its annual country fair, a 30year tradition. Fair time is from 11 A.M. to 5 P.M.

title: 8 Goyas, From Death to Desire, at Met
description: As a Bicentennial tribute to this country from Spain, eight paintings by Goya will go on view starting Sunday (through Aug. 7) at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Loft Jazz Goes on a ThreeDay Toot
description: THE SHORTEST and least expensive jazz festival the seasonand one of the most actionpackedbegins tonight at four performing lofts in downtown Manhattan.

title: The Heavyweights. Return and the City Recaptures a Glow
description: Under the Shubert Alley marquee of A Chorus Line. where thinner men prance every night, Joe Frazier brought boxing back to Broadway yesterday.

title: RHODESIA REMARK IS DOGGING REAGAN
description: MONTEREY, Calif., June 3Ronald Reagan spent much of today attempting to extricate himself from a minor furor over what he called misrepresentation of a hypothetical answer that as President he would, under some circumstances, send United States troops to Rhodesia.

title: HUMPHREY READY IF CARTER FALTERS
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., June Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said today that it Jimmy Carter stumbled badly in next Tuesday's three Presidential primaries, Mr. Humphrey would probably begin active pursuit of the Democratic nomination.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A strike in Canada yesterday dosed all but one of the smelter operations of Alcan Aluminium Ltd., the world's second largest producer of aluminum.

title: Garbage Executive Slain by Gunman In Midtown Garage
description: A 46yearold owner of a New Jersey garbage collecting company was shot to death in a midtown Manhattan parking garage yesterday in what the police called the apparent work of a professional gunman.

title: Fluke Are the Prevailing Catch For Anglers in Nearby Waters
description: AREAA  Fluke is the main catch in the waters off Point Pleasant, N. J., where Dan Zisa hauled in 13 goodsized fish this week aboard the Norma K. III. On Barnegat Ridge, fluke as large as 4 pounds have been taken with squid and smelt. Occasional bluefish and sea bass of varying sizes are being taken at Long Beach Island where John Falkiewicz reports a lack of action because of a bait strike.

title: Mercantile Market, Under Fire, Offers New Potato Futures Plan
description: The beleaguered New York Mercantile Exchange has drawn up and submitted to the Commodities Futures Trading Commission a new and broadened proposed potato futures contract that the regulatory agency had demanded.

title: Weekend Gardening
description: For years I shied away from the gladiolus. It always reminded me of hospitals. But the very factors that make the gladiolus such a popular component of getwell bouquets are also what makes it ideal in the garden.

title: Limnologist Uses Stream To Study Water Life
description: WEST MARLBORO TOWNSHIP, Pa.  Propping herself against the trunk of her car, the stocky, darkhaired woman pulled on a pair of wellworn hip boots, grabbed a longhandled dip net and walked briskly toward a nearby creek, a clutch of 14 graduate students, all similarly booted in her wake.

title: PARKING
description: Motorists will be able to park their cars today and tomorrow on both sides of those streets where alternatesideofthestreet regulations are normally in effect. The regulations have been suspended because of the Jewish holiday of Shabuoth. However, other parking and standing restrictions still apply.

title: C.I.A. Analyst Sees Risk in Delaying Link With China
description: WASHINGTON, June 3A senior analyst of the Central Intelligence Agency, in an unusual published critique of the Administration's policy, says that further delay in formally recognizing China runs the risk of destroying the new American relationship with Peking.

title: and Efforts to Halt It
description: The Labor Government must do more than hold policies that have not yet worked and show little prospect of working adequately for months to come. It must persuade the unions, and the rest of the country, that further cuts in Government spending are essential to stop the inflation sooner. Mr. Healey would obviously prefer to wait until the autumn budget review to trim outlays in a careful and orderly way, but the developing crisis may not permit this. The spending plans of local government authorities, now running over one billion dollars above agreed estimates, need to be reined back promptly.

title: The Labor Scene
description: GENEVAWhen the separate voices of employers and workers are given equal status with those of the world's governments in an international forum, can they do a better job of reconciling the oftenconflicting economic interests of the rich and poor nations than foreign ministers and finance officers have been doing in their long series of standoffs at global gatherings? Or will the only result of getting more diversity into the mix be confusion amplified to the point of chaos?

title: Loch Ness Expedition Casts Off With Perfect Timing for Tests
description: DRUMNADROCHIT, Scotland, June 3In the afternoon the stillness fell over the Great Glen. The morning drizzle drifted beyond the green hills, the wind died down and Loch Ness could settle itself. The dark waters became like a smooth sheet of shining obsidian, a mirror reflecting the steep hills, gray clouds andsome may say  the imaginations of those who had come here in search of the Loch Ness monster.

title: AMERICANS WARN OF I.LO. WALKOUT
description: GENEVA, June 3The chief spokesman for American unions warned the International Labor Organization tonight that United States worker delegates might walk out of its World Employment Conference if an earlier decision to bar the Palestine Liberation Organization was reversed. A hint that United States employers might also quit the conference came from the head of their delegation.

title: Louisiana Moving to Sell Superdome
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 3Charles E. Roemer 2d, the State Commissioner of Administration, said today that two principals, one from New York City, had approached him about buying the Louisiana Superdome and that if the bidding price was right, Louisiana would like to sell.

title: SOVIET TO GIVE CUBA A NUCLEAR REACTOR
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum. bia, June 3 (Reuters)Cuba is to get its first nuclear reactor, and the Soviet Union will supply it, the head of Havana's delegation at the United Nations Habitat Conference disclosed today.

title: Food Fair Confirms Talks on Acquiring The Penn Fruit Co.
description: Food Fair Stores of Philadelphia confirmed reports yesterday that it had been holding discussions with the Penn Fruit Company, which has been in Chapter XI bankruptcy proceedings since last September, regarding a possible acquisition of Penn Fruit by Food Fair. Penn Fruit in 1974 operated 58 supermarkets, three specialty food stores, 18 home and garden stores, two junior department stores and eight self service laundry and drycleaning stores in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York, Delaware and Maryland.

title: 4 Are Convicted in Jersey In CheckPrinting Scheme
description: NEWARK, June 3 (AP)Four persons, including a mother and her son and daughter have pleaded guilty to a variety of charges stemming from an illegal checkprinting and cashing scheme conducted in a sixcounty area of North Jersey.

title: Robber Takes $279,000 From a Brooklyn Bank
description: Greeting the manager of a Brooklyn bank with a cheery Hi, Michael as he drove up to work yesterday morning, a young holdup man drew a gun, forced the manager to open the vault and then escaped with $279,000, according to the police.

title: BAYS WILL YIELD ONE POST, CLINGS TO THREE OTHERS
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Representative Wayne L. Hays agreed today to give up temporarily one of his four committee chairmanships, but his attempt to placate his angry colleagues only ignited new demands that he step down from his other posts as well.

title: Resort Tax Revenue Down
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 3 (AP)Luxury tax collections in this resort for April were down $24,858 from the same month last year, officials report. Revenue and Finance Commissioner Horace Bryant said yesterday that only $191,881 was collected on the room rental tax during the month.

title: BUSINESS LOANS AT CITY'S BANKS EXPAND SHARPLY
description: Business loans at leading New York City banks climbed $439 million in the week ended Wednesday in their largest increase in more than 17 Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: British Lend Magna Carta to ExColony
description: WASHINGTON. June 3The British lost their American colonies nearly 200 years ago, but a Parliamentry delegation did not seem to mind today as it presented the oldest of the four remaining original copies of Magna Carta to the American people as a Bicentennial loan.

title: Market Declines at Close; Dow Moves Down by 2.13
description: The stock market closed with a small loss yesterday after trading all day on the upside in a narrow range.

title: Carter Warns Democrats On Promises in Platform
description: CLEVELAND, June 3Jimmy Carter warned today that the Democratic Party should not adopt a wish box or Christmas tree party platform, filled with what he characterized as excessively costly and unrealistic promises.

title: People and Business
description: A former United States Ambassador to Saudi Arabia, James E. Akins, proposed yesterday the gradual application of a new Federal gasoline consumer tax that would reach $1 a gallon by 1990 as the only way to force production of more energyefficient cars.

title: Getting Off the Ground
description: In this sampling, most of the aviation schools and air charter companies that offer sightseeing flights operate singleengine planes with room for three passengers, charging the same for one or three. (An exception is Republic Air Charter, which has larger planes; price quoted is for each person, not the group.) Some have specific tours that run about a halfhour: others are less formal. All rates are based on trips about a halfhour. Reservations are necessary.

title: Moynihan Backing Off on Senate Bid
description: Daniel P. Moynihan has tentatively decided not to seek the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate,. friends of the former United States representative at the United Nations said last night.

title: Centrowitz Is Fastest in 1,500Meter Run Trials
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 3Matt Centrowitz of Oregon, who comes from the Bronx, turned in a glittering performance today in the 55th annual National Collegiate outdoor track and field championships.

title: NEWCAR SALES UP 17% IN MAY PERIOD; 8TH MONTHLY GAIN
description: DETROIT, June 3Domestic new car sales increased 17 percent in the final third of May, company figures showed today. Sales were lower than expected but the results still meant the automobile industry completed in May its eighth straight month of sharply higher sales.

title: FORD WON'T ENTER THE RUBBER STRIKE
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) President Ford said today that he had no intention of invoking the TaftHartley Act against the strike in the rubber industry. We are monitoring the situation very closely. he told a news conference for Ohio reporters.

title: Department Stores tip 11%
description: WASHINGTON. June 3The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.22 billion, up 11 percent from the gearearlier $1.10 billion. Total retail store) sales were about $12.44 billion up 12 percent from last year's, $11.12 billion.

title: Torres, ExPresident of Bolivia, Found Murdered in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 3 (AP) The body of former President Juan Jose Torres of Bolivia has been found on a rural roadside, the authorities said today.

title: More on Pensions
description: In a report issued earlier this week, the Temporary Commission spelled out additional savings of at least $135 million that New York City could achieve over a period of time by reforming its cumbersome and costly pension systems.

title: Morgenthau Investigating Leasing of DayCare Units
description: District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau is investigating the city's direct leasing of daycare centers to determine if builders and city employees conspired to levy excessive charges in the controversial program.

title: Cubs Add To Woes Of Mets
description: The Mets skipped town last night for the West Coast after losing to the Chicago Cubs, 21, and they left a monumental heap of debris behind: 11 defeats in their last 13 games, 18 in their last 24 and a trail of smashed objects in the locker room.

title: ACCOUNTING UNIT DEFERS PROPOSAL
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board said yesterday that it had decided to defer indefinitely its earlier proposal concerning the issuing of additional figures to show the effect of inflation on financial statements.

title: Music: Amiable Chamber Players
description: The Interaction Chamber Players, an ensemble made up of three amiable and chatty young men, played an agreeable program of music for clarinet, piano and cello at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night.

title: KISSINGER TO MEET VORSTER IN EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON. June 3Secretary of State Henry A. Xiszinger will meet in Europe later this month with Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa as part of the Ford Administration's new policy of working for an end to white minority rule in Rhodesia.

title: Masson the Misjudged
description: IT Is common ground with virtually everyone who knows Andre Maseon, however slightly, that he is one of the most delightful men who ever held up a paintbrush. In very few people does the flame of intelligent curiosity burn so brightly. Masson knows a great deal, he has had an exceptionally full and reWarding life, he is funny. generotis and outgoing, and he makes us feel that we are as clever and as interesting and as experienced as he is. The list of those who have treasured his company is as varied as it is long: in what other context does H. G. Wells stand side by side with Samuel Beckett? Henri Matisse with Ernest Hemingway? Andre Mairaux with JeanPaul Sartre? In the recollection of his company, all hurts are healed, and all hostilities brought to a sage armistice.

title: Harvesting the Bloom
description: Your Gladiolus will remain fresh for up to two weeks if harvested and kept properly. Pick spikes as soon as the lower florets have opened. Use a sharp knife and cut as low as possible, but let at least five leaves remain on each plant to feed energy back to the corm if you wish it to bloom next year. Immerse the spikes immediately in a bucket of cold water while you harvest the rest of the bouquet. The blooms should not touch the rim of the bucket, or they will bruise.

title: A King for Democracy
description: King Juan Carlos I has used the occasion of his visit to the United States to make the most positive commitment of his sixmonth reign to the restoration of authentic liberty and democratic government in Spain. The 38yearold monarch's dramatic avowal, in his address delivered to a joint session of Congress, undoubtedly helped undercut whatever opposition had existed in the Senate to approval of a fiveyear treaty of military and economic cooperation between Spain and the United States.

title: 5 IN BROOKLYN HELD IN POLICE BRIBERY
description: Five Brooklyn men were arrested on bribery and gam bling charges by the Brooklyn District Attorney's office this week and a sixth was still bing sought in the case, which was the culmination of an eightmonth undercover operation.

title: NEW ANGOLA MOVE BY CUBAREPORTED
description: HUAMBO, Angola, June 3Cuban troops, who are assisting the Angolan Government forces, made preparations here today for what appeared to be a new offensive against guerrillas said to belong to the opposition National Union for the Total Independence of Angola.

title: People in Sports
description: While basketball coaches all around him are losing their jobs, Al Attles of the Golden State Warriors has been given some added responsibilities. It was announced yesterday that Attles, in addition to coaching, would assume the position of general manager of the team and be responsible for scoutMe and drafting. He sucteeds Dick Vertlieb, who left to join the Seattle major league baseball expansion team that will begin play next season. Attles led Golden State to last season's National Basketball Association championship, but the Warriors were eliminated from the playoffs this season by the Phoenix Suns. Franklin Mieuli, the Warrior's owner and president, also announced that Gordon (Scotty) Stirling would become the assistant to the president, and would run the daytoday operations of the team.

title: Licentious Lyrics Get Airing In First of Midnight Concerts
description: Those with a taste for bawdy ballads, raunchy roundelays, salacious serenades, doublesentendres or even an outr overture might look into a program at Alice Tully Hall tomorrow at midnight, the first of two late night concerts. There they can hear works of such a nature from the pens of highly respected and respectable composers of England's less staid eras. There will be more of the same from French and Italian composers served up with program notes but no English subtitles. The performers were hte Ensemble for Early Music and the Early Music Gleemen, and the concert will last one hour and five minutes, without intermission.

title: Business Records
description: Thursday, June 3, 1976 Petition filed by:

title: Metropolitan Baedeker:
description: WITHIN an hour of Manhattan, a visitor can tour a Roaring Twenties estate, enjoy boating fishing, bicycling, art galleries, antiques and possibly a free film festival or concert  with some atmosphere of faraway resorts.

title: State Bank Chiefs Plan RateExperiment Talks
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 The banking commissioner of New York, New Jersey and the six New England states are preparing to meet Monday in Boston to consider a proposal that the region be used to experiment with two interest rates of major significance to consumers.

title: Antiques
description: FOR 47 YEARS Mildred and Raft Y. Mottahedeh violated a basic tenet of collectingand in the process they put together what is possibly the finest holding of Chinese export porcelains in private hands in this country.

title: Novels for Our Times
description: THE STARSPANGLED CONTRACT. By Jim Garrison. 372 pages. McGrawHill $8.95. In the opening scene of Jim Garrison's new novel, snots are fired at a figure in a limousine, and for a brief moment we are wrenched back in memory to Dealey Plaza and the death of President Kennedy. Because Jim Garrison, the author, is also Jim Garrison the former New Orleans District Attorney who began an investigation into the assassination that many thought was in itself a fictional scenario, the reader might well expect that he or she is in for another assassination  conspiracy theory smuggled to him in fictional guise.

title: Prices of Bonds Advance As New Issues Sell Well
description: The credit markets continued to regain their footing yesterday after stumbling most of this spring. Bond prices rose, new bond issues sold relatively well and the market recorded a modest uptick late in the afternoon after the Federal Reserve reported that the nation's basic money supply was unchanged during the week ended May 26.

title: Pentagon Equal Rights Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP)  Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld signed a directive today aimed at strengthening equal opportunity policies covering 3 million military and civilian personnel. The directive. broadens the scope of the Pentagon's Equal Opportunity Program to embrace all activities, rather than focusing on employment.

title: Panel Asks State to Keep Prisoneryelease System
description: inmates to work at jobs or in the community, to attend school or to reestablish ties with their families.

title: 8,000 Get Degrees At N.Y.U. Ceremony
description: New York University celebrated the end of the academic year yesterday with a $2.7 million reduction in its deficit and its first outdoor commencement in Washington Square Park since the university was founded in 1831.

title: Rails on the Freeways
description: LOS ANGELESIn a recent survey taken for The Los Angeles Times. 50 percent of those interviewed said they favored construction of the Sunset Coast Line, a rail rapid transit system that would link 44 cities in this area. But 44 percent of the same respondents said they would not personally use the system.

title: Carter Warns Democrats On Promises in Platform
description: CLEVELAND, June 3Jimmy Carter warned today that the Democratic Party should not adopt a wish box or Christmas tree party platform, filled with what he characterized as excessively costly and unrealistic nromises.

title: 4 Guilty of Harassing Black S.I. Family
description: Four residents of New Dorp, S.I., area were convicted yesterday in connection with charges of conspiracy to violate the civil rights of a black family that had wanted to move into their predominantly white neighborhood in 1972.

title: Decline of the Pound
description: With Britain caught in a tricky crisis of inflation unemployment and external deficit, the pound continues to fall. Yesterday it dropped almost to the onceunthinkable level of $1.70; and the Government seems unable to check its continuing slide. But Chancellor Denis Healey says he will not change the Government's basic economic program merely to impress the foreign exchange market.

title: KISSINGER TO MEET VORSTER IN EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger will meet in Europe later this month with. Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa as part of the Ford Administxation's new policy of working for an end to white minority rule in Rhodesia.

title: Stony Brook Relives Past
description: In a wide, grassy meadow called Forsythe Pasture, just beyond Hawkins Road in the village of Stony Brook, L.I., some 1,000 men, women and childrenin costumes handmade and intricately detailed will gather together tomorrow and Sunday to recreate a vivid picture of colonial Long Island at work, at home and at play.

title: Borg, Solomon, Dibbs Advance in Paris
description: PARIS, June 3 (UPI)Bjorn Borg, in pursuit of his third straight French Open tennis title, lost only four games today in leading the favorites, including Harold Solomon and Eddie Dibbs of the United States, into the third round of the $210,000 championship.

title: BEAME UNIT SETS HIRING REFORMS
description: Mayor Beame's Management Advisory Board is preparing controversial Civil Service reform plan that would strengthen city management's hand by permitting a much wider choice of applicants for a vacant job.

title: Facts on Fringes
description: Did you know: That for every $3 New York City spends on base pay, it contributes another $2 in fringe, leave and retirement benefitsroughly twice the amount that other large cities spend on such supplemental emoluments?

title: Quinlans Sell Story To Ladies Journal
description: The parents of Karen Anne Quinlan have arranged with The Ladies Home Journal for the magazine to carry their story in a future issue, the magazine's editor in chief. Lenore Hershey, said last night.

title: Reform by Scandal
description: WASHINGTON, June 3It would be too much to say that money, booze and sex dominate the politics of this city, but you can hardly explain recent history around here without taking them into accountaction against Richard Nixon, and with the aid of the courts, finally brought him down. Now it will be interesting to see whether the leaders of the House and Senate will get their own houses in order. But for the tragedy at Chappaquiddick, with its Friday night highjinks, there is little doubt that Senator Edward Kennedy of Massachusetts would now be the leading candidate for both the Democratic nomination and the Presidency.

title: May Consumer Buying Lagged, Reports of Major Retailers Show
description: Consumer buying across the country in May fell behind its recent pace, according to sales reports issued yesterday by a number of the nation's largest retail chains. The sales results showed smaller gains in the month over last year than they had in March and April.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Dr. Philip Guerin, the psychiatrist who heads the Center for Family Learning in New Rochelle, N.Y., was discussing the complexities of family relationships, when suddenly words failed him.

title: Moynihan Backs Off
description: Daniel P. Moynihan has tentatively decided not to seek the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate, friends of the former representative of the United States to the United Nations said last night. Details, Pasie A16.

title: About Real Estate
description: How often do tenants organize to promote a tour of the rental apartments of landlords? Rarely if ever, say communityminded activists of Flatbush, who are sponsoring a tour of architecturally distinctive apartment houses as well as private homes on June 13, a week from Sunday.

title: Art People
description: THERE is something about the sight of a bare, concrete piazza that sets our city's more publicspirited art lovers salivating. And so it is with the vast open arena at Waterside, the newish apartment complex on the East River at 26th Street. Last year the highminded Public Arts Council (a private, nonprofit group) sponsored a show there of tensile metal strucKenneth Snelson.

title: 13 SCHOOL BOARDS CHIDED BY GOLDIN
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday that more than $1 million a year in city money was being wasted by 13 community school district boards on unnecessary and overly expensive rented office space.

title: Dr. Alexander M. Dushkin: Educator in Israel and U.S.
description: Dr. Alexander M. Dushkin, professor emeritus at the John Dewey School of Education that he helped organize in 1950 at Hebrew University in Jerusalem, died Wednesday night at his home in Jerusalem. He was 85 years old.

title: Spain's Friendly but Discreet Queen
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Queen Sofia stood in the drawing room of Blair House today, posing for photographers.

title: Italian Communist Chief, in Paris, Pessimistic on Election Result
description: PARIS, June 3The Italian Communist leader, Enrico Berlinguer, here for a huge rally of French Communists, said today that he would not advise betting that the rival Christian Democrats would be defeated in the coming Italian elections.

title: A Rose Is a Flowerization
description: When one reads as many manuscripts as each of us editors does, it is very easy to feel that the English language is falling apart. Here are some of the major abuses of the language up with which we will not put, to quote Winston Churchill.

title: French Renew Troops Offer
description: PARIS, June 3 (UPI) Foreign Minister Jean Sauvagnargues today met with the Syrian Foreign Minister and renewed France's offer to send peacekeeping troops to Lebanon to preserve the country's integrity and independence.

title: State's High Court Limits Nadjari to Criminal Cases
description: ALBANY. June 3The New York State Court of Appeals, in a decision certain to add fuel to the political and legal controversy surrounding Maurice H. Nadjari, ruled today that his jurisdiction was limited strictly to the criminaljustice process or system.

title: Visit From the Llord of the Ring
description: My God! read a big placard on the wall. Is this the end of Ali? Three to one the author had caught Edward G. Robinson in Little Caesar on the late, late show. Mother of God! went the closing line of that old shootemup, can this be the end of Rico? Anyway, there was Muhammad All sitting where photographers could shoot him with the placard as background. He was dressed neatly and quietly as usual and, as usual, his clothes were the quietest thing about him. I am the lord of the ring, he was saying, and he spelled it: Llord. Double L? said Barney Nagler of the Racing Form. I thought it was arithmetic he flunked in that draft board exam years ago. As usual, All had a ring of listeners, some of wnom were Mang notes. A few yards away, Bob Biron was talking with quiet earnestness. He had only one listener.

title: Book Agent Says He Obtained Love Letters Written by Nixon
description: Scott Meredith, the literary agent, says he has in his possession 22 letters, some of which he described as love letters, allegedly written by former President Richard M. Nixon to a married woman during the las few months of his Administration.

title: Business Trends
description: Recent skirmishing over patents between the Eastman Kodak Company and the Polaroid Corporation, as they begin direct competition in instant photography, is merely an incident in what many observers forecast will be a large expansion of the entire amateurphotography industry.

title: Economist Suggests U. S. Seek Surveillance of Exchange Rates
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (Reuters)The economist C. Fred Bergsten said today that the United States should push hard to establish effective surveillance over the exchange rate system to protect itself from the actions of other countries.

title: Jersey Told to Keep Its Prisoner Release But Make Reforms
description: TRENTON, June 3The State Commission of Investigation today ended five days of hearings into the scandalridden prisoner release programs with an endorsement of their value and recommendations for revising them.

title: Business in New York
description: In the last two years new faces have replaced old ones in the top executive suites of most of New York's big stores.

title: Udall Disappointed
description: CLEVELAND, June 3 (UPI)Representative Morris K. Udall said today that he was disappointed that Mr. Gilligan endorsed Mr. Carter for President.

title: EGYPT CONDEMNS SYRIA ON LEBANON, ASKS CONFERENCE
description: CAIRO, June 3Egypt today condemned Syria's military intervention in Lebanon and called for an urgent meeting of Arab foreign ministers to put an end to it.

title: ENERGY CUTBACK ORDERED BY BEAME
description: Mayor Beame yesterday ordered city agencies that he controls to devise plans for cutting their fuel consumption by 25 percent in the next fiscal year. The move will mean reducing thermostats in the affected buildings from 70 degrees to 68 degrees during the winter.

title: Brown Remains Noncommittal On Bid to Limit Nuclear Plants
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., June 3 Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr., resuming his homestate campaigning for the Democratic Presidental nomination, carefully straddled today what is probably the touchiest political issue of the moment in California.

title: Poet Slain by Francoists Stirs New Dispute in Spain
description: GRANADA. Spain, June 1  The ghost of Federico Garcia Lorca, the poet slain by Franco forces in 1936 shortly after the outbreak of the Civil War and since then the symbol of all the voices stilled in Spain, is haunting his native region, Andalusia, now that some Spaniards find their voice once more.

title: Giles and Siderowf British Golf Victors
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, June 3 (UPI)Virmy Giles, the defending champion needed just 28 holes of golf today to win two matches that put him into the quarterfinals of the British Amateur championship in his bid to become the first American to win successive titles since Lawson Little 41 years ago.

title: Princeton Mare: Carter 50c, Ford 38c, Reagan 1 Oc
description: PRINCETON, June 3Jimmy Carter was selling for 50 cents, Gerald Ford had risen steadily to 38 cents, and there were several offers to buy and sell Ronald Reagan for less than a dime.

title: Tunney Is Surprised as Hayden Gains
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3To nearly everyone's surprise, but especially Senator John V. Tunney's, Tom Hayden appears to have turned the Democratic primary race for Mr. Tunney's seat into a close contest.

title: Many Jobless in Jersey City
description: TRENTON, June 3, (UPI) The New Jersey Department of Labor and Industry reported yesterday that the highest unemployment rate during April was in the Jersey City area. Figcres indicated that the lowest unemployment rate was in the Trenton area. The statistics were part of an overall study of unemployment, which rose from 11.3 percent in March to 11.6 percent in April.

title: Tax Bill Provision Held Curbing Press On Exposing I.R.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 3A group representing taxpayers charged today that a provision had been put into the pending tax bill under which journalists could be fined and imprisoned for exposing wrongdoing by the Internal Revenue Service.

title: New Cuban Activity In Angola Reported
description: HUAIVIBO, Angola, June 3Cuban troops, who are assisting the Angolan Government forces, made preparations here today for what appeared to be a new offensive against guerrillas said to belong to the opposition National Union for the Total Independence of Angola.

title: 2 SITES PROPOSED FOR A CITY CENTER
description: Either Battery Park City of the West 34th Street railroad yards would be effective sites For a large Manhattan convention center, according to a special study by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: LEO BRONSTEIN, 72, FINE ARTS AUTHOR
description: Leo Bronstein, an author and a retired professor of fine arts, died Tuesday in Strasbourg, France, after being run over by la motorcycle. He was 72 years old and lived at 210 West 101st Street.

title: Oyster Bay Fund Approved
description: Voters of the Oyster BayEast Norwich, L. I., school district approved an $8,689,045 school budget yesterday by 918 to 736. A new library budget was also passed.

title: COURT IN RULING ON EARTH STEAM
description: SANTA ROSA, Calif., June 3 (AP)In a decision with potentially wide energy implications, a judge has ruled that ownership of geothermal steam is covered by mineral rights, not water rights.

title: State's High Court Limits Nadiari to Criminal Cases
description: ALBANY, June 3The New York State Court of Appeals, in a decision certain to add fuel to the political and legal controversy surrounding Maurice H. Nadjari, ruled today that his jurisdiction was limited strictly to the criminaljustice process or system.

title: CITY U. PLAN GETS REBUFF IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, June 3The State Senate's Republican majority leader, Warren Anderson of Binghamton, today effectively washed his hands of a shortterm solution to the City University's runding crisis, blaming the city for allowing the university to overspend its budget and charging that the rescue plan drawn up by Democratic leaders would set a precedent for future fiscal mismanagement by other city agencies.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Associated Press

title: PARKING
description: Motorists will he able to park their cars today and tomorrow on both sides of those streets where alternateside ofthestreet regulations are normally in effect. The regulations have been suspended because of the Jewish holiday of Shabuoth. However, other parking and standing restrictions still apply.

title: VENEZUELAN BRIBES LAID TO OCCIDENTAL
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 3 (UPI)A Venezuelan congressional committee investigating alleged bribes paid by the Occidental Petroleum Corporation here to acquire oilfields in 1971 has concluded that the company was guilty of illicit conduct, a committee member said today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 4, 1976 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Business Briefs
description: AUSTIN, Tex., June 3 (UPI)The Northeast Bank of Houston was ordered closed today because of heavy withdrawals of deposits and problems with the bank's assets. The bank is the second in Houston ordered closed this year. The State Banking Commissioner, Robert E. Stewart, said efforts to solve the bank's asset problems, which involved other real estate acquired through foreclosure on loans, had been unsuccessful and the sudden withdrawal deposits made insolvency of the bank imminent.

title: Jews Begin Celebration Of Shabuoth Holiday
description: Shabuoth, the Jewish holiday commemorated the giving of the Ten Commandments, began at sundown yesterday with observances in synagogues.

title: Broadway
description: THE hottest playwright in London is Ben Travers, who has two comedies going for him now, with another comedy opening at the Savoy next month. The two on the boards now are Plunder and The Bed Before Yesterday, and the one opening next month is Banana Ridge. This means that Mr. Travers is having a season on the West End similar to the ones Neil Simon once had on Broadway. Further comparisons, however, are hard to make. Mr. Travers is 89 years old, and he has never been on Broadway.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: New Jersey Bell Telephone Company, which is seeking a $150.2 million rate increase, is actually entitled to nothing, attorneys for the state's Public Advocate said in Newark. It was the first time in the history of the Public Advocate's rate division that it has recommended New Jersey Bell not be granted one cent of the increase it was seeking. The Public Advocate employed a leading New York accounting firm to check the figures Bell submitted when it first asked for the rate increase last November. The firm's report, filed with the Public Utility Commission, stated that Bell was seeking $41 million in income that did not need. Even without the increase, Bell would be able to earn a 9 percent rate 0 return, the report concluded.

title: Construction of Spacelab MockUp Is Begun in Europe
description: BREMEN  Assembly has begun here of a hard mockup of the Spacelab to be carried into orbit in 1980 as the first Space Shuttle payload, and guidelines have been set forth for the mission destined to open a new era in manned space flight.

title: Legal Claim Won in Suit For Rumanian Fortune
description: A New York tailor has won legal claim to a Murray Hill hotel reportedly owned by the Rumanian Government in the first step of a battle to obtain a collection of rare coins and other objects housed in a Bucharest museum.

title: Exchange Lifts Limit In Nonaccoant Trades
description: Investors will be able to place isolated orders to buy or sell $2,000 worth of securities without having to open an account with a stock broker, the New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday after the regular monthly meeting of directors. It was the first formal meeting of William M. Batten, newly named chairman of the board. Investors have been able to buy or sell only $1,000 of securities without opening an account, the exchange said.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON. June 3Two education groups say they will ask the United States Supreme Court to intervene in the state's public school crisis.

title: ExModel and Her Maid Slain in Greenwich Home
description: GREENWICH. Conn., June A wealthy former fashion model and her liveIn maid were found murdered last night in the upstairs bedroom of a $250,000 home in this affluent town's rural back country.

title: Strike of Hospitals Averted as 2 Sides Agree on a Panel
description: The threat of a municipal hospital strike next Monday was averted late yesterday when city and union officials agreed to submit the dispute to a threeman panel that would make nonbinding recommendations for a settlement.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Egypt yesterday condemned Syria's military intervention in Lebanon and called for a meeting of Arab foreign ministers to put an end to it. Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy said that Egypt supported the Palestine Liberation Organization's demand for Arab action to end the civil war between Moslems and Christians. [Page A1, Column 8.1

title: Publishing: Brodkey Delivers
description: H AROLDBRODKEY'S novel, A Party of Animals (sometimes known as Animal Corner'), is finally in at the office of Farrar, Straus & Giroux. A Party of Animals has been one of the most anticipated works of fiction in the last five years. Bits and pieces have appeared in American Review, Esquire and American Poetry Review. One lengthy segment was published only recently in The New Yorker, which had once run a briefer passage.

title: Warren Township Man Shot Dead in Manhattan
description: A 46yearold owner of a New Jersey garbage collecting company was shot to death in a midtown Manhattan parking garage yesterday in what the police called the apparent work of a professional gunman.

title: West Side Book Browser
description: THE UPPER East Side has singles bars. The Upper West Side has bookstores.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Every year, In the towns of Puerto Rico there is a grand celebration in honor of the saints. Today, and continuing for 10 days, New York will have its first Fiestas Patronales del Barrio, sponsored by the East Harlem Community Corporation. The fiesta will occupy the two westerly lanes of Third Avenue between 106th and 116th Streets. Booths will sell games, souvenirs and delicacies such as pastellas, morcillas, bacalao (cod fish) and nonPuerto Rican shish kebab. Bands, dance groups and singers will perform on stages set up at 109th and 113th Streets. Among the performers are Boby Capo, Monrivera, Guarare. The Alvin Ailey Repertory Workshop dances at 5 P.M. on Sunday. Fiesta opens today at 5 P.M.; tomorrow, this Sunday and next, noon to midnight.

title: Assailant Takes Overdose
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., June 3 (AP)Michael L. Carvin, convicted of flashing a toy gun at Ronald Reagan, was in stable condition at a local hospital today after taking an overdose of sleeping pills. Mr. Carvin, 21 years old, was sentenced yesterday in Miami to an indeterminate prison term.

title: Prices of Soybeans Drop Because of Less Demand
description: Slower foreign and domestic demand for soybean meal in fluenced a sharp drop in soybean meal and soybean prices in futures trading yesterday, on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Exxon U.S.A. Raises Prices Of Gasoline by 1.3c a Gallon
description: Exxon U.S.A., chief American affiliate of the Exxon Corporation, announced yesterday that it had raised wholesale prices of all grades of gasoline by 1.3 cents a gallon. Price increases of one or two cents a gallon have been made by other major companies over the last month. The current nationwide retail average price is 59 cents a gallon. The Union Carbide Corporation announced that schedule prices of its two grades of Ucar bisphenol A, an intermediate used in the manufacture of epoxy and polyester resins and polycarbonates, are being increased 4.6 percent to 9.1 percent, effective July 1 for spot and contract customers.

title: Mexican Bond Issue Planned
description: LONDON, June 4Nacional Financiera, the principal Mexican Government agency for financing economic development, will soon offer a $30 million fiveyear bond issue with an expected coupon of 10 percent, Credit Suisse White Weld Ltd., manager of the offering, said today.

title: Antitrust Filibuster Is Broken In Senate by Vote of 67 to 22
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The Senate broke a filibuster today against a major antitrust bill and moved toward passage of the measure, probably on Monday.

title: Senate Vote on Limiting Debate on Antitrust Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) Following is the 67 to 22 rollcall vote by which the Senate voted today to shut off debate on an antitrust bill.

title: Free Tuition Mainstay Of Eminence for City U.
description: For more than a half century, the graduating seniors at City College have risen at the commencement ceremony to recite the Ephebic Oath of Devotion, vowing to strive to transmit this city not only not less but greater, better and more beautiful than it was transmitted to us.

title: Specialist Broker Fined For Failing in His Duties
description: In one of the largest fines ever imposed against a stockbroker, the New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that it had fined Warren R. Haas, a 48yearold trading floor specialist, $18,000 for haying failed to maintain a fair and orderly market in a stock it did not identify.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Egypt yesterday condemned Syria's military intervention in Lebanon and called for a meeting of Arab foreign ministers to put an end to it. Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy said that Egypt supported the Palestine Liberation Organization's demand for Arab action to end the civil war between Moslems and Christians. [Page A1, Column 8.]

title: Morgenthau Investigating Leasing of DayCare Units
description: District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau is investigating the city's direct leasing of daycare centers to determine builders and city employees conspired to levy excessive charges in the controversial program.

title: Strike of Hospitals Averted as 2 Sides Agree on a Panel
description: The threat of a municipal hospital strike next Monday was averted late yesterday when city and union officials agreed to submit the dispute to a threeman panel that would make nonbinding recommendations for a settlement.

title: EXREP. KEARNEY, 87, IS DEAD IN FLORIDA
description: VENICE, Fla., June 3 (AP)Former Representative Bernard W. Kearney, 87 year old, who was once the ranking Republican member of the nowdefunct House UnAmercian Activities Committee, died tonight in a hospital here.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Oakland A's, et Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street the Bronx, S P.M. (TelevisionChannel 11, 8 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 7:55 P.M.)

title: MISS RAY'S DENIAL ON TAPING QUERIED
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Although Elizabeth Ray has denied that she made secret tape recordings of alleged conversations and liaisons with members of Congress several of her friends, including one former Representative, tell different story.

title: British Lend Magna Carta to ExColony
description: WASHINGTON. June 3The British lost their American colonies nearly 200 years ago, but a Parliamentry delegation did not seem to mind today as it presented the oldest of the four remaining original copies of Magna Carta to the American people as a Bicentennial loan.

title: Efficiency Checks Urged
description: TRENTON, June 3 (UPI)Energy Administrator Burt L. Ross urged New Jerseyans yesterday to check the energy efficiency of airconditioners to save electricity and money. He said that most airconditioners carried information on how efficiently they used energy.

title: Sweden Approves a Law Boosting Workers Power
description: STOCKHOLM, June 3 (AP)The Swedish Parliament today unanimously approved a new powersharing law giving workers a strong voice in the major operations of private companies.

title: THREE ARE GUILTY OF JEWEL SWINDLE
description: A textile businesswoman a salesman for her company, and a third man with no known occupation were found guilty yesterday of swindling a Swiss jewler who sold them a large diamond and a large emerald but never received the $255,000 they promised to pay him.

title: Lesson in Biology Leads to a Ferment
description: A high school experiment in winemaking that alledgedly turned into a winetasting party for a class of 15yearold and 16yearold students has led to the dismissal of their teacher and a lawsuit seeking her reinstate ment with back pay.

title: Snapper and Lobster Or Mexican Spice
description: 1359 First Avenue (at 73d Street). 737.9660.

title: Princeton's Varsity Gains Rowing Final
description: SYRACUSE, June 3The varsity eights from Princeton and Wisconsin placed first in the two heats today and advanced to Saturday's final of the national intercollegiate rowing championships on Lake Onondaga. Four more final?? will be decided to?? when the nine crews that lost in this morning's racing, compete again in two repechage or secondchance events.

title: HUMPHREY READY IF CARTER FALTERS
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., June 3 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said today that if Jimmy Cartel stumbled badly in next Tuesday's three Presidential primaries. Mr. Humphrey would probably begin active pursuit of the Democratic nomination.

title: 3 Piers Destroyed by Fire While Thousands Watch
description: A fire in three bandoned piers on the New Jersey waterfront in Weehawken last night sent flames and acrid smoke billowing hundreds of feet above the Palisades.

title: Management
description: One of the big beneficiaries of the Securities MI d Exchange Commission's recent crackdown on kickbacks, bribes and illegal campaign contributions has been the insurance industry.

title: Church III In Bed
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3 (UPI) Senator Frank Church, stricken with a sore throat and ear infection, canceled all his campain appearances today to spend the day in bed on doctor's orders.

title: Katharine McBride, 72, Dies; Headed Bryn Mawr 28 Years
description: Katharine E. McBride, whn became the fourth president of Bryn Mawr College in 1942 at the age of 37 and retired in 1970, died yesterday in Bryn Mawr (Pa.) Hospital of a heart ailment. She was 72 years old.

title: Advertising
description: Time Inc. is giving serious consideration to entering the women's magazine field to broaden the corporation's advertising base, Kelso Sutton, editor of its magazine development group, said today.

title: Temple in Flemington to Rededicate Torah Stolen by Nazis and Restored
description: FLEMINGTON, June 3A late 19thcentury torah, or sacred scroll of Jewish law, desecrated by the Nazis during their occupations of Czechoslovakia more than a generation ago, has been restored and will be rededicat ed here Saturday by Congregation Bet Tikva of Raritan Township.

title: HAYS WILL YIELD ONE POST, CLINGS TO THREE OTHERS
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Representative Wayne L. Hays agreed today to give up temporarily one of his four committee chairmanships but his attempt to placate his angry colleagues only ignited new demands that he step down from his other posts as well.

title: Limnologist Uses Stream To Study Water Life
description: WEST MARLBORO TOWNSHIP, Pa.  Propping herself against the trunk of her car, the stocky, darkhaired woman pulled on a pair of wellworn hip boots, grabbed a longhandled dip net and walked briskly toward a nearby creek, a clutch of 14 graduate students, all similarly booted, in her wake.

title: Flames Shoot Hundreds of Feet as Two Piers in Weehawken Catch Fire
description: A fire in two abandoned piers on the New Jersey waterfront in Weehawken last night sent flames and acrid smoke billowing hundreds of feet above the Palisades.

title: MICHAEL A. RAFFAELE
description: Michael A. Raffaele, former assistant general foreman of jthe composing room at The New York Times, died yesterday in St. John's Hospital in j Yonkers. He was 67 years old, and lived in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: American Ice Cream Has Invaded Britain
description: LONDON, June 3  Prince Charles has tried it twice. Lee Remick had it on her birthday. Paul McCartney, Elliot Richardson, James Coburn and Dirk Bogarde have queued up for it. And thousands of British students, European tourists, and homesick Americans have suddenly discovered it.

title: Start Gate Ends Race
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (AP)  The second race at Arlington Park was declared no contest today after the starting gates became stuck across the track near the stands after the race began.
