title: Radio
description: 7:30 8:55 A.M., WNYC  FM: Mornings with Music. Concertino No. 5, Pergolesi; The Flower Clock, Francaix; Piano Sonata No. 52, Haydn; Duet for Flute and Violin, C.P.E. Bach; The Sorcerer's Apprentice. Dukes.

title: Informal Forum That Parallels the Habitat Conference Is a Youthful and Radically Different Affair
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, June 8  Two dungareeclad youths were walking across a parking lot at the Habitat Forum, the informal conference pazalleling the United Nations Conference on Human Settlement, when a large sedan sped by, enveloping them in a cloud of dust.

title: Helstoski Is Apparent Victor in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Wednesday, June 9Representative Henry Helstoski, who was indicted by a Federal grand jury last week, apparently won a narrow victory for renomination last night in New Jersey's Ninth Congressional District. oppose the winner of the Secand District Democratic primary.

title: Carter Wants Election Subsidy Continued Beyond Conventions
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Jimmy Carter asked the Federal Election Commission today to change its rules so campaign subsidies could be paid to successful and unsuccessful Presidential candidates after the national conventions had chosen their nominees.

title: Tennis Results
description: Dan Rivkind defeated Andy Soleiman, 60, 61; Bill Tully defeated Csaba Tellas, 63, 61; Ed Cousins defeated Jonn Vanadi, 76, 63; Mel Alpren defeated Walt Kochard. 60, 61; Alan Berk defeated Sam Hochberg, 60, 62; Len Steiner defeated Bob Kamlot, 61, 64; Reggie Weir defeated Charlie Beck, 63, 46, 64; Fred Ooldhirsch defeated Charlie Friedman, 62, 6.7, 60.

title: List of Contributors to the Festival
description: Following is a list compiled by the Festival Committee or those who have contributed to the July 4th in Old New York Festival thus far:

title: Beazne Upheld in Council On Street Name Change
description: The City Council's Parks Committee voted 9 to 1 yesterday to defeat a motion to override Mayor Beame's recent veto of a bill to rename part of Graham Avenue in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn to the Avenue of Puerto grico.

title: Events Today
description: Events Today

title: William Palmer Dies at 61; Lord & Taylor Son Bar Chef
description: William L. Palmer, the chef at the 10thfloor soup bar of Lord & Taylor's Fifth Avenue store, died Sunday at his home in East Elmhurst, Queens. He was 61 years old and lived at 3244 103d Street.

title: BILL TO AID LIBRARIES RECALLED BY MARCHI
description: ALBANY. June 8State Senator John J. Marchi, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, today abruptly recalled from the Governor's office a bill that had passed the Legislature to provide an additional $7 million in state aid to local library systems this year.

title: KISSINGER ASSAILS CHILE OVER CURBS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that humanrights violations had impaired our relationship with Chile and called on all American countries to observe fundamental standards of humane conduct.

title: Suspect in Murder of Gross Surrenders in South
description: A suspect in the murder of Ted Gross, onetime aide of Mayor John V. Lindsay, surrendered yesterday to the police in Charleston County, S. C.

title: SALE IS REPORTED OF AYRWAY CHAIN
description: A Little Rock, Ark., financial group and the Associated Dry Goods Corporation have reportedly reached an agreement in principle under which the Southern group will purchase Associated's AyrWay discount store chain. Associated, which operates Lord & Taylor and other major department stores, is under an April 1975 agreement with the Federal Trade Commission to divest itself of the AyrWay chain within two years. In the fiscal year ended Jan. 31, Ayr Way had sales of about $140 million and earnings of slightly less than $3 million.

title: Brown Hails Momentum
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8Governor Brown declared tonight that his campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination had received so much momentum from today's primaries that he would intensify his efforts to overtake Mr. Carter, In Intenews before appearing at a victory celebration at the Convention Center here, the 38yearold Governor maintained that he had scored victories in both his home state and in New Jersey, although the outcome of the struggle for delegates in that state was far from certain when he spoke.

title: Today's Entries at Belmont
description: Today's Entries at Belmont

title: Walter Field,101, Dies; Acted in 2,000 Films
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 8 (UPI) Walter Field, the oldest American motion picture actor, died on Saturday. He was 101 years old. A veteran of more than 2,000 movies, Mr. Field last worked in an episode of television's Medical Center.

title: U.N. Plaza Hotel Opens; Many Luxuries Offered
description: The 39story United Nations Plaza Hotel opened its 288 rooms and suites yesterday to 350 invited guests.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the obituary or ??? Murray Cuddihy, former president of the Catholic Big Sisters, in The Times Monday it was erroneously stated that she was a daughter of the late Thomas E. Murray, former chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission. Mrs. Cuddihy was a sister of Mr. Murray.

title: MEXICAN AIDE CITES PROGRESS ON OPIUM
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP)  The Mexican Government pledged today to continue its program of eradicating opium poppies on a yearround basis, and the nation's Attorney General said in a joint statement with Attorney General Edward H. Levi of the United States that the program can be expected to reduce the availability of Mexica neroin in the United States late this year.

title: Flood Waters in Idaho Recede, But Anger Over Dam Is Rising
description: REXBURG. Idaho, June 8The swollen Snake River is receding now from the towns and farms it flooded when a controversial Federal irrigation darn collapsed near here Saturday.

title: ELEANOR G. COLT, LABOR SPECIALIST
description: Eleanor G. Coit a specialist in labor education, died Monday at Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital, Hanover, N. H. She was 82 years old and lived at 69 Fifth Avenue.

title: TV: Formula Maker Paid for ABC Film on Infants
description: As recently as the late 1960's, ABC News had been known to present documentaries that were favorable to the interests of the companies that sponsored them. The practice ended around 1970, and it seems no coincidence that ABC's emergence as a credible news organization began at just about that time.

title: Scientists Assess Oil's Damage to Marshes
description: LYNDHURST, June 8Chester P. Mattson, the chief environmental officer of the Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission, said today that the first 36 hours of containment after a massive oil spill on May 26 probably had saved the area from irreparable damage.

title: Dividends Announced
description: EXTRA

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE EASY WAY Not all persons interested in city landmarks have the energy or even ability to go there, hence a sittingdown walking tour of the Greenwich Village historic district. The event, open to the public and especially the elderly, is a free lecture tonight at 8:30 o'clock by Henry Hope Reed Jr., author of five books on city history, at a meeting of the Washington Square Association, in the parish house of the Church of the Ascension, 12 West the Street (off Fifth Avenue). Free and Iowcost literature will be available.

title: Bishops Score I.R.S. Plan lon ChurchRelated Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI) The nation's Roman Catholic bishops said today that the Internal Revenue Service's proposal to require churchrelated agencies to file annual reports would carve up the churches and amputate their ministries.

title: People and Business
description: Richard A. Dabs has resigned from the No. 2 position at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York to join Morgan Stanley & Company, the investment banking firm, as a managing director and as president of Morgan Stanley International, which oversees the firm's international units.

title: Pound Rally Falters
description: The pound rose in London by 4 cents to $1.80 before closing at $1.77. The 10nation credit that spurred the increase was seen as buying time for Britain's economy but doing nothing for its underlying problems. Page 53.

title: Lack of Funds Scaling Down July 4 Old New York Festival
description: The July 4th in Old New York Festival, what was to have been a threeday, manyfaceted celebration of the Bicentennial, has been scaled down, its budget reduced from a planned $250,000 to $130,000 because of an unexpected lack of financial support from the city's corporate community.

title: KISSINGER ASSAILS CHILE OVER CURBS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that humanrights violations had impaired our relationship with Chile and called on all American countries to observe fundamental standards of humane conduct.

title: Newcombe, Stockton Bow
description: BECKENHAM; England, June 8 (UPI)John Newcombe of Australia and Dick Stockton of the United States were beaten and Jimmy Connors won today in the Beckenham Robertsons grasscourt tennis tournament.

title: 2 Held in Newark Holdup
description: NEWARK, June 8 (AP)Two men were arrested and charged yesterday in a $40,000 armed robbery of a Midlantic Bank branch here, the police said. The men were identified as Ronald Parrish, 39 years old, and Charles Brame, 23, both of Newark. The police said the men entered the ban at around yesterday, ordered more than 25 customers to stand against the wall and emptied three cash drawers. They escaped by car and were later apprehended, the police said. Thirty thousand dollars of the stolen money was recovered.

title: Two Indians Go on Trial In Deaths of F.B.I. Agents
description: CEDAR RAPIDS. Iowa, June Two Indian men went on trial for the murder of two Fedtral Bureau of Investigation agents here this week in a case the American Indian Movement hopes to prove shows systematis Government harassment and an F.B.I. reign of terror on the troubled Pine Ridge Reservation in South Dakota.

title: Youth Killed in CaveIn
description: MASTIC, L. I., June 8 (UPI) An 18yearold laborer was trapped today when a 15footdeep cesspool excavation caved in here and died of apparent suffocation before another worker and two policemen could dig him out. The police identified the victim as Robert Kraemer of 915 Karshick Street, Bohemia, L. I.

title: Woman Accused in 11 Deaths Paroled
description: YORK, Neb., June 8Caril Ann Fugate won freedom today, IS years after accompanying Charles Starkweather on a murder rampage.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Carlstadt Councilman was freed on $5,000 bail after being charged with soliciting sexual favors from two 12yearold girls. The Councilman, Thomas Delesea Jr., 46 years old, was arrested on a complaint filed by the girls' parents, who Raid Mr. Delesea had tried to sell the girls pictures of a man and woman engaged in a sex act and had asked the girls whether they or their friends would care to do the same.

title: Deaths
description: ATKINStelli, devoted wife of the late Hyman, beloved mother of Lillian Tenrosen and of Me late Robert and Irving Michael Atkin, adored grandmother and greatgrandmother. Funeral Wednesday. June 9. 1 P.M., Parkside. Jerome Ave. and 170th St., Bronx.

title: Councilmen Who Ignored Court Order In Newark Get Stay of Jail Sentence
description: NEWARK, June 8The State Supreme Court granted a stay today of indefinite jail sentences imposed on five City Councilmen who had refused to vote for a courtordered revaluation of taxable property, and agreed to hear arguments in the case on June 21.

title: Inn of Mountain Gods, Owned by New Mexico Tribe, in Earthly Fight on Liquor License
description: MESCALERO, N. M.,In the Chiracahua Room, a wedding party of Texans was singing Roll me over in the clover; the bar manager was showing a visitor secret storerooms where $450,000 worth of liquor was stockpiled. Indian busboys were busy clearing dishes from a dining room said to have the best American cuisine in the area. Outside, an elaborate sprinkler system was dousing guests, walkways, tennis courts and balconies, as well as newly sodded lawns.

title: Cash Prices
description: Cash Prices

title: Monday's Fights
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif.  Pete Ranzany, 147 pounds, Sacramento, knocked out Alfonzo Hayman, 147, Philadelphia, 9 rounds; Monroe Brooks, 140, Los Angeles, outpointed Augustin Estrada, 138, Mexico, 10.

title: A 45YearOld Rivet in the First Amendment
description: Although journalists tend to give all credit to the Founding Fathers for freedom of the press, it was the creative work of this century's judiciary Charles Evans Hughes, Oliver Wendell Holmes, Louis D. Brandeis, Harlan F. Stone and Owen J. Robertsthat reinforced the prohibition against prior restraint and, in effect, nationalized the First Amendment when they decided Near v. Minnesota 45 years ago this month.

title: View of World's Shantytowns Less Grim
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, June 8Shantytowns of squatters, living on land that does not belong to them, are gaining a new respectability around the world.

title: Stage: Canada Festival
description: STRATFORD, Ontario, June 8Canada's Stratford Festival officially opened here yesterday with two performances, a matinee of Hamlet at the Avon Theater and an evening performance of Congreve's The Way of the World at the Festival Stage. It was a remarkable daythe simple affirmation of a great theater company.

title: Bill Easing Access to Data On Credit Gains in Albany
description: ALBANY. June 8  Under a bill, which passed the Assembly today, consumers would have greater access to credit reports on them maintained by credit reporting agencies and the agencies would be prohibited from obtaining such information as political affiliations, race and relieion.

title: LAB WILL BUILD IN COLLEGE POINT
description: One of the country's largest medical laboratories has decided to build a $9 million facility in a Queens industrial park, Mayor Beame announced yesterday. The laboratory will get tax and financing advantage.

title: EAME WEIGHING CHANGES lN HEADS
description: City Hall officials indicated yesterday that two or three agency heads might be replaced in the next 60 days as Mayor Beame presses for management. changes.

title: ConflictofInterest Spat Halts Approval of Carey's Nominees
description: ALBANY, June 8The New York Senate's Finance committee, which has virtually the last word on the confirmation of nominees to state jobs, is refusing to confirm a number of Governor Carey's nominees because of a dispute over the Governor's controversial conflictofinterest regulations.

title: 2 Professors Rebut Report of Monkeys Raising African Boy
description: BOSTON, June 8 (UPI)Two Boston professors say that an African boy rumored to have been raised by monkeys is mentally retarded and was not brought up in the wild but in various institutions.

title: Princeton Graduation: Warm and Placid
description: PRINCETON, June 8Orange and black gowns hung limply in the sultry morning air today as Princeton University graduated the largest class in its 230year history.

title: Harrises Lose Plea to Delay Trial on Coast for a Year
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8 (UPI)  William and Emily Harris have lost their appeal for a year's delay in their trial for an alleged crime spree with Patricia Hears.

title: Yew York Institute Plans to Establish Osteopathic College
description: OLD WESTBURY, LI., Jun 8A college of osteopathic medicine and surgery will be established at the New York Institute of Technology, th institute announced yesterday.

title: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries
description: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries

title: Municipal Unionist and Congressmen In Clash Over New York City Salaries
description: WASHLNGTON, June 8  A top New York City municipal labor leader met privately today with members of the New York City Congressional delegation who assailed him for using what they termed phony and misleading figures on municipal salaries and for holding out false hope of extension of Federal loans and a Federal takeover of welfare payments.

title: 5 INDICTED ON FRAUD IN INSURANCE FEES
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., June (UPI)A Federal grand jury indicted today five men in a nationwide insurance fraud with victims in at least six states. The indictment charged the defendants, two of them already in custody, with 34 counts of mail fraud and two counts of conspiracy to participate in racketeering activity.

title: Rumsfeld Clears Pentagon Aide of Conflict of Interest in Missile Program
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld today cleared Dr. Malcolm R. Currie, the director of defense research and engineering, of any conflict of interest in his involvement in a controversial missile program being pressed by Rockwell International.

title: Padres Blank Mets on 3 Hits
description: SAN DIEGO, June 8 Mickey Lolich of the Mets got another lesson tonight in the facts of life for pitchers you can't win without a little help from your friends.

title: 2 Professors Rebut Report of Monkeys Raising African Boy
description: BOSTON. June 8 (UPI)Two Boston professors say that an African boy rumored to have been raised by monkeys is mentally retarded and was not brought up in the wild but in various institutions.

title: Body Found in Bay
description: I The decomposed body of a woman, was found yesterday wrapped in a blanket and floating in Jamaica Bay, off North Channel Bridge in Howard Beach, Queens. The police said wire and a chain attached to a 10pound anchor had been bound around the victim, whose identity was unknown.

title: Church Cites Unlucky Events
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Sen ator Church, conceding defeat in the Ohio primary today, told about 200 of his followers that a series of unlucky events had prevented him from waging a, successful campaign in that spate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a student at CUNY, I found the decision by the Board of Higher Education to impose tuition disappointing and frustrating. Worse than that, however, is the prospect that, even with tuition, further cutbacks may be made in an already ailing university.

title: Prosecutor Seeks an Increase In the Bail Set for Rubin Carter
description: Burrell I. Humphreys, the Prosecutor in Passaic County, N. J., has reportedly filed a court motion to increase Rubin (Hurricane) Carter's bail and to impose more stringent restrictions on Mr. Carter's freedom to travel outside of New Jersey while awaiting trial on triplemurder charges.

title: News Groups Protesting Costs For the Democratic Convention
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) News organizations planning coverage of the Democratic National Convention in New York City on July 1216 protested to Democratic National Committee officials today about a variety of problems.

title: Business Records
description: Tuesday, June 8, 1976

title: Gonda and Muraskin Gain Westchester Final
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., June 8 The 6,544 yard Fenway Golf Club course was hit by 90degree heat, high humidity and few cooling winds today and the oppressive conditions took their toll on the eight survivors playing in the 57th Westchester amateur championship.

title: Buses to Nonpublic Schools Supported
description: The borough presidents of Manhattan and the Bronx visited central school headquarters yesterday to urge three members of the New York City Board of Education to continue bus service for 982 pupils who are transported at public expense from their homes in one borough to parochial schools in other boroughs and, in some instances, to schools in Nassau County. Emerging from the meeting later, Percy E. Sutton, the Manhattan Borough President, said, We failed.

title: PRICES HOLD FIRM IN BOND MARKET
description: The credit markets shifted into lower gear yesterday but Aid not stall. Investment bankars marketed a typically heavy Tuesday volume of new fixedincome issues, and though there were plenty of unsold securities left at the end of the day, prices held firm and the atmosphere of the marketplace was optimistic.

title: In memoriam
description: KARPJoseph. After thirteen years, still sorely missed.

title: Advertising
description: WASHINGTON June 8Violent programs on television could have a negative effect on the sales of products advertised within such presentations, a pilot consumer study by the J. Walter Thompson Company shows.

title: U.S. JURY CHARGES FALSE S.B.A. CLAIMS
description: A Manhattan businessman who formerly headed an insurance brokerage firm in Jeffersonville, N.Y., was indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges of making false statements to the Small Business Administration to obtain its guarantees of a fraudulent $450,000 loan from the First National Bank of Jeffersonville.

title: Reagan Celebrates
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8Ronald Reagan said tonight that his smashing victory over President Ford in the California primary laid to rest the accusation that he was no longer popular with Republicans in his home state.

title: LEBANON MAY GET TOKEN ARAB FORCE
description: CAIRO, Wednesday, June 9The Arab League, meeting here in emergency session last night and this morning, has decided to send a fourman delegation to Syria to propose a token Arab peacekeeping force as well as an immediate ceasefire and withdrawal of Syrian troops, according to informed sources here.

title: Notes on People
description: A soap opera actually ended, and happily, too, in Beverly Hills, Calif., yesterday, when Louise Lasser, star of television's Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman, was placed on a sixmonth drug education program after appearing in Municipal Court on a cocaine possession charge. The deadpan star of the hit soap opera spoof must return to court Dec. 1 for a progress report, and if she has successfully completed the probationary drug education program, as a first offender, all proceedings against her will be dropped. Miss Lasser was arrested May I in a boutique and a routine police search of her purse turned up a vial of white powder said to be cocaine. Yesterday's happy ending was greeted by Miss Lasser and the producers of Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman with relief, with relief.

title: HumphreyBrown Slate Appears Jersey Winner
description: With approximately one fifth of the statewide delegate votes counted from 5,085 precincts in the state, the statewide uncommitted candidates had received 55,000 votes, while Carter delegates won 40,000.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI)A Federal Trade Commission judge ruled today that the makers of a diet pill falsely advertised that users could lose weight while continuing to eat whatever they wanted. The product involved is called X11 Diet Tablets. In an unusual move, the decision by an administrative law judge, Daniel H. Hanscom, also found the drug store chain that sold the pills guilty the same offense.

title: The Secret of Success for FoodBuying Cooperatives
description: When it came the turn of a member of a small food buying coop to do the shopping, she bought some of those decorative little gourds, thinking the other members would be pleased to have them. They weren't.

title: Kennedys Plus Valentino Equal Magic
description: Three boys and two girls, some wearing Special Olympics Tshirts, did somersaults, backflips and handstands on three mats in the middle of the dance floor in the grand ballroom of the Hotel Pierre. The blacktie audience rose to its feet applauding, and Pat Kennedy Lawford, in her Paris dress by JeanLouis Scherrer, ran over to the children and kissed each one.

title: Crawdaddy Party Mirrors Magazine
description: Promises, promises, crawdaddy magazine, which with some justification thinks of itself as the first magazine to take rock music seriously, threw a 10th anniversary party for itself Monday night at the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater on Astor Place.

title: GENE WAYNE FENTON
description: Gene Wayne Fenton of Incline Village, Nev., a former security analyst for Oppenheimer & Co., Inc., New York, died. June 1 of acute myelogenous leukemia in the University of California Medical Center, San Francisco. His age was 46.

title: Arabs Seize Chicago Office To Protest Syrian Action
description: CHICAGO, June 8 (AP)About 30 Arab demonstrators, protesting the Syrian invasion of Lebanon, have taken over the Arab Information Center here and say they will remain peacefully in the office until tomorror.

title: FORD VICTOR IN JERSEY AND OHIO; CARTER IS SET BACK IN JERSEY; REAGAN, BROWN LEAD CALIFORNIA
description: President Ford scored convincing triumphs over Ronald Reagan in the Ohio and New Jersey primaries yesterday, but Mr. Reagan, the conservative former California Governor, was running far ahead in his home state.

title: HAYS'S VOTE IS LESS THAN IN EARLIER BIDS
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Wednesday, June 9Representative Wayne L. Hays, the powerful Ohio Congressman who has been implicated in a Washington payrollandsex inquiry, yesterday was running substantially behind his earlier performances against a perennial challenger in the Democratic primary.

title: Electability, Not Issues
description: Electability overshadowed stands on the issues or other personal qualities as a central factor in the Ohio and New Jersey Presidential primaries yesterday. Based News on samplings of sentiment among Analysis voters immediately after they cast their ballots, President Ford won substantial victories in Ohio and New Jersey because Republicans in the two states perceived him as a stronger contender than Ronald Reagan in the Nov. 2 election.

title: Orioles Draft Local Player
description: Dallas Williams, who will bat third and play center field today at Yankee Stadium, knew where to spend his lunch period yesterday at Lincoln High School.

title: Democrats Abroad Elect Six Delegates To the Convention
description: LONDON, June 8For the first time in history, members of the Democratic Party living abroad will have not only a voice but also real voting 6power at their quadrennial convention in New York City next month.

title: People in Sports
description: Joe Namath, who has grown accustomed to losing in the last several seasons with the Jets, lost again yesterday. His $2.5 million law suit against Sports Illustrated, regarding the unauthorized use of his picture in an advertisement, was rebuffed by the New York State Court of Appeals in Albany.

title: Florida Loses Benefits
description: WASHINGTON. June 8 (AP) The Labor Department announced today that payment of emergency extended unemployment benefits in Florida would end Saturday. Under the law, the emergency program ends in a state when the average rate of insured unemployment is less than 5 percent for 13 consecutive weeks. The Government said that the rate in Florida reached that level in the week ended May 22.

title: Confidence in Britain
description: Before the international rescue party put together a $5.3 billion lifeline to rescue sterling, the British pound had slid as low as $1.70. Yesterday, when word reached the market that help was on the way from the United States and other members of the rich men's club known as the Group of Ten, the pound ralliedto $1.80. The rich nations did not have do much actual buying. They had only to flash their roll of bills. Those who had gone short on the poundincluding many multinational corpora tions, who insist they act defensively, not to make a fast buckrushed to cover themselves by buying sterling. The market's psychology changed overnight.

title: FIGHTING INTENSE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 8Beirut was in a state of siege today, and Western diplomats reported that a large force of Syrian troops, armor and artillery had moved into Lebanon in 24 hours, perhaps doubling to 12,000 the number of Syrian regulars in the country.

title: And Treat Those Two Imposters
description: Another thing I've learned, George Foreman said, disaster and triumph you gotta take em both the same because they're both imposters.

title: Most Dangerous Game
description: MUNICH, West GermanyThe greatest eventual danger spot on the European horizon is Yugoslavia, not Italy, Portugal or Spain. While the subject is rarely discussed, it has long been recognized as an almost inescapable source of future tension.

title: N.B.A. Draft Selections
description: N.B.A. Draft Selections

title: CORRECTION
description: In the obituary of Julia Murray Cuddihy, former president of the Catholic Big Sisters, in The Times Monday it was erroneously stated that she was a daughter of the late Thomas E. Murray, former chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission. Mrs. Cuddihy was a sister of Mr. Murray.

title: A NotSoTall Ship Is First At Bermuda
description: The Tall Ships, which will he on display during the Fourth of July weekend in New York Harbor and at Newport, R.I., the last week of June, are coming closer to the United States each day. The second of three races across the Atlantic Ocean, from Tenerife in the Canary Islands 2,530 miles to Bermuda, began to end yesterday with the first vessel reaching Bermuda.

title: Lack of Funds Curbs Old New York Plans
description: The July 4th in Old New York Festival, what was to have been a threeday, manyfaceted celebration of the Bicentennial, has been scaled down, its budget reduced from a planned $250,000 to $130,000 because of an unexpected lack of financial support from the city's corporate community.

title: Udall Concedes in Ohio
description: CLEVELAND, June 8Representative Udall came into the ballroom in the Holiday Inn here, where a small crowd of supporters and staff greeted him with applause and shouts of Go, Mo!

title: How to Seek City U. Tuition Assistance
description: After months of wrangling over whether the policy of free tuition could survive at the City University as it enters a period of financial austerity, the Board of Higher Education last week approved the charging of tuition to undergraduate students next fall. Charges of $750 a year for freshmen and sophomores and $900 for juniors and seniors the same rates as at the State University are virtually assured.

title: RALLY IN ANGOLA TO SUPPORT TRIM
description: LUANDA, Angola, June 8The Angolan Government today scheduled a mass rally for tomorrow afternoon to show support for the forthcoming trial of two Americans and 11 other foreigners as mercenaries in the recent civil war.

title: VINCENT MURPHY, LABOR LEADER, 83
description: Vincent J. Murphy, the longtime New Jersey labor leader and former Mayor of Newark, dled yesterday at his home in Spring Lake, N.J. He was 83 years old.

title: BOB FEERICK DIES; A BASKETBALL STAR
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 8 (UPI)Bob Feerick, former basketball star and general manager of the Golden State Warriors of the National Basketball Association, died today of a heart attack at the age of 56.

title: Electability, Not Issues
description: Electability overshadowed stands on the issues or other personal qualities as a central factor in the Ohio and New Jersey Presidential primaries yesterday. Based on samplings of sentiment among voters immediately after they cast their ballots, President Ford won substantial victories in Ohio and New Jersey because Republicans in the two states perceived him as a stronger contender than Ronald Reagan in the Nov. 2 election.

title: Military Accused of Bias in Recruiting
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The four major military services discriminate against potential black recruits to keep the armed forces from attracting more blacks than commanding generals believe the officers can handle, a military manpower specialist says.

title: CARTER SCORES DELEGATE GAINS, WINS OHIO, IS BEATEN IN JERSEY;
description: Jimmy Carter won a landslide victory in Ohio yesterday that gave him more than 100 delegates in that state alone and a gain of more than 200 in the day's three Democratic Presidential primaries.

title: Reynolds Metals Says It Made Contributions
description: The Reynolds Metal Company announced that it had made political contributions in four countries and that it believed they were properly authorized and permissible under applicable law.

title: Walter Field, 101, Dies; Acted in 2,000 Films
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 8 (UPI) Walter Field, the oldest American motion picture actor, died on Saturday. He was 101 years old. A veteran of more than 2,000 movies, Mr. Field last worked in an episode of television's Medical Center.

title: Israel Unruffled As Syria Steps Up Drive in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, June 8Israel remained calm today as Syrian forces pushed farther into Lebanon, and Defense Minister Shimon Peres raid the Israeli Government had acted properly in deciding not to intervene at this points.

title: Aide to Ford Says Race Remains Fluid
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  A Ford campaign official said tonight that the race for the Republican Presidential nomination remained fluid after the primary elections today and predicted that it would go right down to the wire.

title: PRICES IRREGULAR IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market finished mostly lower yesterday in continued light trading.

title: Freshrnen on G.O.P. Hit List Facing an Unpredictable Future
description: WASHINGTON, June 8It has been 18 months since they were swept into office in the aftermath of Watergate, some from districts that had never before sent a Democrat to the House of Representatives.

title: Yankees And Ellis Triumph
description: Tommy Davis, who had expected to arrive at Yankee Stadium nearly two months ago as the Yankees designated hitter, finally reached the park last nightas the California Angels designated hitter.

title: Borek Paces Trials
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 8Gene Borek qualified for the United States Open golf championship for the ninth time today and said, I always work a little harder for this. After all, it is the national championship.

title: New Books
description: A New Life of Anton Chekhov, by Ronald Hingley (Knopf. $12.50).

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A block of four 24cent 1918 United States airmail stamps with the airplane printed inverted was sold at auction for $170,000 at the New York galleries of the H. R. Harmer Organization, 6 West 48th Street. A spokesman for the galleries said that the price was the highest ever paid for a United States stamp item. He said the block, which had been owned by Princeton University, was sold to the Raymond H. Weill Company, New Orleans dealers. Only four similar blocks of the same stamps are known to exist, the spokesman said.

title: Silverio Breaks School Record
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 8 Manny Silverio of North Bergen, N.J., bettered his national scholastic record and retained his title in the 16pound hammer throw tonight in the opening of the Amateur Athletic Union junior track and field championships at the University of Tennessee's Tom Black Stadium.

title: Rumsfeld Meets Australian
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) Australia's Defense Minister'James Killen, and Secretary of Defense Donald H. Rumsfeld today discussed how to intensify aerial surveillance of Soviet fleet operations in the Indian Ocean.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Pound Up 4c to 1.80 Before 1.77 Close; Swiss Central Bank Actsto Curb Franc
description: GENEVA, June 8The Swiss National Bank ordered a series of measures today in the hope of clipping the wings of the highflying Swiss franc, which has become the despair of the nation's export and tourist industries.

title: Genoa Prosecutor, A Foe of Extremists, And 2 Aides Slain
description: GENOA, Italy, June 8 (AP)Genoa's state's attorney, long a foe of leftwing extremists, was shot to death on a busy downtown street today, just 12 days before Italy's crucial national elections. His bodyguard and his driver also were slain.

title: Shortfall Attributed to Dry Weather
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP)The Agriculture Departmtnt said today that the Soviet Union's 1976 grain harvest was likely to fall short of Moscow's goal of 205 million metric tons.

title: Corn Futures Drop on Profit Taking
description: In trading described as hectic and gyrating wildly in price. wheat and soybean prices yesterday continued their strong showing of the preceding day.

title: About Education
description: Benjamin S. Bloom, the University of Chicago educational researcher has begun a new attack on the widespread assumption that schools can do relatively little to counteract the adverse effects on learning of home and neighborhood environments.

title: WINE TALK
description: Several California white wines triumphed over some of the best Burgundy has to offer in a blind tasting in Paris recently. More startling:

title: FIGHTING INTENSE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 8Beirut was in a state of siege today, and Western diplomats reported that a large force of Syrian troops, armors and artillery had moved into Lebanon In 24 hours, perhaps doubling to 12,000 the number of Syrian regulars in the country.

title: William Palmer Dies at 61; Lord & Taylor Soup Bar Chef
description: William L. Palmer, the chef at the 10thfloor soup bar of Lord & Taylor's Fifth Avenue store, died Sunday at his home in East Elmhurst, Queens. He was 61 years old and lived at 3244 103d Street.

title: Decision On Orr Delayed
description: MONTREAL, June 8The Bobby Orr situation remained in limbo today. After allday negotiations at the National Hockey League meetings, the only news that Alan Eagleson, the agent for the star defenseman, could offer was that Orr, a free agent, had narrowed his alternatives to just one hockey club, the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: Judge Lord Was Right
description: Five months ago a United States Court of Appeals disqualified District Court Judge Miles Lord from taking further part in the case of the Reserve Mining Company because of his alleged gross bias. The higher court may have had a point about the judge's emotionalism in denouncing the way the company had, in his view, frustrated the conclusions which had to be arrived at but the conclusions themselves continue to be persuasive.

title: PARENT OF S. & RULED INSOLVENT
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 8A state judge today declared the Bankers Trust Company, corporate parent of the financially troubled Bankers Trust Savings and Loan Association, insolvent. He appointed a receiver to preserve the assets of the comnanv.

title: State Monitor Questions Municipal Hospital Cuts
description: New York State's special deputy comptroller monitoring New York City's austerity program said yesterday that $75.7 million of the $101.2 million in budget cuts proposed for the municipal hospitals could not be counted on because of a lack of detailed plans and uncertainty over closing down facilities.

title: Now for the Playoffs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 8The primary elections, over at last, have turned out better than most critics of the system predicted. They, have not settled everything but they cut out all the extremists except Ronald Reagan, gave the power of decision back to the people, and brought forward a striking new personality in former Governor Carter of Georgia.

title: Ohio Gives Ford and Carter Big Victories They Sought
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 8President Ford and former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia swept Ohio today in Presidential primaries considered to be of maim importance to both.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. California Angels, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx. 8 P.M. (RadioWaICA, 7:55 P.M.)

title: Ashe Wins 2 Sets, Then Falls to Taroczy
description: PARIS, June 8  Arthur Ashe, the world's No. 1 player, was beaten by his former ball boy and a pair of claycourt experts Eddie Dibbs and Harold Solomon, reached the quarterfinals of the $120,000 French open tennis championships tonight. Kathy Kuykendall, the last American woman in the tournament, was ousted.

title: Music: Dianne Chilgren at the Piano
description: Dianne Chilgren played a program of French keyboard music in Carnegie Recital Hall on Monday night and made it particularly attractive by including works that are too seldom heard nowadays. Along with such repertory staples as Ravel's Gaspard de la Nuit and Toccata there were Roussel's Sonatine (Op. 16). Poulenc's threepart Napoli Suite and three excerpts from Chabrier's Pieces Pittoresques. Rameau's Gavotte with Variations in A minor and Faure's Nocturne No. 6 in D flat (Op. 63) slightly less novel.

title: U.S., ISREAL LEAVE AS P.L.O. SPEAKS
description: GENEVA, June 8The American and Israeli delegations walked out of the International Labor Organization's World Employment Conference here today when an observer from the Palestine Liberation Organization rose to speak.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: An upstate New York consumer organization has petitioned the United States Product Safety Commission for a ban on Bounce, Procter & Gamble's new type of fabric softener.

title: Onion Sandwiches: A Memorable Whimsy of Humble Origin
description: There are many foods in this world indelibly inscribed in our memory, and the gamut goes, almost without saying, from the ridiculous to the sublime.

title: Sets Win Fourth Straight
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 8The New York Sets defeated the Indiana Loves, 2521, in overtime tonight for their fourth straight victory in World Team Tennis. Virginia Wade and Billie Jean King clinched the victory by taking the women's doubles.

title: VINCENT MURPHY, LABOR LEADER, 83
description: Vincent J. Murphy, the longtime New Jersey labor leader and former Mayor of Newark, died yesterday at his home in Spring Lake, N.J. He was 83 years old.

title: Brown and Reagan Are Victors in California Primary
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8Ronald Reagan and Edmund G. Brown Jr. won the Republican and Democratic Presidential primaries today in the state where both had been elected Governor.

title: About New York
description: Five airplanes, flying as one, inscribed a message across the sunwashed blue sky at Brighton Beach last Saturday.

title: HumphreyBrown Slate Victorious in New Jersey
description: The uncommitted delegates supporting Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesotk and Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California won an upset victory over Jimmy Garter yesterday in New Jersey's Democratic Presidential primary.

title: Carter Says 3 Active Rivals Think He Will Be Nominee
description: ATLANTA, June 8Jimmy Carter said today that he spoke by telephone late this afternoon, to most of his rivals for the Democratic Presidential nomination and that they had indicated a belief that he would be the nominee.

title: January, Zarley Qualify
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 8 (UPI)Don January and Kermit Zarley finished with 136 totals today to lead a group of 54 players qualifying for next week's United States Open golf championship in Atlanta.

title: Grim Report on Cyprus
description: Though clothed in diplomatic language, Secretary General Waldheim's semiannual report to the Security Council on the United Nations operation on Cyprus makes grim reading. After citing the increasing difficulties encountered by the United Nations forcesknown as UNFICYPin gaining access to Greek Cypriots remaining in the Turkishoccupied northern part of the island, Dr. Waldheim sums up:

title: Arab Reversals
description: In a swift and ironic reversal that none could have foreseen a few short months ago, Syria's President Assad suddenly finds himself in awkward estrangement from his Arab colleaguesjust the isolation that he so relished inflicting on his archrival, President Sadat of Egypt.

title: Democrats Cancel Picnic On Gracie Mansion Lawn
description: Undaunted by the usual ha zards of red ants and rain, al deluxe $125aplasticplate picnic sponsored by the Democratic State Committee on the lawn of Gracie Mansion, scheduled for next Monday, foun dered yesterday on another hazardRepublicans.

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
description: Major League Box Scores and Standings

title: State Dinner for Elizabeth Will Be on PBS on July 7
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Public Broadcasting Service will televise, live, the White House state dinner for Queen Elizabeth II on July 7. The threehour program will follow the royal party throughout the eveningfrom the departure from Blair House through the arrival at the White House, the receiving line, the formal dinner, with its toasts by the two heads of state and the entertainment. The cameras may even catch a glimpse of the Queen dancing the first foxtrot with President Ford.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: BEAME WEIGHING CHANGES IN HEADS OF SOME AGENCIES
description: City Hall officials indicated yesterday that two or three agency heads might be replaced in the next 60 days as Mayor Beame presses for management changes.

title: LOANS IN 5 MONTHS SET AN I.M.F. RECORD
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) Loans by the International Monetary Fund to nations with special financing problems, primarily poor nations, reached record level during the first five months of this year, the institution said today.

title: TIMES POLLS 5,681 IN THE 3 PRIMARIES
description: The New York Times polled 5,681 voters yesterday in the three primary election statesOhio, California and New Jersey.

title: Saharan Rebels Stage 2 Raids Inside Capital of Mauritania
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, Wednesday, June 9 (Agence FrancePresse)Guerrillas demanding independence for the former Spanish Saharan territory that Mauritania and Morocco have divided attacked this capital twice yesterday.

title: New York City Cracks Down on DirectLease Day Care Centers
description: The New York City administration has begun to oracle down on the muchcriticized direct  lease daycare centers. Landlords of 17 centers containing major building defects are to be ordered to correct them under threat by the city of withholding of rents and an attempt to cancel their leases.

title: CUNY: Political Hostage
description: The political game plan fielded by State Senator Warren M. Anderson, Republican majority leader, offers a choice between two devastating alternatives.

title: Wildcatters Sink 83% of Wells, Lag in Finding Oil, Study Says
description: Wildcatters and other independents sink 83 percent of the exploratory wells, but the major oil companies have discovered most of the oil and gas reserves of the United States, a petroleum econ'omist. John Lichtblau, said yesterday.

title: Market Place
description: Prior to 1973, the manufacturers of auto replacement parts strung together years of steadily rising profits, and Wall Street bestowed upon them the mantle of growth stocks.

title: Shinn Comments on Budget
description: Richard R. Shinn, the businessman who heads Mayor Beame's Management Advisory Board, questioned last night whether the city's budget could be effectively balanced in the threeyear period allotted under the emergency financial plan devised last year.

title: Experts in Europe Question U.S. Plan For Mass Flu Shots
description: GENEVA, June 7A number of European public health specialists are seriously questioning the wisdom of the American plan to immunize almost the entire population with a new influenza vaccine.

title: TEACHERS AT CITY U. SUPPORTED ON FUNDS
description: Members of the faculty at City University, meeting to protest the political stalemate that has kept the university closed since 111ay 28, were urged yesterday to continue to fight for increased state financing for next year.

title: Pickles Aren't the Only Use For Cool, Clean, Airy Dill
description: Say dill to most Americans, and chances are the instantaneous word association will be pickles. As much as one may prize that cold, crisp and tangy specialty, to limit dill to that use is to sell short one of the most sweetly and gently odoriferous of herbs. And though dill may lack the status accorded tarragon and chervil, oregano and basil, its fresh air flavor, reminiscent of country mornings and cool spring water, lends itself to far wider uses than the more overpowering French and Italian favorites.

title: Now for Elderly in France, Help at Home, Fun Outside
description: ISSY  LES  MOULINEAUN FranceLike 77yearold Natalie Nicoll, who has learned to joke and to complain again, hundreds of lonely old people in this gray Perk suburb are being gradually coaxed out of isolation and depression without fear that they will be placed in state homes for the aged.

title: Carter and Israel: He Goes Almost the Distance on U.S. Support and Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Jimmy Carter has defined a series of positions on the Middle East that add up to a nearly complete list of what Israelis and American supporters of Israel like to hear. His idea, as it News emerged in a Analysis speech to Jewish leaders in New Jersey Sunday, is to make the United States com mitment to the survival of Isthatso solid and so unequivocal that the Israelis would have the confidence to relinquish occuSpied Arab territory. With the prospect of having territory returned, the Arabs would be ready to make peace with Israel. The two sides, in Mr. Carter'g view, would reach a geheral peace settlement, which would then be carried out in stages over a period of years as each came to trust the other a little more.

title: Fashion Gets a Line On Linemen
description: The idea of fashion inspired by linementhose workers who get their high by clambering skyward to install and repair utility equipmentmay strike some people as nothing more than puton.

title: SOVIET ARMS HELP IN BEIRUT DOUBTED
description: BRUSSELS June 8Accoraing to high NATO sources, there is no evidence that the Soviet Union has launched any special supply runs to the belligerents in Lebanon as it did to Egypt and Syria when the 1973 Middle Eastern war began.

title: Subatomic Particle ManifestingCharm Reported on Coast
description: A new subatomic particle that physicists believe has the characteristic of charm has been discovered in experiments at the University of California's Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory, and the Stanford Linear Accelerator Center.

title: Corporate Affairs
description: Litwin S.A. a Parisbased subsidiary of Amtel Inc. has been awarded a contract of more than $40 million to supply the materials and to supervise construction of gasolineprocessing plant in the Soviat Union.

title: COALITION ATTACKS GRAND JURY SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON June 8 (AP) A coalition of lawyers, politicians and church groups criticized the Federal grand jury system today, saying that it had become a Government sword against the people.

title: Lack of Funds Perils Shins Visit to Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, June 8 (AP)Plans for the visit of foreign vessels here during the Bicentennial are in jeopardy because of a snortage of funds, recording to a committee planning the visits.

title: Mother of Two Girls in Custody Case Asks for Word of Their Whereabouts
description: MINEOLA. L.I., June 8The natural mother of two girls missing from a temporary foster home since last Friday called a news conference today to plead for their return and give her side or the story.

title: Freshmen on G.O.P. Hit List Facing an Unpredictable Future
description: WASHINGTON, June 8It has been 18 months since they were swept into office in the aftermath of Watergate, some from districts that had never before sent a Democrat to the House of Representatives.

title: Speedy Marsha Wins Sire Trot
description: WESTBURY, L.I., June 8Meadows Image, a 3yearold trotting filly who had earnings of only $638 from two previous career starts, enabled her owners, George and Helen Kessler of Holland Patent, N.Y., to acquire a windfall tonight.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's biggest charity game, exhibiting the subdividing facility of an amoeba, was played Tuesday night, with a nucleus at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel and an oftshoot at the Old Oaks Country Club in Purchase N.Y. The result was a profit of some $30,000 for the U.J.A.Federation of Jewish Philanthtopies, and a triumph for the organizers, Tubby Stayman and Marilyn Krulwich in Manhattan and Barbara Schwartz in Westchester County.

title: Roosevelt Raceway Results
description: Roosevelt Raceway Results

title: NASA Studies Water Quality
description: HOUSTON (UPI)Scientists at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration say new techniques developed to detect microorganizations in water systems on manned spacecraft can he used to spot harmful bacteria in municipal water supplies. Officials plan to incorporate the new processes in a system that the space agency is developing to monitor Water quality electronically.

title: Arco Gasoline Price Up 1c
description: The Atlantic Richfield Company announced yesterday a gasoline price rise of 1 cent a gallon in all marketing areas. The increase is in accordance with Federal Energy Administration regulations allowing partial recovery of higher raw material and other costs, Arco said.

title: Campaign Fund That Gives Women Candidates a Lift
description: Several dozen women (and 11 men) decided the other evening that it was a special scandal in the Bicentennial that there were no women in the United States Senate or Supreme Court.

title: Blast in Washington Hits Yugoslav Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, June 9 (AP)An explosion apparently caused by a bomb rocked the Yugoslav Embassy here shortly after midnight today, the police reported. One person suffered a minor injury.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Decolonization Committee 3 P.M.

title: Rhodesian Tribal Leader Kidnapped by Guerrillas
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia June 8 (UPI) Black Nationalist guerrillas have kidnapped one of Rhodesia's senior tribal chiefs near the area where three whites were killed in weekend attacks, Internal Affairs Minister Jack Musset said today.

title: Finger Lakes Results
description: Finger Lakes Results

title: ExRep. William M. Citron Of Connecticut Dead at 79
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., June 8 (AP)William Michael Citron of Middletown, former Democratic United States Representative from Connecticut, died Monday in Titusville, Fla. He Was 79 years old.

title: Jersey Told Its Economy Trails in U.S. Recovery
description: TRENTON, June 8The Department of Labor and Industry reported today that the state's economic recovery continued to lag behind the nation's but that there should be a quickening of the pace of recovery in the rest of the year.

title: 2 Die in School Bus Crash
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, June 8 (UPI) Two persons were killed and 17 injured, two seriously, when a minischool bus carrying students to a school for the mentally retarded collided with a car, hit a steel pole and overturned today on the city's west side. The police said that the driver and a student were killed. They were not immediately identified.

title: 2 J.D.L. MEMBERS SEIZED BY F.B.I.
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced yesterday the arrest shortly after midnight of two young members of the Jewish Defense League and a New Jersey fleamarket operator who allegedly supplied them with explosives.

title: Electronic Pipe Organs Distressing to Biggs
description: E. Power Biggs, an elder statesman of the music world whose indefatigable labors over nearly half a century have made his name almost synonymous with organplaying, came down to New York from his home in Cambridge, Mass., on Monday to deliver himself of some tart opinions on the pipeorgan situation in New York concert halls. Invited here by the New York chapter of the American Guild of Organists, he spoke at a public session on the subject held at Holy. Trinity Church on Central Park West.

title: Change Game, Veeck Urges
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 8Bill Veeck, the selfstyled 62  year  old scuffler with one leg who can't see or hear, ignored his disabilities today to take a few wild swings at the Establishment.

title: IRA CONSTANT
description: Ira Constant of Haworth, N. J., who retired in 1971 as advertising manager of La Roche Laboratories, Nutley, and as director of creative services of HoffmannLa Roche, Nutley, died in Pascack Valley Hospital, Westwood, Sunday. He was 69 years old.

title: HEARING WEIGHS ROSENSTIEL WILL
description: MIAMI, June 8Two physicians declared in Dade County Probate Court today that the late financier Lewis S. Rosenstiel, who had been their patient, was unable to comprefiend the terms of a codicil signed six weeks before his death that changed the terms of his will.

title: Morgan Gets 2 Homers Again, Helps Reds Defeat Pirates, 105
description: Joe Morgan, the National League's most valuable player last year and the leading votegetter in early balloting for this year's AllStar game, is becoming something he's never been in his 13 years of pro balla homerun hitter.

title: Brezhnev Complains of an Increase in Efforts to Hamper Detente
description: MOSCOW, June 8The Soviet party chief, Leonid I. Brezhnev, complained today of noticeable increase in efforts abroad to hamper EastWest accommodation and declared that the Soviet Union was fully determined to oppose such a trend.

title: Decency and Courage Amid Lebanese Horror
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 6There are no prisoners in the Lebanese civil war. A prisoner is put to deathoften slowly. Many have been mutilated before or after death.

title: Loan for Cannery in Ghana
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI)  Approval of a $600,000 loan to help build a $1.3 million tuna cannery in the African nation of Ghana was announced today by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, a Federal agency. The loan will go to Pioneer Food Cannery Ltd., in which StarKist International, a wholly owned subsidiary of the H.J. Holnz Company, has a 50 percent interest.

title: Eleanor Parker Resigns From Pal Joey
description: For the second time in as many days, a star performer Eleanor Parkerhas left the cast of Pal Joey, the Rodgers and Hart musical that had been scheduled to open at the Circle in the Square on June 17.

title: Banks Seldom Balk at Boycott by Arabs
description: WASHINGTON. June 8American banks have recently complied with thousands of Arab requests to participate in transactions involving the economic boycott of Israel, a Cornmerce Department official told Congress today.

title: HELEN DE HUENE
description: Baroness Helen HoyningenHuene, a fashion designer under the name Helen de Huene. died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital. She was 81 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Beirut was in a state of siege with continued shelling and fighting in the Moslem neighborhoods of the Lebanese capital. Western diplomats reported more Syrian troops armor and artillery entering the country. President Hafez alAssad seems to have withheld an allout attack. A high level delegation representing Syria, Libya, Algeria and the Palestine guerrilla movement arrived in Beirut on a mission to defuse the crisis between Syrian and Palestinian forces. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: Californians Vote 2 to 1 Against Nuclear Curbs
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8A controversial plan for limiting construction of nuclear power plants in California was turned down by the voters, returns tonight indicated. The results were about 2 to 1 against the measure, which was placed on the ballot as Proposition 15 by petitions signed by voters.

title: Experts in Europe Question U.S. Plan For Mass Flu Shots
description: GENEVA, June 7A number of European public health specialists are seriously questioning the wisdom of the American plan to immunize almost the entire population with a new influenza vaccine.

title: NEW DATA FOUND IN C.I.A. PROJECT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 8The Central Intelligence Agency has found additional records on 2,000 persons whose mail was opened in its mail interception program after it had informed a court here six months ago that a search of its files had been complete.

title: Getty's Will Filed; The Specific Value Of Estate Not Given
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8 (UPI) The will of J. Paul Getty was filed today for probate and his estate was valued at more than $1 million. The exact total was not soecified.

title: About Real Estate
description: Last October Mayor Beame announced that the city could rot finance the construction of a new convention and exhibition center on the Hudson River between 93d and 47th Streets. He asked the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to do a study of situating the center within the northern portion of Battery Park City downtown.

title: ELEANOR G. COLT, LABOR SPECIALIST
description: Eleanor G. Coit a specialist) in labor education, died Monray at Mary Hitchcock Meorial Hospital, Hanover, N. H. She was 82 years old and lived at 69 Fifth Avenue.

title: Dow Rises 1.88 in Light Trading
description: A fire drill that delayed the opening of New York Stock Exchange trading 15 minutes was among the market's highlights yesterday as investors appeared to await the results of the last three Presidential primaries.

title: EXIMBANK MAPS NEW SET OF RULES
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The ExportImport Bank announced today a new set of international rules for governmentassisted export credits that the other leading industrial nations are expected to follow.

title: Assad Gives Assent
description: DAMASCUS, Syria. June 9Syria said today that it had agreed to the stationing of some troops from other Arab nations in Lebanon to help establish a durable truce.

title: State Report Cites Savings in Welfare In New York City
description: A state report yesterday credited New York City with recent significant achievements in speeding up closings of welfare cases, but said that more savings of $10.5 million to $13 million a year could still be made.

title: A Company Evicted At Bronx Terminal Is Leaving the City
description: The Goodie Brand Packing, Corporation, leader of insurgent merchants at the Bronx; Terminal Market, announced yesterday that it would leave New York City, taking with it 100 jobs.

title: The Sound of Music Boxes
description: Thomas Edison's invention of the phonograph dealt a heavy blow to the musicbox industry as home entertainment. Today the music box is valued mostly as a collector's item or as a gift. It shows up in antique, gift, music and toy shops as well as at department stores, but probably the best sources in New York City are G. Schirmerwhich regularly stocks 250 styles of contemporary modelsand Rita Ford Inc., where the emphasis is on antiques.

title: Panel Would Limit Tax Bureau In Giving Data to U. S. Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The power of Government agencies to collect personal information about individuals from Internal Revenue Service data should be restricted and defined by law, a Federal commission said in a report released today.

title: MADRID LEGALIZES POLITICAL PARTIES
description: MADRID. June 9Parliament today approved a bill today to legalize political parties, which have been forbidden since 1939.

title: Three Quit Women's Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) President Ford announced today that he had accepted the resignation of three members of the National Commission on the Observance of International Women's Year 1975. Resigning were Barbara Bergmann of College Park, Md.: Maryl S. Coleman of Lansing, Mich., and William C. Mercer of Boston.

title: A Blue Cross Step
description: The Blue Cross Association said yesterday that it had taken a first step toward extending full coverage to its subscribers for comprehensive, nonhospital treatment of alcoholism, a major public health problem that afflicts an estimated nine million Americans.

title: SHIFT TO GEORGIAN
description: Opposition to Jimmy Carter's candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination crumbled yesterday, and he appeared to be assured of victory on the first ballot next month.

title: It Was a Day for Tourists in the Big City
description: John Mueller was shooting the interior of St. Patrick's Cathedral at onequarter of a second at f2. Walter Joseph was listening to a steeldrum player in Times Square run through Strangers in the Night, and Bernard Ianelli, squinting into the afternoon sun, was waiting for his chance to board a Circle Line boat for a cruise around Manhattan.

title: At Rockefeller University, Graduation Is Ph. D.Day
description: The well  ordered, disciplined anarchy that is Rockefeller University graduated 17 Ph.D.'s yesterday and celebrated its 75th anniversary in yet another demonstration of the adage that the best things in life are free.

title: Ford on Shaky Ground
description: President Ford did about as well as expected in the final round of primaries, but his best was inadequate to the task of crushing Ronald Reagan's challenge.

title: Swedish Runner Wins
description: STOCKHOLM, June 9 (UPI) Anders Gaerderud, Sweden's world recordholder in the 3,000meter steeplechase, established the fastest time in the world this year when he won his specialty in 8 minutes 15.2 seconds today. It was also the first time that five competitors crossed the finish line in less than 8:20. Gaerderud set the world record of 8:09.8 last year.

title: Carter Is Rated as No. 1 By London Bookmaker
description: LONDON, June 9 (AP)Britain's major bookmaker, Ladbroke's, reported today that bets totaling $200,000 have been placed with the organization on Jimmy Carter to become the next President of the United States. A spokesman said bets on all candidates totaled $500,000.

title: Carter Is Rated as No.1 By London Bookmaker
description: LONDON, June 9 (AP)Britain's major bookmaker, Ladbroke's, reported today that bets totaling $200,000 have been placed with the organization on Jimmy Carter to become the next President of the United States. A spokesman said bets on all candidates totaled $500,000.

title: Booksellers See Continued Rise in Sale of Paperbacks
description: CHICAGO, June 9Cheared by increasing book sales, members of the American Bonk Sellers Association gathered here this week to look at the long list of new titles coming out next fall and to be told how to persuade the American public to read more books  anybody's hooks  in the coming year.

title: Output of Gasoline Climbs to a Record; Inventories Also Up
description: Gasoline production in the United States rose to a record of 7.24 million barrels a day in the latest week, pushing the nation's stocks of motor fuel higher despite the vacation driving as a result of the MemorialDay holiday.

title: Maine Backs Referendum To Save Bigelow Mountain
description: AUGUSTA, Ma., June 9 (UPI) Bigelow Mountain, whioh a Massachusetts company wanted to develop into a ski resort, will be preserved, and the group that fought for preservation will stay together until the land is acquired by the state.

title: New Bond Issues
description: New Bond Issues

title: G:M.A.C. OFFERING BOUGHT BRISKLY
description: The credit markets, after dawdling along this week with out mush sense of direction gained strength yesterday afternoon. The General Motors Acceptance Corporation's $300 million of debentures and notes that were priced late Tuesday ap peared virtually all sold late yesterday afternoon, and Maryland's big new 5175 mi'lion issue of taxexempt bonds was estimated almost 90 percent sold.Credit Markets

title: Abandoned School in Queens Lives Again as Arts Complex
description: With a $150,000 loan from a large bank and help from New York City. Federal, state and neighborhood agencies, an abandoned public school in Queens has become an exhibition and studio center for some of the country's most experimental artists.

title: Times Names Diplomatic Reporter
description: The appointment of Flora Lewis. Paris bureau chief of The New York Times, to the additional post of European diplomatic correspondent of The Times, has been announced by A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor.

title: U.S. and Panama Report Progress in Canal Talks
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 9The United States and Panama today reported significant progress in negotiations for a new canal treaty and pledged a most serious effort to achieve such a treaty as promptly as possible.

title: Planner Sees Improvement In Industrial Development
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, June 9A state planning official forecast today an improvement in conditions that have sometimes discouraged or impeded industrial development in. New Jersey.

title: Teacher Strike of 75 May Cost New York $20 Million in Aid
description: Last fall's fiveday strike by teachers could cost the finandaily hardpressed New York City school system an unexpected loss of $20 million in state aid next year, according to calculations by city school authorities.

title: A.T.&T. Is Ordered To Compensate Man For Lost Promotion
description: WASHINGTON June 9 (AP)A Federal judge ruled today that American Telephone and Telegraph Company must compensate a male employee for passing over him to promote lessexperienced woman in order to correct its past discrimination against women.

title: Books of The Times
description: Flacking for the BookoftheMonth Club in 1967. Gilbert Highet said of. The Chinese Looking Glass': I never believed that anybody could equal John Gunther in writing an Inside book, but Dennis Bloodworth has done it. Perhaps this was intended as praise. If so, it stands up, applying just as well to The Chinese Machiavelli, which Mr. Bloodworth,. Far East correspondent for The London Observer, has coauthored with his wife, Ching Ping Bloodworth, daughter of SunYatsen's senior personal secretary. At a pace of roughly 10 pages a century, with the ordinary reader in mind, The Chinese Machiavelli is a long march over Szechuans of anecdote.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical error, the report in yesterday's Times of the resignation of Thomas E. Kauper as head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division incorrectly said he was leaving because he felt he had not received sufficient support from Attorney General Edward H. Levi or from President Ford. Mr. Kauper said he was resigning solely to return to teaching at the University of Michigan Law School.

title: Recital: Serkin Celebrates 40 Years
description: After a couple of postponements owing to illness, Rudolf Serkin finally celebrated the 40th anniversary of his New York debut last night, with a recital at Kaufmann Hall of the 9. Street Young Men'sYoung Women's Hebrew Association. Mr. Serkin, economical as ever, played just three piecesif, that is, you regard the 24 Preludes of Chopin as one monster of a work, as he does.

title: The Screen:'Deep Red' Is a Bucket of Ax-Murder Cliches
description: "Deep Red," which opened yesterday at the Cinerama, 86th Street Twin I and other theaters, is an English-dubbed Italian-made bucket of ax-murder-movie clichs thoroughly soaked in red paint that seems intended to represent fake blood. I don't think that Dario Argento, the director, meant to distance us from the action in this way. He's simply a director of incomparable incompetence.In the leading role David Hemmings, the English actor, looks wan and in need of a vacation from Rome's off-screen high life. He plays a music teacher whose friends and acquaintances keep getting hacked up, thus interrupting his composing.The bill at the RKO 86th Street Twin 1 Theater also includes a terribly self-congratulatory Gulf Oil Corporation industrial film, which is about as boring as industrial films can ever be, and during the intermission the management turns its stereo speakers to radio station WTFM so that the audience can listen to music and commercials for Pepperidge Farm French dinner rolls.

title: Phone Calls No Joke For Onondaga County
description: SYRACUSE, June 9 (AP)Onondaga County employees have been found to be making as many as 100 longdistance calls a month on government telephones to DialAJoke in New York city. That was one finding in a recent investigation by the county into how employees use the telephone during work hours.

title: Syria Reported Putting More Troops Near Lebano
description: WASHINGTON, June 9Faced with increased opposition to its intervention in Lebanon, Syria was reported today to have moved several thousand more troops up to the Lemanese border.

title: TRUCE IN LEBANON URGED BY SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, June 9 (Reuters) The Soviet Union called today for an end to foreign intervention in the Lebanese war and demanded an immediate ceasefire.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: BANGKOK, Thailand  Putt Lawlek, 143 pounds, Thailand, knocked out Sperling Bangkaribaun, 140, Indonesia, 7 round 3.

title: Ford and G.N. Plan 6% Truck Price Rise
description: DETROIT. June 9The nation's two biggest auto companies have set tentative price increases of 6 percent on some of their 1977 model trucks. The increase averages $752 on heavy truck models, according to a Ford Motor Company spokesman.

title: Washington Drops Free Water Rights, Ending a Tradition
description: OLYMPIA, Wash. June 9 (AP)The Old West tradition of free, perpetual water rights has ended in this state.

title: Israel's Delegate at U.N. Fears Lebanon Spillover
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., June 9Chaim Herzog, Israel's delegate, said today that the hostilities in Lebanon had developed into a major internaitional conflict between the Arab governments, posing dangers to Israel and to the rest of the Middle East.

title: McCarthy Says Nomination Of Carter Is Not Inevitable
description: BOSTON, June 9 (AP)For mer Senator Eugene J. McCarthy, whose strong showing in the New Hampshire Democratic primary eight years ago helped upset President Lyndon B. Johnson's plans for a second full term, says that Jimmy Carter's nomination at the Democratic National Convention is not inevitable.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, June 9Several months ago, when Governor Byrne was about to sign a bill to revise New Jersey's election statutes the League of Women Voters obiected vigorously.

title: CABINET IN BRITAIN SURVIVES KEY VOTE
description: LONDON, June 9 (AP)Britain's Labor Government defeated a motion of no confidence on its economic policies today by 309 to 290 in the House of Commons.

title: A Lakeland Wins 1.13Carat Diamond as Best in Show
description: DENVER, June 9Colorado is famous for its gold and silver. Hundreds of millions of dollars of those metals have been mined in the state since the rush to the Rockies in 1859. Today a rocka 1.13carat diamondwas uncovered in the MileHigh City.

title: Savings Banks in State Post Net Deposit Inflows for May
description: The savings banks of New York State had a net deposit inflow of $293 million in May, the Savings Bank Association of New York reported yesterday.

title: Loews Tells S.E.C. Of Payoffs Abroad
description: The Loews Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had voluntarily told the Securities and Exchange Commission that the Lorillard Tobacco division had made questionable payments that could approximate $1.5 million for the last five years in connection with cerLain foreign sales of tobacco.

title: People in Sports
description: The Milwaukee Bucks have obtained their 1973 top draft choice three years later. Sixfoot  11  inch Swen Nater, who played for three teams in his three seasons in the American Basketball Association, including the defunct Virginia Squires, signed yesterday with the Bucks of the National Basketball Association.

title: ATOMIC AIDES GOT 3 FIRE WARNINGS
description: WASHINGTON, June 9Senior Federal atomic energy officials received at least three specific warnings about the danger of a serious fire and a related safety problem at the world's largest nuclear power plant well before a major fire broke out there, Government documents show.

title: Sybil Thorndike Is Dead; An Actress for 7 Decades
description: Dame Sybil Thorndilte, the preeminent actress of the British, theater, whose career spanned seven decades and five reigns, beginning with the Edwardian era, died yesterday at her home in London, four days after suffering a heart attack. She was 93 years old.

title: Miss Quinlan Taken To a Nursing Home Runby Welfare Unit
description: Karen Ann Quinlan was moved last night from St. Clare's Hospital in Denville, N.J., where she has lain in a coma for more than a year to the Morris View Nursing Home in Morris Plains. N.J.

title: Carter Closes In
description: Former Governor Carter's triumph in the Ohio primary has brought the Democratic Party's Presidential nomination almost within his grasp. Barring some unexpected turn of fate, his long quest for the nomination is now virtually certain of being crowned with success.

title: Israelis Halt Arab Protest Against Syrian Intervention
description: NABLUS. IsraeliOccupied West Bank. June 9 (UPDIsaeli troops fired teargas grenades today to disperse hundreds of teenage Arabs demon. strating against the Syrian intervention in Lebanon.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Helstoski Gains on Absentee Ballots
description: JERSEY CITY, June 9Representative Henry Helstoski's narrow victory margin in yesterday's Democratic primary on the basis of votingmachine tabulations swelled today with the addition of absentee ballots, many of which were filled out before he was indicted June 2 on Federal extortion charges.

title: Publication of French Restaurant Book Is Celebrated, of Course, With a Feast
description: LYONS, France,Seven of France's best chefs rolled up their sleeves the other night for joint production of a meal to prove their right to a place in a new guide to France's best restaurants.

title: Warning Is Added
description: A study of more than a thousand alcoholics admitted to treatment programs throughout the country suggests that a sizable percentage of alcoholics can return to normal, moderate drinking without relapsing into alcohol abuse, according to a report released yesterday by the Rand Corporation.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical error, the report in yesterday's Times of the resignation of Thomas E. Kauper as head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division incorrectly said he was leaving because he felt he had not received sufficient support from Attorney General Edward H. Levi or from President Ford. Mr. Kauper said he was resigning solely to return to teaching at the University of Michigan Law School.

title: Truce Move Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Thursday, June, 10After meeting stiffresistance. Syrian armor was reported halted yesterday in the mountains east of Beirut and outside the port of Saida to the south.

title: Orr Joins Hawks, but His Knee Is Doubtful
description: MONTREAL, June 9Bobby Orr agreed today to accept the terms offered by the Chicago Black Hawks hockey team.

title: Haughton Takes Sire Trot
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 9A 3yearold colt, who last season won $35,116 as a pacer, tonight troted to the richest reward of his brief career by capturing the first of two $43,496 nonbetting New York Sire Stakes events at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Deaths
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW ??? (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO.
