AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Reagan vs. Carter
description: CHICAGOThe clearest indication that Gerald Ford is going to lose the nomination to Ronald Reagan came at the conclusion of one of the President's television spots in California.

title: Canadian Border Patrols Increased to Bar Terrorists
description: MONTREAL, June 9 (UPI)Heavy surveillance aimed at topping any potential terrorist has gone into effect along the entire CanadianAmerican border, a spokesman for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said today.

title: LAIRD PREDICTING PLATFORM FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON June 9 Melvin R. Laird said today, on behalf of President Ford, that the Republican Presidential nomination was as good as won, and he tried to warn Ronald Reagan's followers against a divisive fight over the party platform.

title: Hockey's No. 1 Star
description: Winter holds a longterm lease on Parry Sound, the small Ontario town where Bobby Orr grew up, Sometimes, when the Arctic air breathes heavily, the temperature drops to 40 degrees below zero. It is the kind of town where young men learn how to drink to keep warm at an early age, and where young women get fat long before their time: the kind of town where kids grow up and leave.

title: Radio
description: 7:30  8:55 A.M., WNYC  FM: Mornings with Music. Sinfonies de Fanfares, Mouret; Quartet for Flute, Violin, Viola and Cello No. 3, Stamitz; Prelude to the Afternoon of a Faun, Debussy; Two Etudes, Chopin; Sonata for violin and Harpsichord in F, Bach; Sonata for Strings No. 1, Rossini.

title: Bolivia Declares State of Siege To Balk Widespread Unrest
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, June 9 (AP) A state of siege was decrect throughout Bolivia today to deal with a series of strikes and student demonstrations that began last week.

title: Murphy's Law (The Worst Is Likely) Is Bedeviling Searchers at Loch Ness
description: DRUMNADROCHIT, SCOTLAND. June 9The engineers and scientists probing Loch Ness with camera and sonar are encountering more evidence of Murphy than of the famed monster. This is the ubiquious Murphy of Murphy's Law which holds that whatever can go wrong will go wrong.

title: Carter Strategy From the Start: 1976 Was Year for a Gambler
description: ATLANTARight from the start, Jimmy Carter's Presidential campaign has moved on the fragile premise that 1976 was a gambler's year.

title: Fire Stops Election Parties
description: LOS ANGELES, June 9 (AP) Hundreds of people, including many attending parties celebrating the California primary election, were evacuated from the downtown Biltmore Hotel early today after a fire broke out in an elevator car. A Fire Department spokesman said it took half an hour to bring the fire under control.

title: Personal Finance: PayableThrough Drafts
description: It looks like a check, and most recipients think that it is a check. But it isn't a check. What is it?

title: Advertising
description: Ad agencies and their clients are truly singing the blues these days about the soaring cost of television commercial time, especially in the fourth quarter.

title: The Chief Awards in Denver
description: Chantilly Lace; 2, Anne Snelling's Irish water spaniel, Ch. Oaktree's Irishtocrat; 3, Jessica Darby's and W. A. Dolling's golden retriever, Ch. Combo Gold Rush of Golden Pine; 4, John Gilkey's Brittany spaniel, Ch. Ftynant's Happy Time.

title: H. M. VAN DEUSEN, MUSEUM CURATOR
description: Hobart M. Van Deusen, who had been curator in the mammalogy department of the American Museum of Natural History for 30 years, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home in West Rumney, N.H. He was 65 years old and had retired last gear.

title: Bridge
description: Many players faced with a difficult problem gaze at the ceiling, perhaps seeking help from the heavens. Calling on help from the gods in general may not be productive, however, and the Mexicans can do better. They can demand help from Xochipilli, the god of games, flowers and song in Mayan mythology.

description: Events Today

title: Veterinary College Gains
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 9 (UPI) The State College of Veterinary Medicine at Cornell University has been give a fiveyear probationary accreditation by the American Veterinary Medicine Association's Council on Education, it was announced today. The probationary accreditation was granted pending increased staffing in clinical specialty areas and physical improvements at the facility, a spokesman said. The college is the state's only veterinary school.

title: Cosmos Rally To Beat Kicks
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn.. June 9 (AP)Secondhalf goals by Giorgio Chinaglia and Tony Field lifted the New York Cosmos to a 21 North American Soccer League victory over Minnesota here tonight.

title: A Blue Cross Step
description: The Blue Cross Association said yesterday that it had taken a first step toward extending full coverage to its subscribers for comprehensive, nonhospital treatment of alcoholism, a major public health problem that afflicts an estimated nine million Americans.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, June 9Several months ago, when Governor Byrne was about to sign a bill to revise New Jersey's election statutes the League of Women Voters obiected vigorously.

title: Nominate Muskie Opponent
description: PORTLAND, Me., June 9 (AP)Maine Republicans have nominated Robert A. G. Monks, a 42yearold millionaire businesman from Cape Elizabeth, to oppose Senator Edmund S. Muskie, a Democrat, in the Nov. 2 election. Mr. Monks, a former state energy director, won 83.7 percent of the Republican vote in yesterday's primary, defeating Plato Truman, a Biddeford businessman.

title: Warning to Imperialists
description: CAIRO, Thursday, June 10The Syrian delegate to the Arab League, Mahmoud alAtassi, commented today that the Soviet statement condemning foreign intervention in Lebanon referred only to imperialist actions. He said SovietSyrian relations were unchanged.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two youths accused of the murder and robbery of Roger Hane, a magazine illustrator who was fatally beaten by six bicycle thieves as he rode in Central Park two years ago, interrupted their trial in New York State Supreme Court to plead guilty to robbery charges. Paul Flaxman, the prosecutor, recommended that Justice Joseph Martinis accept the plea, which calls for a 25year prison term, because the youths, Luis Colon and Ivan Gonzales, both now 18 years old, were not the actual killers. The real killers, Mr. Flaxman said, were two 15yearolds who have been sent to a state reformatory for three years, the maximum for juveniles under state law. The juveniles are eligible for parole this September, authorities said.

title: CARTER RETICENT ON RUNNING MATE
description: PLAINS, Ga., June 9Jimmy Carter, now virtually sure of the Democratic Presidential nomination, made a vigorous effort today to discourage speculation about his possible choice of a VicePresidential running mate.

title: Amer. Soccer League
description: LAST NIGHTS GAME Los Angeles 1, New York 0.

title: G. O. P. Committee Challenging Limits on Spending by Nominee
description: WASHINGTON. June 9The Republican National Committe maintained today that it could spend unlimited amounts of money to support the general election campaign of its Presidential candidate, despite ceilings imposed by Congress in the 1974 campaign law.

title: Hanoi Reeducating ExFoes
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 9 (AP)  Some military officers and civilian officials of the former South Vietnamese governWent will be kept in reeducation camps for as long as three years, Hanoi's official press agency reported today.

title: Belmont Racing Charts; 1976, by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form); Wednesday, June 9. 33d day. Weather clear, track fast.
description: Belmont Racing Charts; 1976, by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form); Wednesday, June 9. 33d day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: Increase in Prices Of 8 to 23% Listed By British Steel
description: The British Steel Corporation announced in London yesterday that It would increase prices 8 to 23 percent on a number of products, effective July 4.

title: Yankees Top Angels, 43; Martin Ejected From Game
description: The Yankees 43 victory over California was almost anticlimactic last night. It served primarily as the conclusion to a bizarre muggy evening at Yankee Stadium during which:

title: Gold's Purchasers Anticipate Period Of Price Stability
description: PARIS. June 9European buyers of gold at an auction of the international Monetary Fund last week in Washington said today that they acted because they saw a period of price stability ahead for the metal with little downside risk.

title: BEAME, IN ATTACK ON STATE, RESISTS SOME BUDGET CUTS
description: In his strongest complaint yet about Governor Carey's fiscal prodding, Mayor Bearne yesterday vowed to resist the Governor's pressure for additional budget cuts designed merely to permit the state to avoid its responsibilities.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Hot, Dry Weather In Midwest Keeps Grain Futures Up
description: Weather reports held the atitention of traders at the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. With the corn and soybean crops in midgrowth and needing moisture, weather trends are important.

title: Federated and Saks Fined, On PriceFixing Charges
description: Federated Department Stores and Saks & Company, parent concerns of I. Magnin & Company and Saks Fifth Avenue, respectively, were each fined a maximum $50,000 yesterday in Federal District Court, San Francisco, after company attorneys filed pleas of no contest to charges of conspiring to fix prices.

title: Glance Loses to Evans After Mishap at Start
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 9 Harvey Glance, the Auburn University freshman who won the National Collegiate 100meter and 200meter titles last weekend, was beaten tonight because of an apparent starting mishap in the Amateur Athletic Union junior track and field championships at the University of Tennessee's Tom Black Stadium.

title: Decision Is Reserved in Academy Case
description: A Federal district court judge reserved decision yesterday on a request by Cadet Timothy D. Ringgold and other similarly situated cadets that a threejudge panel hear arguments on the constitutionality of the United States Military Academy's honor code.

title: Shunned West Pointer Gets Medal
description: WEST BERLIN, June 9 (AP)James J. Pelosi, the West Pointer who was given the silent treatment by fellow cadets despite his exoneration of cheating charges, has won an Army Commendation Medal for saving an East German man injured in a traffic accident.

title: Money
description: Federal funds market rate 5 high,3 low, 5 close.

title: Byrne Woos Another Wall Street Firm
description: Governor Byrne continued yesterday his campaign to attract more New York brokerage firms to New Jersey in a meeting with Mark N. Kaplan, president of Drexel Burnham & Company, one of the nation's leading stockbrokers.

title: BAN IS REMOVED ON VISITS TO CHILD
description: Declaring that visits with a grandparent are often a precious part of a child's experience. the Appellate Division of New York Supreme Court in Brooklyn has overturned a lowercourt ruling that had denied a Bronx couple access to their 7yearold grandchild.

title: ANGOLA MARCHERS ASK DEATH FOR 13
description: LUANDA, Angola, June 9Tens of thousands of Angolans marched through this capital today demanding the death sentence for 13 mercenaries who are to go on trial Friday.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. California Angels, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 7:55 P.M.)

title: Panatta Topples Borg
description: PARIS, June 9The jinx still holds.

title: Fed Outlines Rules To Block Redlining
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Federal Government moved today toward combating the practice of redlining in the nation's banking and mortgage lending industry by requiring public disclosure of lending patterns.

title: New Jersey Delegate Vote
description: NEWARK, June 9 (AP)Following is a countybycounty breakdown of the voting Tuesday for atlarge delegates in the Democratic Presidential primary in New Jersey:

title: Assad Gives Assent
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 9Syria said today that it had agreed to the stationing of some troops from other Arab nations in Lebanon to help establish a durable truce.

title: Court ReformNow
description: Reorganization of the state court system has reached the stage in Albany where there is agreement in principle but not in fact on the major sections of Governor Carey's judicial reform package.

title: Assembly in Albany Votes Plan to Allow City U. to Reopen, but the Senate Leaders Show Reluctance
description: ALBANY, June 9The State Assembly tonight overcame the personal misgivings of many members and partisan divisions with its Republican minority to pass the Democratic leadership's City University rescue package.

title: Baseball Crowds Up by 1.1 Million
description: Major league baseball attendance has increased by 1.1 million over the period last year as the season approaches the onethird mark, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn reported yesterday. Apparently heading for a record season, the 24 clubs, through last Sunday, played before 9,635,209 fans, a 13 percent jump over a comparable period last year for home playing dates. The major league attendance record of 30,109,926 was set in 1973. Crowds have reached the 30million mark the last three years.

title: Blumenthal, Majority Leader, to Retire From Assembly in Fall
description: ALBANY, June 9Albert H. Blumenthal, the Assembly majority leader, said today that. to spend more time with his family, he would not seek reelection to an eighth term this fall.

title: Auto Racing Aide Dies
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 9 (AP) Joseph L. Quinn, safety director at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway for 30 years, died this morning at a hospital here. He was 71 years old. Mr. Quinn, a native or Newark, was a life member of the United States Auto Club and the Izaak Walton League.

title: Taiwan Discloses A Major Shuffling Of Cabinet Leaders;
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 9The Government today announced a major shuffle involving nine Cabinet posts and the mayoralty of Taipei.

title: Pound at $1.7744 As 2 Central Banks Stabilize Currency
description: LONDON, June 9 (AP)The British and Swiss central banks successfully stabilized their currencies today in keeping with a renewed effort by international monetary authorities to prevent excessive swings in the foreignexchange market.

title: Warning Is Added
description: A study of more than a thousand alcoholics admitted to treatment programs throughout the country suggests that a sizable percentage of alcoholics can return to normal, moderate drinking without relapsing into alcohol abuse, according to a report released yesterday by the Rand Corporation.

title: Stephane Grappelli Has Fiddle Power At Reno Sweeney
description: Stephane Grappelli looks like Alec B. Francis playing the Old Music Master these days  a sharp, lean profile, With the few wisps of hair left on top of his head flourishing into silken gray strands that sweep down over his collar.

title: James A. Farley, 88, Dies; Ran Roosevelt Campaigns
description: James A. Farley, a major Democratic Party figure during the New Deal Administration of Franklin Delano Roosevelt and a former Postmaster General, died yesterday in his suite at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel. He was 88 years old.

title: Lawrence W. Robert, U.S. Treasury Aide in 30's, Dead at 88
description: ATLANTA, June 9 (AP)Lawrence W. Robert, who served as Assistant Secretary of the Treasury and later treasurer of the Democratic National Committee under President Franklin D. Roosevelt, died today. He was 88 years old.

title: HumphreyBrown Victory In Jersey Is Called Futile
description: Democratic leaders in New Jersey agreed yesterday that the overwhelming victory for the HumphreyBrown uncommitted delegates in Tuesday's Presidential primary apparently came too late to stop Jimmy Carter and that the principal political victim of the onslaught appeared to be Governor Byrne.

title: Assembly Votes a Property Tax to Help Cities Finance Pensions
description: ALBANY, June 9The Assembly today approved, 90 to 60, a bill authorizing a statelevied property tax in a number of cities and city school districts to enable them to continue to finance pension and Social Security payments.

title: Lincoln P.S.A.L. Victor
description: Dallas Williams made his Yankee Stadium debut yesterday but the Baltimore Oroles are confident it won't be his only appearance at the refurbished Bronx ball park.

title: Energy Reserves Asks List Be Kept From Rittenberry
description: The Energy Reserves Group, formerly the Clinton Oil Company, filed a complaint yesterday in the Federal District Court in Wichita, Kan, seeking to enjoin C. R. Rittenberry and Associates of tutsa, okla from interfering with the company's reorganization under the court's jurisdiction. Energy Reserves said it was apparent that Rittenberry intends to make a takeover bid.

title: Nuclear Issues Advance In a Quiet Stock Session
description: Nuclearrelated Issues, responding to Tuesday's California primary vote rejecting strict new controls on nuclear power them, advanced strongly yesterday in an otherwise uneventful stock market.

title: Randy Jones Wins Without a Fastball
description: Not long ago the other pitchers on the San Diego Padres were listening to their coach, Roger Craig, talk about how to work differently on various hitters when Randy Jones joined the group.

title: Hirshhorn Shows ArtistImmigrants
description: WASHINGTONAfter all the colonial portraits and scenes of the Grand Canyon and other picturesque mementoes of early America, it is nice to be reminded in this Bicentennial year that we are in reality a nation of immigrants, and that the achievements of American art in the present century owe a great dealsometimes, it seems, almost everythingto the successive waves of immigration that began in the late 19th century.

title: NATO AIDES MEET ON UPBEAT NOTE
description: BRUSSELS, June 9  Although they are deeply preoccupied with the possible entry of Communists into Italy's Government, top NATO officials said here today that the alliance was generally in a better mood that it had been in years.

title: Whether Italian Communists Get in the Government or Not, the Outlook Is That Troubles Will Persi
description: ROME, June 9With 11 days to go before the voting, the emerging consensus is that the parliamentary election will solve little and leave Italy in deep difficulty for some time to come. If the Communists do News not get into the Analysis Cabinet this time, there will be trouble, many diplomats and politicians believe. If the Communists do get in, they add, there will be trouble.

title: BEAM, IN ATTACK ON STATE, RESISTS SOME BUDGET CUTS,
description: In his strongest complaint yet about Governor Carey's fiscal prodding, Mayor Beane yesterday vowed to resist the Governor's pressure for additional budget cuts designed merely to permit the state to avoid its responsibilities.

title: Defection to Carter In G.O.P. Is Hinted
description: An unusually large proportion of Republican voters who hacked President Ford or his challenger, Ronald Reagan, in Tuesday's final primaries said they would abandon their party in November to vote for Jimmy Carter if their choice lost the nomination and Mr. Carter was the Democratic candidate.

title: People and Business
description: Emile Van Lennep, Secretary General of the Organization for Economic Development and Cooperation, called on, industrialized nations yesterday to place speed limits on their economic recoveries to prevent another worldwide recession in 1977 or 1978.

title: U. S. SEES EASING OF ARAB BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Administration declared today that the United States was making significant progress in blunting the Arab countries economic boycott of Israel and argued that legislative remedies might prove harmful to its diplomatic efforts.

title: Guide GOING OUT Guide
description: BENTON BONUS You finance the eggs and I'll do the picture, Thomas Hart Benton reportedly told Alva Johnson, president of the New School in 1931. The artist, back from Europe, then proceeded to execute his first mural, a large, fourwall panorama of his native American scene. He used the tempera technique, a method of oil painting that mixes eggs with the pigments. All these years, the spectacular multipanel work has dominated a schoolroom used for hoard meetings and now a lecture hall.

title: European Criticism Upsets the Germans
description: WEST BERLIN, June 9A sudden spate of criticism in Western Europe has stirred sculsearching and debate in West Germany over why the ugly German is reappearing.

title: What's past is prologue. The pastwhat's that?
description: SOUTHAMPTON, N.Y.The unique excellence of television is also its tragic flaw. It captures the present only to become a captive of the present. With a childlike sense of wonder at the flashing moment, it is plagued with a child's short attention span.

title: CARTER RETICENT ON RUNNING MATE
description: PLAINS, Ga., June 9Jimmy Carter, now virtually sure of the Democratic Presidential nomination, made a vigorous effort today to discourage speculation about his possible choice of a VicePresidential running mate.

title: 2 Students at State U. in Buffalo Slain in OffCampus Apartment
description: BUFFALO, June 9Two students at the State University at Buffalo were stain this morning in an offcampus apartment. The police said that robbery apparently was the motive and that about $100 had been taken.

title: Bangor Gaining Status As Gateway for Airlines
description: BANGOR, Me., June 9As the passenger from a DenvertoFrankfurt charter flight piled out Into the new international airport terminal here last night at a refueling stop, 20yearold Debbie Morrison made for the phone to call home with a progress report.

title: Art of Packing: It's Lost on Some
description: The perfect luggage, perfectly organized, ready to go at a moment's notice. It rarely happens, even to seasoned, and constant, travelers.

title: Good Work in Chile
description: Chile's military rulers must be having second thoughts about the wisdom of playing host to the sixth General Assembly of the Organization of American States. Instead of providing the regime with the international respectability it so desperately desires, the O.A.S. sessions thus far have focused heavily on flagrant violations of human rights in the Americas, particularly in Chile.

title: New York Party Misses Carter's Express Train
description: The New York State Democratic Party, the host for next month's Democratic National Convention, was left standing on the platform yesterday as the Jimmy Carter Presidential Express roared out of the station.

title: City U. Bill Passed
description: The State Assembly voted 87 to 55 last night to pass the Democratic leadership's $24million program to allow the City University to reopen. The plan now goes to the State Senate. Page 23.

title: Bruce Johnson, 27, Dead; Led Museum of Folk Art
description: Bruce A. Johnson, director of the Museum of American Folk Art, died Saturday in a motorcycle accident near Peekskill, N. Y. He was 27 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Tom Sawyer's Mississippi Is Revisited a Century After
description: HANNIBAL, Mo., June 9 It would be pleasant to report that Tom Sawyer is alive and well at age 100 and living here in Hannibal where he belongs. But who is to say?

title: ExPolice Detective Acquitted in Case Of Drug Possession
description: Robert Hantz, a former detective and muchdecorated police officer, was acquitted yesterday on departmental charges of possession of marijuana and of trying to impede an investigation of the incident.

title: ALBANY IN ACCORD ON HOUSING BILL
description: ALBANY, June 9 Governor Carey and the legislative leaders closed most of their major differences tonight on a program to clear the way for Federal assistance in the rescue of the State Housing Finance Agency, and fiscal aides said they would try to pass the necessary bills tomorrow.

title: Farley, Jim to Thousands, Was the Master Political Organizer and Salesman
description: As returns from the 1930 New York gubernatorial race filtered in to the Biltmore Hotel headquarters of the State Democratic Committee that Nov. 4 night, its rreshman chairman issued a statement.

title: Truce Move Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Thursday, June 10After meeting stiff; resistance, Syrian armor was reported halted yesterday in the mountains cast of Deirut and outside the port of saida to the south.

title: State Senate Tax Action To Aid Schools Doubted
description: TRENTON, June 9The State Senate President, Matthew D. Feldman, said today that he saw no sentiment in the Senate for passage of a tax plan to meet the constitutional crisis facing the state's public schools.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF AS VOLUME FALLS
description: Investor concern over the Lebanese situation and increasing interest rates depressed prices yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market.

title: U. S. Delays Decision on Use of Auto Air Bags Till January
description: WASHINGTON, June 9Transportation Secretary William T. Coleman Jr. announced today that he had postponed until next January his decision on whether to require air bags on all new automobiles sold in this country.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Syria agreed to the stationing of some troops from other Arab countries in Lebanon to help establish a durable peace. The announcement in Damascus following a meeting of President Hafez alAssad with Arab League representatives who had pressed him to withdraw all Syrian troops, to which he did not agree. Later Syria and 19 other Arab League countries decided in Cairo to put a token peacekeeping force, including Syrian troops, in Lebanon to replace the large Syrian force. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Decolonization Committee 10:30 A.M.

title: Aramco Says Saudis Report Price Cuts In Two Crude Oils
description: The Arabian American Oil Company said yesterday that the Saudi Arabian Government had informed the company that it was reducing the price for its medium grade crude oil by 5 cents a barrel and its heavy crude by 10 cents a barrel.

title: 4th Bubonic Piague Case
description: SANTA FE. N. M., June 9 (UPI) New Mexico health officials have confirmed the fourth case of bubonic plague in New Mexico this year and said the disease was being reported at a higher rate than last year's record number of Cases.

title: Eximbank Maps Rules
description: The Export  Import Bank announced a new set of international rules for governmentassisted export credits that the other leading industrial nations are expected to low. Page 56.

title: Optimism Evident in Computer Meetings
description: More than 40,000 computer specialists, users, vendors and students have swarmed through the National Computer Conference and exhibition here this week, showing a spirit of business optimism that recalled the industry's salad days of the late 1960's.

title: Muraskin Wins Westchester Amateur, 2 Up
description: SCARSDALE, June 9  Dave Muraskin fought the tricky Fenway Golf Club course, his temper and Frank Gonda of Leewood but overcame all three to win the Westchester Amateur championship today.

title: 1 in 5 Marine Recruits Held Mentally Unfit in 75
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) The chief psychiatrist at the Parris Island Marine Corps Recruit Depot testified today that one out of five recruits was discharged last year for psychiatric or mental reasons.

title: Ballet: 2 Elegant, Floating Giselles
description: Two unusual performances of Giselle were presented by American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House. Yesterday afternoon, Eleanor D'Antuono was partnered by Jorge Esquivel, the young Cuban dancer who is Alicia Alonso's principal partner. Mr. Esquivel stepped in for Ted Kivitt, who is reportedly injured, and in his United States debut as Albrecht he cut a very elegant and classically styled figure. It was an exciting occasion.

title: 6 Bridge Officers Face Trial
description: Six employees of the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority were suspended May 27 and face departmental trial for irregularities in toll reporting an authority official confirmed yesterday. The official, George Schoepfer, executive of ficer and chief engineer of the authority, said the amounts involved in the thefts and other details were not made public pending the trial of the employees, described as bridge and tunnel officers.

title: Lawyer Says He Thinks Ray Covering Up for Someone
description: MEMPHIS, June 9 (AP)One oY James Earl Ray's attorneys said today that he was convinced his client was not acting alone in the 1968 slaying of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: SHIFT TO GEORGIAN
description: Opposition to Jimmy Carter's candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination crumbled yesterday, and he appeared to be assured of victory on the first ballot next month.

title: POLICY SPURS RIFT OF BANKS, BROKERS
description: A basic policy difference in securities dealings appeared yesterday to have created a major break in relations between some of the nation's leading banks and stockbrokers.

title: Maple Rides Five Victors; Loses a 6th
description: Eddie Maple rode five winners at Belmont Park yesterday, and missed a sixth when one of his eight mounts was disqualified for interference.

title: HARRY H. HARMAN, STATISTICIAN, DIES
description: Harry H. Harman, director of developmental research for the Educational Testing Service and a pioneer of the statistical technique of factor analysis, died on Tuesday at the Princeton Medical Center. He was 63 years old.

title: Winter Wheat Forecast Is Cut but Remains Huge
description: CHICAGO, June 9The nation's winter wheat crop, the principal source of flour for bread, will be slightly smaller than the Agriculture Department expected a month ago.

title: Chess
description: It is excellent strategy to play to thwart your opponent's objectivessuch great competitors as Samuel Reshevsky and Viktor Korchnoi have built a major part of their careers around this approach to the gamebut you must always be careful, while inhibiting one line of development, not to push your opponent into something far stronger.

title: Council Committee Asks Albany to Help Save WNYC System
description: The New York City Council's Committee on State Legislation unanimously passed a homerule message yesterday calling on the Legislature to create a quasi  governmental, tax  exempt corporation to operate the city's Municipal Broadcasting System.

title: CHLOROFORM LINK TO CANCER VERIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (UPI) Government scientists confirmed today preliminary reports showing that chloroforn causes cancer in test animals, and the Fuod and Drug Administration said that drug companies had stopped using it in toothpastes and cough remedies.

title: Three Quit Women's Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) President Ford announced today that he had accepted the resignation of three members of the National Commission on the Observance of International Women's Year 1975. Resigning were Barbara Bergmann of College Park, Md.; Maryl S. Coleman of Lansing, Mich. and William C. Morcer of Boston.

title: SOUTH KOREAN PLAN REJECTED BY NORTH
description: SEOUL, South Korea. Jure 9 North Korean Red Cross offidials rejected a South Korean proposal today for an exchage of visits across the demilitarized zone by members of fam lies esparated since the Korean war the proposal had stipulated that 500 persons from each side visit and that visits be limited to family grave sites.

title: Democrats Remove Hays As Head of Campaign Unit
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 Democrats in the House today formally ousted Representative Wayne L. Hays, the central figure in two investigations into charges of payroll padding, from one of his four committee chairmanships.

title: JOSEPH L. COLUCCIO
description: Joseph L. Coluccio, a vice president of Shearson Hayden Stone Inc., died at his home yesterday. He was 65 years old and lived at 111 Fox Glove Run in Toms River, N.J.

description: Syria agreed to the stationing of some troops from other Arab countries in Lebanon to help establish a durable peace. The announcement in Damascus following a meeting of President Hafez alAssad with Arab League representatives who had pressed him to withdraw all Syrian troops, to which he did not agree. Later Syria and 19 other Arab League countries decided in Cairo to put a token peacekeeping force, including Syrian troops, in Lebanon to replace the large Syrian force. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: FORD NOMINEE SEEN WITHDRAWING NAME
description: CONCORD, N. H., June 9President Ford's nominee for chairman of the Interstate Commerce Commerce, Warren B. Rudman, has scheduled a news conference here Friday at which he is expected to withdraw from consideration for the post.

title: Democrats Choose Metzenbaum To Oppose Taft for Senate Seat
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 9While the Ford and Carter Presidential tides rolled across Ohio yesterday, Democratic voters propelled former United States Senator Howard Metzenbaum into a November race against Robert Taft Jr. Mr. Taft, the state's incumbent Republican Senator, was unopposed in the primary.

title: Revenue Sharing Debate
description: The Washington lobby of elected local officials has been telling the House of Representatives that, in effect, almost nothing in the general revenue sharing program should be changed. Their argument flies in the face of intelligent analysis, for it suggests that in spending $30 billion over a fiveyear period, the nation has learned nothing of value. That is clearly not the case.

title: PENTAGON AT ODDS WITH 2 SHIPYARDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Defense Department has run into a negotiating impasse with two of the Navy's principal shipbuilders. Litton Industries and Tenneco, which are demanding more money than the Pentagon is willing to provide in contractual relief.

title: Big Board Seat Price Rises
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported a seat sale yesterday at $100,000, up $3,00C from the last sale on June 2.

description: SAN DIEGO, June 9Randy Jones of the Padres won his first headtohead battle with Tom Seavier of the Mets tonight by shutting out the visitors from New York. 30.

description: WASHINGTON, June 9The centurylong trend of everincreasing size of American children may have ended, according to a Government report made public today.

description: Daniel Patrick Moynihan's offagain, onagain candidacy for United States Senator from New York was on again, as of last night.

description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin yesterday suspended city rent payments totaling $32,195 a month to landlords of three daycare centers leased directly by the city because, he said, major structural deficiencies made parts of them unusable.

description: Dividends Announced

title: Dr. Nathaniel H. Cooper. Methadone Program Chief
description: Dr. Nathaniel H. Cooper, director of the methadone maintenance treatment program at Methodist and Cumberland Hospitals, both in Brooklyn, died Tuesday in the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center after a long illness. He was 66 years old.

title: A Baby Dies After She Is Taken From Doctor Accused of Murder
description: LOS ANGELES, June 9 (AP)A baby girl taken from a facility operated by an osteopathic physician charged with murder in the deaths of 10 infants died yesterday five hours after she was admitted to CountyU.S.C. Medical Center, a spokesman said.

title: Nuclear Power Vote
description: A California proposal that could have limited nuclear power was defeated by 2 to 1 in yesterday's primary. Utilities that opposed the curbs are optimistic about the future, but the plan's backers vowed to fight on. Page 55.

title: Sybil Thorndike Is Dead; An Actress for 7 Decades
description: Dame Sybil Thorndike, the preeminent actress of the British theater, whose career spanned seven decades and five reigns, beginning with the Edwardian era, died yesterday at her home in London, four days after suffering a heart attack. She was 93 years old.

title: Effects of Tuesday Voting
description: Following are the latest tallies in Tuesday's Presidential primaries in California, New Jersey and Ohio, and the new Republican delegatevote totals that resulted from those elections. Democratic delegate totals are not included because shifts to Jimmy Carter yesterday by other candidates and leaders make precise figures impractical.

title: Mindy Hertzberg Is Married on L.I.
description: The marriage of Mindy Hertzberg, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Joshua Hertzberg of Bayside, Queens, to Joshua Rosenthal, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Rosenthal of Brooklyn, took place yesterday evening in the Great Neck (L.I.) Synagogue. The bride's father, spiritual leader of the Jewish Center of Bayside Oaks in Queens, performed the ceremony. He was assisted by seven other rabbis.

title: 2 SYRIANS DESCRIBE MISSION IN LEBANON
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, June (AP)Two men identified as captured Syrian tank gunners said today that they had been sent into this southern Lebanese city with orders only move around on an apparent intimidation mission.

title: Soviet Diet Still Starchy as Meat Drive Lags
description: MOSCOW, June 9The woman scrutinized a dozen pink slabs of veal that had been arrayed on a counter of the central farmers market like gems on a jeweler's cloth. How much is it? she inquired cautiously.

title: Blumenthal to Quit State Legislature; Decision a Surprise
description: ALBANY, June 9Albert H. Blumenthal the Assembly majority leader, said today that, to spend more time with his family, he would retire from the Assembly this fall at the end of his seventh term.

title: Clyne President Forecasts Gains
description: Henry Kornhauser is happy as a clam, but more talkative. The C. T. Clyne Company of which he is president and chief operating officer billed $32.6 million last year according to Advertising Age and is currently billing at the rate of $45 million. He says that. He also says that he expects to be adding two or three major companies to the client roster within the next 90 days.

title: Utilities Hopeful as a Nuclear Curb Loses In California, but Backers Vow to Fight On
description: SAN FRANCISCO. June 9 Executives of utility and power companies that spent more than $3.5 million to defeat Cilifornia's controversial nuclear safeguards initiative were only guardedly optimistic today about the impact of the victory while proponents of the measure vowed to continue the fight.

title: James A. Farley, 88, Dies; Ran Roosevelt Campaigns
description: James A. Farley, a major Democratic Party figure during the New Deal Administration of Franklin Delano Roosevelt and a former Postmaster General, died yesterday in his suite at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel. He was 88 years old.

description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Securities and Exchange Commission invited suggestions today on how to carry out its recently announced proposal to set up a mechanism for settling disputes between brokers and their customers.

title: Ford Said to Accept A Compromise Plan For Postal Subsidy
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) President Ford has agreed to a compromise raising the taxpayers subsidy for the Postal Service by $1 billion over two years to save the agency from insolvency, Senator Hiram L. Fong said today.

title: Dederick, Morey in Golf Tie
description: RYE, N.Y., June 9When a golfer's age is a number close to par on his home course and he shoots his age or better in a round of tournament golf, he has played exceedingly well.

title: City U. Bill Passed
description: The State Assembly voted 87 to 55 last night to pass the Democratic leadership's $24million program to allow the City University to reopen. The plan now goes to the State Senate. Page 23.

title: Notes on People
description: The Australian Defense Minister gave glad tidings to the San Diego Zoo, not to mention all lovers of those cuddly little Australian koala bears. James Killen, who is in Washington, said that Australia would slightly lift its longtime embargo on the export of koalas in a once only waiver, partly as a Bicentennial gift to the United States and to replenish the San Diego Zoo's koala population. The zoo will receive two males and four females for the only koala colony in this country. The colony now has three females.

title: Tunney and Hayakawa Win in California
description: LOS ANGELES, June 9Democratic Senator John V. Tunney was renominated easily yesterday, and will run against Dr. S. I. Hayakaw, a former Democrat, who was nominated by the Republicans.

description: Is MCA Inc., the entertainment colossus that spawned the movie Jaws, now stock to sell after its eyePopping market advance?

title: 2 New U.S. Agencies Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (UPI) Senator Ernest F. Hollings, Democrat of South Carolina, proposed today merging the Interior Department the Coast Guard and several other Federal agencies into two new department for energy and environment. He made his proposal in a speech at the National Planning Conference on Commercial Development of the Oceans.

description: NBCTV, which has been making extensive changes in its 24yearold Today program because of declining ratings, announced yesterday that Tom Brokaw would become host of the earlymorning show in August, after the national political conventions are over.

description: STRATFORD, Ontario, June 9The second day of the Stratford Festival definitely had its momentsparticularly in yesterday afternoon's performance of The Tempest at the Avon Stagebut it did not quite maintain the pace or quality of Monday's opening day.

title: $60 Per Week and All You Can Drink (in a Clinic)
description: PISCATAWAY, June 9  Each month two clinical psychologists at Rutgers University here take in four alcoholics, give them tree room and board, wages, and all the liquor they can drink.

description: More than 5,000 students and faculty members of the City University of New York demonstrated outside City Hall yesterday, chanting Beame is a liar and calling for the reopening of the 20unit system.

description: Gaylord Perry is still sharp after all his years in the game.

description: To the Editor: In calling for the establishment of a regional Reconstruction Finance Corp Municipal Assistance Corporation Chairman Felix Rohatyn correctly concluded that the economic future of the Northeast depends on our ability to address economic problems in a cooperative fashion and on a more active Federal involvement in the process.

description: WASHINGTON, June 9Representative Bella S. Abzug, Democrat of Manhattan and a candidate for her party's Senate nomination, is a militant feminist, but she has thus far been unable to win the support of her two women colleagues in New York City's Congressional delegation.

description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) Growing abuses by postal employees of an injury compensation program are having a grave impact on the Postal Service's financial condition, the mail agency said today.

description: The Casts

title: Leaders Discount Victory in Jersey By Unpieciged Slate
description: Democratic leaders in New Jerscy agreed yesterday that the overwhelming victory for the liumphreyBrown uncommitted delegates in Tuesday's Presidential primary apparently came too late to stop Jimmy Carter and that the principal political victim of the onslaught appeared to be Governor Byrne.

title: Defection to Carter In G.O.P. Is Hinted
description: An unusually large proportion of Republican voters who backed President Ford or his challenger, Ronald Reagan, in Tuesday's final primaries said they would abandon their party in November to vote for Jimmy Carter if their choice lost the nomination and Mr. Carter was the Democratic candidate.

title: Nuclear Power Vote
description: A California proposal that could have limited nuclear power was defeated by 2 to 1 in Tuesday's voting. Utilities that opposed the curbs are optimistic about the future, but the plan's backers vowed to fight on. Page 55.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The General Motors Corporation announced yesterday that it would defer future payments for the worldwide licensing rights to the illfated Wankel rotary engine unless it put it into production. The announcement was the latest indication that G.M. which has already paid $38 million for rights to the engine, may never manufacture it.

title: What's the Difference?
description: Public cynicism about politics is an old story in this country, but the feelseems especially strong this year. Pollsters telephoning prospective voters in the primary states met this sort of reaction again and again: Oh, don't ask me about politicians. They're all the same. I'm not voting.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: CHASE MANHATTAN TO SHUT 2 BRANCHES
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank said yesterday that it would close two more branches this summer in a further effort to improve profitability. One of two branches in Binghamton will close July 30. and one of two branches in Poughkeepsie will close later in the summer. The bank said it was making studies to determine whether to close other unprofitable offices.

title: Westport Playhouse: A Stable of Talent
description: For a theater conceived in the restlessness of Broadway and in a producer's unrequited love for barns, the famous old Westport Country Playhouse in Westport, Conn., has opened its 46th season in remarkable comfort with Roberta, an expansive, elaborately costumed, vintage Jerome Kern musical with Ruth Warrick as Madam Roberta and an array of such familiar tunes as Smoke Gets in Your Eyes, I Won't Dance and Lovely to Look At, Delightful to Know. adore this theater, Miss Warwick said. They practically invented the strawhat circuit here.

title: U. S. CHALLENGED OVER INDIA BLAST
description: WASHINGTON, June 10Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff said today that there were strong indications that despite public assurances to the contrary, the United States supplied India with material essential to its detonation of a nuclear device.

title: A Book That Goes Bump in the Night
description: Personally, I am a dedicated agnostic about reality itself, and therefore picked up Something's There under the impression that it was a campaign biography of California's leading poltergeist. Edmund G. Brown Jr. It is instead a mostly breezy and sometimes queasy account of Dan Greenburg's misadventures with the paranormal, which is much more interesting, even though both of them go bump in the night.

title: For Mrs. Carter, a Rest at Last
description: Rosalynn Carter, the Democratic frontrunner for First Lady, says the grueling 14month prenomination campaign that she and her husband, Jimmy, have just concluded was like being in a tunnelI don't know any of the new books, I don't know any of the new movies, I don't know anything.

title: Senate Votes Funds for Lake Placid
description: WASHINGTON, June 10The Senate passed a bill today that would ultimately provide Lake Placid, N.Y., up to $50 million to stage the 1980 Olympic Winter Games. The House is expected to act on the bill tomorrow or early next week. President Ford had proposed a total of $28 million. The Senate bill allotted $28 million for four facilitiesspeedskating rink, figureskating arena, 90meter ski jump and luge course. It authorized the Economic Development Administration to provide up to $22 million more.

title: Seewazen Toes Powers
description: George (Butch) Seewagen of Bayside, Queens, the topseeded player, defeated Mike Powers of Glen Head, L.I., 63, 62, yesterday in the eighth round of the New York State tennis championships at the North Shore Tennis and Racquet Club in Bayside.

title: 14 Senators to Attack Tax Bill As Burden to the Middle Class
description: WASHINGTON. June 10A bipartisan group of 14 Senators disclosed today plans for an organized attack on the tax bill that the Senate Finance Committee is preparing to take to the Senate floor.

title: Boycott Plan Assailed by J. P. Stevens
description: J. P. Stevens & Company, the Southern textile chain, said yesterday that it considered the threatened labor boycott of its products an improper use of the combined power of many unions.

title: Unlocking CUNY's Door
description: In a sensible compromise, the leadership of the State Senate has agreed to accept the firstyear portion of the package to rescue City University proposed by Governor Carey and approved by the Assembly.

title: Schedule of Events
description: 11. Crabshucking demonstration. Noon. Fishmounting demonstration. 1 P.M. Pieeating contest

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin reported yesterday that $13.8 million had been collected from tenants occupying cityowned property in the year ending last Nov. 30, but that this was $7 million less than the city should have received. He blamed the city's Real Estate Department for slow and ineffective collection procedures.

title: New York Delegate Tally Disputed by Reagan Men
description: With President Ford and Ronald Reagan in a close race for the Republican nomination for President, the forces backing Mr. Reagan in New York are claiming considerably more support among delegates to the national Convention than the official count gave them.

title: 1976 Festa Calendar
description: Today through Sunday: Feast of St. Anthony of Padua. (Sullivan and West Houston Streets, Manhattan.) SP 72755.

title: Candy Mints Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 (UPI)  More than 6,500 cases of candy mints that had been distributed nationwide are being recalled because they contained Red Dye No. 2, the food coloring baned in February as a possible cause of cancer. The Food and Drug Administration ordered the recall yesterday of Delson Brand MerriMints, Delson Brand Green MerriMints, Newton Brand Cream Mints and Delson Brand Mint Thins, all made by the Delson Candy Company, a division of the Consolidated Foods Corporation of Englewood, N.J.

title: When Big Jim Stopped Rotating
description: As Damon Runyon told the story, Bill Muldoon was chairman of the New York State Athletic Commission when Gov. Al Smith appointed Jim Farley to the threeman board. Readers of W. O. McGeehan knew Bill Muldoon, Jim Farley and Bill Brown as the Three Dumb Dukes, and Muldoon considered his position as grand duke permanent until about a year after Jim's appointment. Then, Runyon related, Jim told Mudoon that he and Brown had agreed that the chairmanship should be rotated annually. Muldoon grumbled, but he knew he was outvoted, two to one, so he put up no active resistance and Farley became chairman. A year and more went by and Jim was still chairman. I thought we were rotating the chairmanship, Muldoon said to Farley. We've stopped rotating it, Jim said.

title: Troop Movements by Iraq Stir Concern in Damascus
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 10 The Syrian Government announced today that it was obliged to take urgent and appropriate measures to counter is reported buildup of Iraqi military forces near the SyrianIraqi border.

title: U.S. Said to Make Few Gains in Seoul In Efforts to Ease Repressive Policies
description: SEOUL, South KoreaQuiet efforts by the United States to ease the authoritarian human and civil rights policies of the South Korean Government of President Park Chung Hee show no signs of having any effect, according to interviews with diplomats, South Koreans and other observers here.

title: Byrne's Pressure Forces Port Body To Seek New Chief
description: The commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jerseycoerced by one veto by Governor Byrne, and the threat of moreagreed [yesterday to seek a replacement for the agency's executive director, A. Gerdes Kuhbach.

title: Adolph Zukor Is Dead at 103; Built Paramount Movie Empire
description: Adolph Zukor, who made entertainment history in 1912 when he offered the American public its first featurelength film, died at his Century City apartment in Los Angeles yesterday. He was 103 years old.

title: A Fillin on What to Fill Up on at the Festas
description: LEAVE it to country cousins to mark the advent of summer by the arrival of May peonies and June roses. To the confirmed city dweller, summer can be perceived more readily by the nightblooming gardens of the city streets, the floral bouquets and the garlands of colorerd lights arching down neighborhood blocks over the convival bacchanalia that is the Italian street festa.

title: POSTAL CHIEF FACES INQUIRY ON PAYOFF
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 (AP) The Justice Department is investigating allegations that Postmaster General Benjamin F. Bailar was given reduced prices on rare stamps in return for awarding $7 million in postal contracts, according to a department official.

title: Israeli Chief of Staff Says Beirut Battles Fortify Arab Force
description: TEL AVIV, June 10Israel's top military commander said today that Palestinian ??? fighting in Lebanon were ??? ing battle experience that they would use against Israel after the war.

description: Gerald Ford was not wrong on the facts but he was certainly illadvised to assert in his television advertising in California that Ronald Reagan, as President, might well get the country into a war. The record amply sustains the charge, to wit:

title: House Votes, 361 to 35, to Extend Revenue Sharing Into Fall of 80
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 The House of Representatives voted tonight. 361 to 35, to extend the Federal Government's general revenue sharing program through September 1980, without substantial change in the present law.

title: State Acts to Delay Newark Revaluation
description: TRENTON, June 10A bill that would place a twoyear moratorium on revaluation of real property in the City of Newark was introduced in both houses of the Legislature today with assurances from Governor Byrne that he would sign it.

title: WARNING IS ISSUED ON FISCAL DISPUTE
description: An attempt to reach a private compromise on the fiscal differences between Governor Carey and Mayor Beame was under way yesterday after business leaders involved with the Emergency Financial Control Board warned that the situation was degenerating into a purely political dispute that was harmful to the city.

title: Bees and Pirates (61) Routed
description: Twenty thousand bees invaded Three Rivers Stadium late yesterday afternoon, and if they were trying to sting the Pittsburgh Pirates into action, they failed. They also were escorted out of the ballpark by Steve Demko, a professional handler of the pesky insects.

title: Carter Poll Said to List Possible Running Mates
description: BOSTON, June 10 (AP)Jimmy Carter's campaign workers have commissioned a nationwide attitude poll on 14 Vice Presidential possibilities, including Senator Edward M. Kennedy, The Boston Globe reported in its Fri, day editions.

title: CORRECTION
description: A picture caption in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly identified May Newhurger as a secretary. Mrs. Newhurger is legislative director of the Assembly's Higher Education Committee in Albany.

description: Commodity Price Index Up 0.9 From WeekAgo Level

title: Coast Nine Wins Title
description: SPRINGIELD, Ill., June 10 (UPI)Denis Sherow set a tournament record last night with six hitsa triple, double and four singlesand led Cal Poly Pomona to a 173 victory over Southern IllinoisEdwardsville to capture the National Collegiate Division II world series. Sherow was drafted by the Montreal Expos on Tuesday.

title: Mauritanians Say Polisario Leader Died During Attack
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, June 10 (Agence FrancePresse) The Mauritanian capital was calm today in the aftermath of two mortar and machinegun attacks in the last 48 hours and as Mauritanian sources asserted that the leader of the Saharan independence movement. Sayed elWali, was dead.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Texas Rangers, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (TelevisionChannel II. 8 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 7:55 P.M.)

title: Halston: More Elegant Understatement
description: The Halston mystique has reached such a state that even without the physical presence of such clients as Lisa Minelli or Elizabeth Taylor his shows become fashion events. The air was thick with anticipation before the press show yesterday of his custommade clothes in his Madison Avenue salon, even though he had presented another fall collection on Seventh Avenue just a month ago.

title: Some Car Plants Close, but Output Exceeds 4 Million
description: DETROIT. June 10American auto production for 1976 passed the 4 million mark this week, with plans for building big cars on overtime and several small car plants closed or heading for long summer shutdowns.

title: U.S. BACKS MOVES IN LEBANON WAR
description: WASHINGTON, June 10The United States cautiously endorsed today the latest Arab efforts to bring about a ceasefire in Lebanon and forestall a major clash between Syria and Palestinians.

title: Mrs. Ford Says Envoy Rejected Reagan's Offer
description: WASHINGTON. June 10 (AP)Betty Ford told reporters today that Ronald Reagan had approached Ambassador Anne Arnistrong, former counselor to the President, about running for Vice President with him, but that Mrs. Armstrong had declined.

title: Grace Herbert Golf To YoungPeck Duo
description: PURCHASE, N.Y., June 10 Mrs. Robert Young of Aspetuck Valley C.C., Weston, Conn., and Mrs. Bernard Peck of the Patterson Club, Fairfield, Conn., who led by three strokes after the first round yesterday, won the 17th annual Grace Herbert Memorial betterball championship of the Women's TriCounty Golf Association by four shots at Brae Burn Country Club today.

description: In the sea of reruns are two islands of live television, and both are fundraising affairs. WNET/13 is in the ninth day (and night) of its10day auctionan audience participation show for the moneyed classesand WORTV (Channel 9) gives over nine hours tonight, starting at 8 P.M., to the fourth annual entertainment  packed telethon to aid the mentally retarded.

title: Manila and U. S. Will Begin Talks On Bases Tuesday
description: MANILA, June 10The Philppine Government announced today that negotiations with the United States for a new agreement for American bases here would open Tuesday in the northern city of Baguio.

title: U.S. Pledges Aid to Buffalo For a LightRail System
description: WASHINGTON, June 10The use of lightrail systems to solve transit problems in some urban areas received a huge boost today when the Federal Government announced that it had agreed in principle to supply up to S269 million for a 6.4mile line in Buffalo.

title: Adolph Zukor Is Dead at 103; Built Paramount Movie Empire
description: Adolph Zukor, who made entertainment history in 1912 when he offered the American public its first featurelength film, died at his Century City apartment in Los Angeles yesterday. He was 103 years old.

description: ALBANY, June 10The Assembly gave final passage today to a controversial but widely popular bill designed to reduce street solicitation by prostitutes by outlawing loitering for purposes of prostitution.

description: Major League Leaders

title: De Chirico in Search of Self
description: THE case of Giorgio de Chirico is one of the strangest in the annals of modern art. So strange indeed that Mr. de Chirico, who will be 88 years old on July 10, looks at times more like a character in a farfetched novel than a distinguished figure in the history of art.

title: MONEY SUPPLY UP A BILLION IN WEEK AS LOANS DECLINE
description: The nation's basic money supply climbed by $1 billion in the latest statement week and business loans at leading New York City banks declined by $269 million, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Humphrey Is Considering Race For Majority Leader of Senate
description: WASHINGTON. June 10Senator Hubert H. Humphrey. who has abandoned any active quest for the Democratic Presidential nomination, said today that he was seriously considering running for Senate majority leader.

title: Rosenberg Lawyers Alleging Judicial Impropriety in Case
description: Lawyers for the two sons of Ethel and Julius Rosenberg, electrocuted as atomic spy plotters in 1953, charged yesterday that nowreleased reports by Federal Bureau of Investigation agentsif accurateindicated the trial judge had violated canons of judicial ethics and constitutional separation of powers.

title: Carter's Position on Issues Designed for Wide Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, June 10An examination of Jimmy Carter's stands on the range of campaign issues shows that, in nearly every case, he seems to have taken the positions designed to satisfy the most posible voters and alienate the fewest.

title: BYRNE'S PRESSURE MOVES PORT BODY
description: The Commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jerseycoerced by one veto by Governor Byrne and the threat of moreagreed yesterday to seek a replacement for the agency's executive director, A. Gerdes Kuhbach.

title: Blazers. Nuggets To Meet Next Fall
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 10 (AP) The Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Association announced plans today to play two exhibition games against the Denver Nuggets of the American Basketball Association this fall. The teams will meet Oct. 6 in Denver, then play two nights later in Portland.

title: Saving Sterling
description: The action taken by the leading industrial nations in providing a $5.3 billion standby credit to Britain was a welltimed example of international monetary cooperation at its best.

title: Morey Cards a 69 to Win Senior Playoff by 10 Shots
description: RYE, N.Y., June 10In an 18hole playoff today, Dale Morey of High Point, N.C., birdied the first three holes and went on to defeat Dr. Gerald F. Dederick Jr. of Ho  Ho  Kus, NJ., by 10 strokes to win the United States Seniors Golf Association championship for a second straight year. The tournament is for players 55 years of age and older.

title: Business in Canada
description: OTTAWAAn economist from a third world country, in Vancouver for a United Nations conference, suggested the other day that this nation's vast resources must make many Canadians feel complaisant in a world full of need. Canadians reacted wryly to the comment.

description: Do race horses sleep standing up? How much do they weigh? What do they eat? How old do you have to be to become a jockey?

At any rate, the Metropolitan Museum or Art, which was prepared to pay $1.6million for it, did not get the superb Still Life with Japanese Print, a painting by Paul Gauguin that sold for $1.4million at the auction of works from the Josef Rosensaft collection, held here last March at Sotheby ParkeBernet.

title: U.S. Debut for Ghislaine Thesmar
description: Tonight will mark the American debut of Ghislaine Thesmar, a principal dancer with the Paris Opera Ballet, who will appear with the New York City Ballet at the State Theater as part of an exchange agreement between the two companies.

Bergets are running around loose on a Saturday night?

title: Iran Cuts Price for Crude Oil Further
description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 10A further cut in the price of heavy crude oil was announced today by Iran, the second largest producer among the members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries. of crude oil by Saudi Arabia, which is OPEC's largest producer, and Kuwait.

title: REPORT URGES BAN ON PRISON TESTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 10A new staff report for a Governmentappointed commission recommends that most medical research in prisons be discontinued.

title: MILTON M. UNGER, NEWARK LAWYER
description: Milton M. Unger, a Newark lawyer who once arrested the Graf Zeppelin on behalf of a client, died Wednesday at Overlook Hospital, Summit, N. J. He was 90 years old and lived in South Orange.

title: Hays in Ohio Hospital
description: Representative Wayne L. Hays, accused of using Government funds to maintain a mistress, was in guarded condition in an Ohio hospital after falling into a coma in what his physician called an overreaction to a prescribed sleeping pill. Page B 5.

title: Tower Resigns as Aide To Ford at Convention
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 (AP)Senator John G. Tower, Republican of Texas, resigned today as President Ford's floor manager for the Republican convention in Kansas City.

title: Laotian Students to Return
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, June 10 (Reuters)  More than 3,000 (students sent to China and North Vietnam to continue their studies during the fighting in Laos are returning home, an official spokesman said today.

title: Advertising
description: In a speech that he has been giving since March to various members of his top management, Jeremiah J. Attridge, vice president and general manager of corporate advertising and sales promotion of the JohnsManville Sales Corporation, has been pointing out that the organization gave up largescale corporate advertising 20 years ago and dropped from 117th on the Fortune 500 list in 1956 to 221st in 1970.

title: Books of The Times
description: AFRIEND of mine told me that he had once written a short story in order to have a particular character perform a particular action, oniy to find that the character refused to carry out his design. In developing the story, the author had also developed the character in such a way that the projected action was no longer consistent with his psychology. A fully imagined character is not altogether at the disposal of his creator. He acquires a certain autonomy, based on qualities attributed to him by the author, who often unconsciously makes him richer and more complex than he had originally planned. This is one of the elements that make good fiction an adventure for the author as well as for the characters and the reader.

title: Knicks Taking On A Burden (Ticky)

C., June 10 (AP)Lee Trevino's aching back, which may knock him out of the United States Open, and a violent thunderstorm today upstaged the sixunderpar 66 Mason Rudolph carded for the lead among those who finished the first round of the $250,000 Kemper open golf tournament.

description: The KerrMcGee Corporation's $125 million of highgrade bonds marketed yesterday sold out quickly even though they were priced to yield 8.57 percent, well below the 8.90 percent return put on simiCredit larly rated ConMarkets tinental Oil Cornpany bonds offered two weeks ago. The drop in yield represented the most adventurous attempt yet to test the bond market's recovery since Memorial Day, and it seemed to foreshadow still lower longterm interest rates.

description: Jimmy Carter picked up more delegates yesterday in his quest for the 1.505 votes needed to assure him a firstballot Presidential nomination at the Democratic National Convention.

title: Art: Hockney, The Inimitable
description: SIXTEEN years ago the word got around that there was a student at the Royal College of Art in London called David Hockney. All manner of amusing things were said about him, and a great many of them were true, and right from the start there were people who snapped up his first etchings when they were put on the market at a cautious $8 apiece. Hockney's work had a larky, unsubdued energy and an inimitable handwriting; no one could mistake a Hackney.

description: The Assembly gave final legislative passage to a bill permitting motorists to make right turns on red lights. The bill would take effect six months after being signed into law. Its sponsors predicted it would save millions of gallons of gasoline each year.

description: ROME, June 10 (Reuters) Alessandro Lamburghini, a Romanbuilding contractor kidnapped two weeks ago, was released last night after his family paid a ransom believed to have totaled $800,000.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, June 10The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the holiday week ended June 5 totaled an estimated 14.1 billion tonmiles, 7.6 percent below the corresponding nonholiday week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 423,752 cars, off 10.5 percent from last year. The American Trucking Association Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was down 3 percent from last year.

description: MADRID, June 10Hundreds of supporters of a general amnesty for political prisoners and exiles discovered today when they sought to meet that it is not enough to pass a law.

title: A Shetland Sheepdog Best in Denver Show

title: Bangladesh Flood Toll at 15
