description: 12 staionl 13, Gorilla; 14, Nimbus; 16, Piranha; 17, Clover; 18, Sanguine; 20, Betlournan; 22, Quest; 23, Scat; 25, Cocoanut.

title: DON BOLLES DIES; MAIMED REPORTER
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., June 13Don Bolles, the reporter for The Arizona Republic whose car was bombed while he was working on an article about the Mafia, died today, a spokesman for the newspaper said.

title: CourtMartial to Begin Today In Boot Camp Death of Marine
description: SAN DIEGO, June 13The first of four courtsmartial in the Marine Corps worst boot camp scandal in 20 years starts tomorrow at the San Diego Marine Recruit Denot.

title: Miss Adler Bride Of Martin Goldwyn
description: Caroline Adler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney G. Adler of Lawrence, L.I., was married yesterday afternoon at her parents home to Martin Goldwyn, son of Mrs. Solomon Goldwyn of Great Neck Estates, L.I., and the late Mr. Goldwyn.

title: Book Publishers Caught Unprepared For Carter's Fast Rise as Candidate
description: LOS ANGELES, June 13Literati: There won't be time, apparently, for anyone to write and publish a booklength evaluation this year of Jimmy Carter, the presumed Democratic Presidential nomineeexcept, of course, his own story, Why Not The Best?' which Bantam books has just reissued in paperback. Peter Pringle of The Sunday Times of London had been contemplating a Carter book with James Wade and the Dial Press but gave up the idea One respected American book and newspaper writer started pushing the idea of a Carter portrait last March but could not find a publisher who thought the former Georgia Governor had a chance of being nominated. As recently as a month ago, publishers were telling the same writer that there was too little chance of Mr. Carter's being elected to risk the investment.

title: KISSINGER MENDS FENCES IN MEXICO
description: CANCUN. Mexico, June 13Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's 72hour visit to Mexico, which ended here tonight, seems to have cleared the air of recent tensions in United States Mexican relations, officials from both countries said today.

title: W.K. Harvey, C.I.A. Aide, 60; Linked to AntiCastro Plotting
description: William K. Harvey, reportedly the head of a special Central Intelligence Agency group set up in the 1960's to plan the removal of foreign leaders by means including assassination, died of a heart attack last Wednesday in an Indianapolis hosnital.

title: A Liberal's Confession
description: DAVIS, Calif.This is a sermon. Like many sermons, it commences with a confession. I am a liberal, and I have sinned.

title: Teamster Dissidents Picket Convention
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 13A handful of rankandfile delegates to the convention of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters said today that they would offer amendments to the teamster constitution to democratize the union, but they conceded that they had little chance of success.

title: Greek Cathedral's New Interior Is Sanctified in Ancient Ritual
description: The interior of the Greek Orthodox Archdiocesan Cathedral of the Holy Trinity at 319 East 74th Streetrenovated at a cost of $500,000was sanctified yesterday in accordance with ancient Byzantine ritual.

title: DEMOCRATS BACK CALL IN PLATFORM FOR SOVIET AMITY
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 The drafting subcommittee of the Democratic Platform Committee voted today to commit the party to seeking areas of cooperation with the Soviet Union while maintaining a strong American military deterrent.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: AN EVENING WITH DIANA ROSS, directed by Joe Layton; musical director, Gil Askey; special material by Bill Goldenberg and Bill Dyer. At the Palace, Broadway at 47th Street, at 6:45. Two week engagement.

title: Strike Voted at Iron Works
description: BATH. Me., June 13 (AP)Union workers at the Bath Iron Works voted today to strike for pay increases that a union official said would bring wages at the iron works to levels paid at other union shipyards around the country. The union wants a wage of $6 an hour for firstyear workers, who earned $4.73 an hour under the contract negotiated three years ago. The union rejected the latest company offer of $5.80 an hour.

title: Rep. Howe Held on Sex Charge in Utah; Gravel Denies Sex on Boat With Miss Ray
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Representative Allan Turner Howe, a 48yearold freshman Democrat from Utah, was arrested in Salt Lake City last night on a misdemeanor charge of soliciting sex acts for hire after he allegedly propositioned a policewoman who was posing as a prostitute.

title: Charles C. Griffin Dead at 74; Latin American History Expert
description: Dr. Charles C. Griffin, a scholar and expert in Latin American history and former dean of the faculty at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., died yesterday at his Hyde Park. N.Y., home at the age of 74. He had been ill with emphysema.

title: GUS HALL DEPLORES ATTACK ON DETENTE
description: Gus Hall, Communist candidate for President, decried majorparty campaign attacks on SovietAmerican rapproachment yesterday in his first mass campaign rally here at Manhattan Center, 311 West 34th Street. He insisted dtente was a twowav gain.

title: Cuba Cuts Papers Size
description: HAVANA, June 13 (Reuters)Havana's only two daily newspapers will each lose two pages tomorrow to save paper under austerity measures introduced to help the country achieve its first fiveyear development plan. The Communist Party's morning newspaper. Granma, will have six pages instead of eight. The evening paper Juventud Rebelde will have four.

title: UGANDA TRAVELERS TELL OF BIG PURGE
description: NIAIROBI, Kenya, June 13 (AP)  Unconfirmed reports reaching here today told of a mass purge through shootings and arrests in Uganda after an attempt to assassinate President Idi Amin.

title: For Carter, a Dash Of Humor Suffices
description: ATLANTA, June 9Jimmy Carter has about the same attitude toward humor as that of a simple meatandpotatoes cook towards garlic, hot peppers and herbs. A little, he seems to believe, goes a long way.

title: 2 Crews Qualify For Olympics
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 13  Larry Klecatsky and Bill Belden, a New York Athletic ClubUdine Boat Club combination, qualified today to represent the United States in the double sculls at the Olympic Games.

title: 3 Muses Have Irish Accents in Yonkers
description: YONKERS, June 13Michatel Carnase, a blueeyed, frecklefaced 9yearold, sat, crosslegged under the tree playing an Irish jig on a violin.

title: The Bandwagon as a Tote Bag
description: Some of the cotton tote bags that Sally Weiner runs up in her Westbeth apartment are decorated with pictures of Heinz ketchup bottles; Elsie, the Borden cow, and the designs found on such beverages as Sprite, Diet Pepsicola and Ballantine draft beer. But some people whose tastes run more to the political might warm to a series with nostalgic overtones.

title: Godspell Moving to Broadway After a Profitable 5Year Run
description: About a year ago the producers of Godspellwhich has been running five years Off Broadwayconducted a survey among 500 theatergoers in the Broadway area to determine how many of them had seenor not seen the musical based on the Gospel According to St. Matthew.

title: Youth Captures Sail Trial
description: ASSOCIATION ISLAND. N.Y., June 13The making of the United States Olympic sailing contingent began to jell in today's second race of the sevenrace selection trials at the United States Sailing Center.

title: Angolans Relying on Cuban Medical Teams
description: HUAMBO, Angola, June 3If the Cuban doctors go when the Cuban troops pull out of Angola, we will all die, an Angolan priest said the other day.

title: Food Stamp Rolls In New York State Will Be Increased
description: New York State's 367,000 participants in the Supplemental Security Income program for aged, blind and disabled poor people will become eligible on July 1 for food stamps.

description: American Ballet Theater's production of La Bayadre brought in two casts of principals on Saturday at the Metropolitan Opera House. Eleanor D'Antuono and Ted Kivitt led the evening performance.

description: Roosevelt Entries

title: Dance: Muriel Aasen
description: For a supposedly antitraditional company, the New York City Ballet has its fair share of traditional classics. Three of the five generally agreedupon 19thcentury classics have found a home in the current repertory. The most recent addition has been Copplia, and like the others, it has been recast by George Balanchine in a mold that reflects his special tastes and sense of theater.

title: England Gains in World Cup Soccer
description: HELSINKI, Finland, June 13 (UPI)England beat Finland, 41, today in their Group 2 World Cup qualifying soccer game at the Olympic Stadium. The English team performed listlessly in the first half, clinging to a 21 lead, but in the second half put, on a dazzling display of ball control. Kevin Keegan of Liverpool scored twice and the other Engfish, goals were by Stuart Pearson and Mick Channon. Matti Paaelainen, Finland's captain, scored his team's goal.

title: U.N. Finds Teams of Men Pulling the Plows in Laos
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 13 (AP)Teams of human buffalos pull plows in parts of Laos where btiffalo herds were decimated during the long Indochina war, a United Nations report says.

title: BRITISH LAWYERS AID MERCENARIES
description: LUANDA, Angola, June 13The Angolan Peoples Revolutionary Tribunal agreed today to allow a team of four British lawyers to take over the defense of British mercenaries in midtrial to give every opportunity to the defense.

title: Muses Have Irish Accents For 2.200 in Yonkers Feis
description: YONKERS, June 13Michael Carnase, a blueeyed, frecklefaced 9yearold sat crosslegged under the tree playing an Irish jig on a violin.

title: Slain Mafia Leader's Porcelains Are Auctioned
description: CHICAGO, June 13In a large sweltering room that looked like a mock Moorish castle, the earthly goods of Sam (Momo) Giancana, the slain Mafia mobster, were sold today to the highest bidder.

title: ItalianAmericans Adopt an Aloof Attitude Toward Italy's Election
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I.In 1948, thousands of ItalianAmericans, fearful of strong Communist gains in Italy's postWorld War II elections, banded together and inundated their relatives with letters urging them to reiect the Reds.

title: Dorothy Fink Married
description: Dorothy Love Fink, widow of Frank Fink, was married yesterday morning to J. Peter Brunswick. The ceremony was performed in the Hemisphere Club in the TimeLife Building by Rabbi Avraham Soltes. The bride, a producer of Broadway musicals, is the daughter of Mrs. Charles Schwartz of New York and the late Mr. Schwartz. Mr. Brunswick is advertising manager and public relations director of ElAl Airlines. His previous marriage ended in divorce. He is a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Brunswick of Wrzburg, Germany.

title: Washington and Business
description: WASHINGTONFor the 10th consecutive year, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission will record a sizable increase in its backlog of job complaints when its books close on the fiscal year at the end of this month, with the number likely to be more than 130,000.

title: Ogilvy & Mather ChicagoBound
description: Ogilvy & Mather is going to establish itself in a big way in Chicago, the world's second largest advertising city.

title: 10Day Channel 13 Auction Brings Bids of $1.6 Million
description: A diamond, 4,320 pieces of bubble gum and other items offered during Channel 13's marathon ontheair auction brought announced sales of $1.6 million, up $500,000 from last year, officials of WNET reported.

title: Study Urges More Care in the Selection of VicePresidential Nominees
description: A Harvard University study to be released today charges that the present system of choosing VicePresidential nominees contains an inherent and unacceptable degree of risk.

description: JOHANNESBURG, June 13Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia flew to Pretoria today for discussions with Prime Minister John D. Vorster.

title: GRAIN FRAUD IN 61 AIDED COMPANIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 13Agriculture Department agents found corruption in the graininspection system 13 years before similar wrongdoing erupted into a national scandal, but department officials recommended there against prosecution and the case was dropped.

title: Chile's Seeking of Capital Threatening Andean Pact
description: BOGOTA, Colombia  The Andean Economic Integration Pact is in danger of breaking up because of a political dispute between Chile and other members of the group over treatment of foreign capital.

title: Jay Wolf, 47, Producer, Casting Director and Agent
description: Jay Wolf, casting director, producer and theatrical agent, died at his home in Manhattan Friday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 47 years old.

title: Donna Young Captures Golf in Playoff
description: TORONTO, June 13 (AP)Donna Caponi Young fired a fiveunderpar 67 today to force a playoff against Judy Rankin, then parred the first extra hole to win the $80.000 Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament.

title: Samuel Barkin Weds Patricia L. Aronow
description: Patricia Leslie Aronow, an editor with Tobe Associates, New York fashion consultants, was married yesterday at noon to Samuel Barkin, a buyer for the men's store at Blooiningdale's. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel performed the ceremony in the BethEl Chapel of Temple EmanuEl.

title: CHILE LOAN HELD RISKY FOR BANKS
description: A recent $125 million loan to the Government of Chile by 16 major New York, California and Canadian banks carries a very substantial risk for the banks involved, Representative Henry S. Reuss, Democrat of Wisconsin, has warned in a letter to the Comptroller of the Currency, James E. Smith.

title: Twisters Hit Chicago Area. Two Deaths Are Reported
description: CHICAGO, June 13 (UPI)At least two persons were killed and 14 injured tonight when a tornado leveled an eightblock area of Lemont, about 30 miles south of here, the authorities said three twisters touched down on Chicago's South Side, ??? injuries were reported.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Top Pentagon officials said yesterday that the United States had agreed to discuss plans for military aid programs to Kenya and Zaire. This is a major policy departure intended to counter growing Soviet military and political influence in Africa. Secretary of Defense Donald H. Rumsfeld will go to Nairobi and Kinshasa this week for talks in the first official mission of a United States Defense Secretary to Africa. (Page 1, Column 8.]

title: 5CentaPound Flying Raises $2,000 for Hospital
description: TETERBORO, June 13At Teterboro Airport here, it was fundraising at 5 cents a poundthe more you weighed, the more you paid.

title: Dr. Beth Koster Becomes Bride
description: Dr. Beth Ellen Koster, who starts an internship next month at Presbyterian Hospital, was married yesterday to Dr. Stuart Charles Yudofsky, a New York psychiatrist. Rabbi Joseph Speiser officiated in Temple Beth El, New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: G.E. and Unions Expected to Press Talks
description: Negotiations between the General Electric Company and two major electrical unions are expected to intensify this week as top level bargainers for both sides try to work out new agreements for 85,000 workers.

title: Steel Politics
description: President Ford's decision to impose threeyear quotas on imports of specialty steels makes a travesty of the Administration's repeated pledges of a liberal trade policy. The nation's deep economic interest in expanding trade is being treated as a political football.

title: 3 Way Senate Fight Confronts Democrats
description: A complicated threeway struggle emerged yesterday among Democrats seeking the nomination for United States Senator from New York.

title: Heating Oil Price Rise Seen If U.S. Removes Controls
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) The removing of price controls from home heating oil and diesel fuel could bring price Increases to consumers of up to $1.2 billion, a Library of Congress study said today.

title: To Stop Redlining
description: The Federal Reserve Board is taking a minimal attitude toward its responsibilities under the House Mortgage Disclosure Act, which is aimed at discouraging redliningthe practice of some banks and other lending institutions of refraining from mortgage loans in urban areas they consider to be deteriorating, or in danger of deteriorating.

description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo., June 13 They had to do things very badly, a Reagan manager said of the Ford managers, even to let us make it close.

title: Dallas Police Drop Equal Hiring Ratio For Two Minorities
description: DALLAS, June 13A fiveyear, $300,000 program to hire blacks and MexicanAmerican police officers on a onetoone ratio with whites, has been discontinued by the Dallas police department, it was reported today.

title: Mishap Early in Flight Shuts Off TV on Jet
description: DETROIT, June 13 (UPI) While most of the 231 passengers aboard an American Airlines jet were watching the television showing Capt. H. K. Paton manage the DC10's first few minutes of a flight to San Francisco yesterday, a loud bang shot through the first class cabin. The televisions went blank.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Faculty offices and cafeterias were empty last week, but CUNY professors were still gathering in small groups exchanging the apocalyptic gossip and gallows humor that have characterized this past year. Only the surroundings were differentthe long lines at State Employment Offices where they applied for unemployment insurance.

title: New Health Plan Controversy on Coast Centers on the Dismissal of Reformer
description: LOS ANGELESWhile Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. has been away running for President, new controversy over California's troubled 5100 millionayear prepaid health program for the poor is emerging as his administration's thorniest management problem and a potential source of political embarrassment as well.

title: H.W. Connaughton Sr., 72, Crafts Council Accountant
description: Howard William Connaughton Sr., a certified public accountant for the American Crafts Council, a nonprofit organization that maintains the Museum of Contemporary Crafts, at 44 West 53d Street, died of a heart attack yesterday at the United Hospital in Portchester, N.Y.

description: CHICAGO, June 13 (UPI)The sculptor Claes Oldenburg, whose works include a 45foot clothespin and a 24foot lipstick, is doing a 100foot red steel baseball bat for the city of Chicago.

title: Cleaver's Lawyer Quits
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 13 (UPI)George V. Higgins, the authorlawyer, said today that he was quitting as Eldridge Cleaver's lawyer because of profound differences of opinion betwen him and the former Black Panther leader, whose trial had been set for tomorrow. Mr. Cleaver is charged with attempted murder and assault with a deadly weapon in a 1968 Panther shootout with the police. Mr. Higgins's request is expected to be granted tomorrow.

title: Bridge:
description: While a powerful New York team that had won a preliminary skirmish but lost the vital battle returned home gloomily yesterday, squads representing New England and New Jersey clashed in the grand national zonal final in Boston. After 43 of 64 deals, New Jersey led by 31 international match points.

description: The United States Government announced last week programs to hasten development of widely available devices allowing blind students to read at normal speed through conversion of letters and numbers into computerized speech.
