description: Article 3  No Title

title: 2 Automakers Gave Funds To Defeat Atom Plant Curb
description: DETROIT, June 27 (UPI) he nation's two largest automobile makers contributed $45,000 to help defeat a California ballot proposal earlier this month to limit nuclear power plant development in the state, according to a report released today.

title: Imponderables for Italy
description: Italy's prospects of successfully coping with its colossal economic problems while preserving its thirtyyearold democratic system now depend largely on two factors:

title: SmallTown Black Mayors Find Early Going Is Rough
description: TOUGALOO, Miss., June 24Willard Whitaker became the first black Mayor of Madison, Ark., three years ago in a hail of bullets in a shootout with the Ku Klux Klan and a victory at the Dolls.

title: Less Is More and Smaller Bigger As Mozart Festival Opens Today
description: Less is sometimes more, and smaller can be bigger and better. This year, Lincoln Center's Mostly Mozart Festival, a major cultural adornment of New York City's summers will take place in Alice Tully Hall, which is less than half the size of Avery Fisher Hall, the festival's normal site. The number of seats available for each concert will be reduced from 2.836 to 1.096.

title: TWO UNIONS REACH ACCORD WITH G.E.
description: Two major electrical unions reached tentative agreement last night with the General Electric Company on contracts for 87,000 workers in the company's plants around the country.

title: 4 in Fallen Craft Found Dead
description: TRURO, Mass., June 27 (AP)  The bodies of four persons were recovered from the Atlantic Ocean today after the Coast (Guard found a plane from Canada that had been reported missing on a flight over Cape Cod from Nantucket.

title: Sitting In on Meeting Of Rome Communists
description: ROME, June 27Like their comrades around the country, the members of the Monteverde Nuovo section of the Italian Communist Party met last week to analyze election results and the work they had done for the cause.

title: Steel Pier Rocks to Scottish Rollers
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 26The Bay City Rollers, a Scottish rock band that is the idol of young girls in Europe and that had a recent No, I American single, slipped into the Steel Pier Music Hall here tonight for its first American concert performance. The scene in the hall before the band came on was wonderfully, nostalgically reminiscent of rockandroll in its golden youth. The tension in the air was so palpable it made you smile: As soon as they come out. I'll die, said one 12yearold to her friend, and there wasn't a hint of camp or irony in her voice.

title: O.A.S. Chief Cites Strong Feelings On Human Rights
description: The secretary general of the Organization of American States, Alejandro Orfila of Argentina, has declared that his strong personal feelings in the matter of human rights led him to visit the Tres Alamos detention center in Chile earlier this month.

title: Airliner With 257 Hijacked From Athens
description: Hijackers seized an Air France jetliner yesterday with 257 persons aboard forced it to refuel at Benghazi in Libya and then flew it to Entebbe Airport in Uganda, airline officials said early today.

title: Books of The Times
description: The first 30 pages or so of The Lardners: My Family Remenroerea by Ring Lardner Jr., are largely devoted to family genealogy. And because such genealogy tends to put me off, especially when it seems to have no pertinence to the subject of the book except to establish pedigree, I laid The Lardners aside when I first looked at about a month ago. But then, driving from a weekend out of town a few weeks later, I happened to tune in the radio to an interview between Ring Lardner Jr. and a committee composed of Howard Cosell, his ego, and a cough he kept interrupting Lardner to apologize for. Lardner nevertheless persisted and talked intriguingly about his memoir. mentioned Ring Lardner Sr.'s contributions to news reportinghow he was the first to record what people actually said instead of how they would have sounded had their words been processed through Fowler's Modern English Usage.

J. Meehan & Company; Spear, Leeds & Kellogg; Adler, Coleman & Company; Walter N. Frank & Company; Henderson Brothers, Inc.; Phelan, Silver, Vesce, Barry & Company, and Robb, Peck, McCooey & Company.

description: Bursting in as the mysterious vagabond in George M. Cohan's old mysteryfarce, The Tavern, William Newman swings his cape, juggles his staff, flourishes his hat. Now, cape, you hear him thinking. Now, staff. Now, hat.

description: The American AcademyMcAllister Institute of Funeral Service at 229 Park Avenue South is not often a scene of festivity.

title: Geiberger Golf Victor On a Bogey
description: OAK BROOK, Ill., June 27 (AP)Al Geiherger carded a closing 73 that was good enough to win the Western open golf tournament today as Bob Dickson collapsed and lost a sixshot lead and Joe Porter missed with a double bogey on the last hole.

title: Thousands Flock to Rhode Island To See Ships and Spend Money
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 27  This old port turned into a kind of smallscale Woodstockbythewater over the weekend as tens of thousands of people swarmed here to see the tall ships.

title: Sandra D. Handwerger Is Married
description: The marriage of Sandra Dee Handwerger, a 1976 graduate of Vassar College. to Steven N. Masket, who graduated from Vassar last year, took place at noon yesterday at the Suburban Temple of Wantagh, L.I. Rabbi Robert A. Raab performed the ceremony.

title: Housing in Jeopardy
description: The benefits of urban home ownershipold homes as well as neware no longer subject to question. In the city's most stable residential areas, cooperatives have generally remained wellmaintained and fully taxpaying. Their tenantowners have continued to meet the rising costs of housing.

title: BOLIVIA IS SEEKING TO DEFUSE STRIKE
description: A PAZ. Bolvia. June 27 ???The military goverment ??? offered cheaper consumer goods for tin miners in an ??? to defuse a violenceridden ??? dayold strike that is cutting ??? into Botivia's tin revenues.

title: JETLINER BLASTED IN BEIRUT AIRPORT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 27A Boeing 707 passenger jetliner was blasted by artillery and burned to the frame today during bombardment of Beirut Airport. The airport was immediately closed indefinitely.

description: 1Al Unser, ParneillCosworth, 200 lees, 143.622 miles oer hour.

title: Finley Yields on Playing of 3 A's, Averts Strike
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 27 (UPI)  The Oakland A's played today after Charles O. Finley, their owner, averted a strike by agreeing to Commissioner Bowie Kuhn's directive to reinstate three star players to active duty immediately.

title: The Cast
description: THE TAVERN be George M. Cohen. Directed by Michael Posnick; setting hy Vicki Paul; costumes be Peg Schierhols; lighting by Burt J. Patslaic); stage manager, Kimberly Francis Keatsley. Presented by the Actors Alliance. At the Provincetown Playhouse, 133 Macdougal Street.

title: Brazilian Limit on Broadcasts Is a Blow to Opposition Party
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 27The proGovernment majority in the Brazilian Congress has rammed through a bill prohibiting the two political parties from using radio or television for campaigning during municipal elections scheduled later this year.

title: Gas Well Fire Put Out
description: GAYLORD, Mich., June 27 (UPI)A fire with flames 300 feet high at a natural gas well was extinguished today, a month after it erupted. A crew from Houston. Tex., headed by Red Adair, who is wellknown as a fighter of oil well fires, capped the well in a heavily wooded area of northern Michigan after weeks of preparation.

title: SAN QUENTIN SIX TO OPEN DEFENSE
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., June 27 Jerry Herman, the Mann County prosecutor, has coneluded a fiveday closing argument in the trial of the San Quentin Six in Superior Court there. The defense will begin presenting its case tomorrow.

title: Elizabeth C. Wesman Bride of Dana Eischen
description: Elizabeth Claire Wesman, daughter of Mrs. Alexander G. Wesman of White Plains and the late Mr. Wesman, was married yesterday afternoon to Dana Edward Eischen, son of Irene A. Eischen of East Syracuse, N.Y., and Edward E. Eischen of Canandaigua, N.Y.

description: No. Amer. Soccer League

title: Personal Finance
description: The recent run on deposits at many savings and loan associations in Mississippi called attention to the question of insurance of the savingsor share; as they are sometimes calledaccounts at such associations. Americans have deposited more than $300 million in such financial institutions, which have been created to foster both thrift and home ownership, and are naturally concerned with the safety of these accounts.

title: Dello Joio Wins N.J. Jump Prize
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., June 27Allegro, owned by Vincent Murphy and ridden by Norman dello Joio,.was both speedy and surefooted today, and the combination earned him first place in the jumper special at the Middlesex horse show.

title: The Other Mayor
description: BOSTON, June 27This tired city has two mayors. One is U. S. District Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. who personally directs the administration of the strifetorn public school system in an effort to carry through his farreaching plan for desegregation and school reform.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SCORE & SCRIPT These unfamiliar bank sounds tonight and tomorrow won't be jingling coins but oldtime ballads, as the Manhattan Savings Bank stages a free Bicentennial tribute in melody with a vocal octet and pianist. Vintagemusic fans are invited to look in on the sessions being held tomorrow at 7:30 P.M. at the bank's Park Lane office, third Avenue and fifth Street, and Wednesday at 12:15 and 1 P.M. at the bank's main office, Madison and 47th Street.

title: Hayes Captures North Shore Net
description: MANHASSET, L. I., June 27John Hayes, a Princeton senior from Cos Cob, Conn., defeated Joe Bouquin of Danbury, Conn., 46, 61, 64, and won the North Shore tennis championship today at the Valley Tennis Courts. Hayes broke Bouquin's service in the third game of the final set and led the rest of the way.

title: Coast Quake Measures 2.5
description: LOS ANGELES, June 27 (UPI) An earthquake measuring 2.5 on the Richter scale was re??? in the Los Angeles area cordod at 3:15 p.m. There were no reports of damage.

title: SCHAUFUSS SPECIAL AS BALLET'S OBERON
description: Every so often in ballet a dancer comes along whose individuality is so distinct that he does not belong to any type or category. Peter Schaufuss is such a dancer, and his first appearance as Oberon Saturday night at the State Theater in the New York City Ballet's A Midsummer Night's Dream proved the point again.

title: Phils Defeat Cardinals, 62 With Boone's Grand Slam
description: BobBoone who started the season With only 16 home runs in his four years with the Philadelphia Phillies, hit his third homer of this season yesterday, and it was a big one a grand slam that capped a sixrun fourth inning in a 62 victory over the visitinff St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Option Investors Aware of Risks, Survey Shows
description: The typical person who trades in stock options is financially secure, sophisticated aware of the risks of option trading and in general happy with how he has fared in the marketplace.

title: A Sour Keynote
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Howard Raker, the man chosen by President Ford to be the keynote speaker at the Republican convention, has a problem. But it's not the problem he thinks he has.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is, of course, preferable to make the civilian nuclear power program as safe as possible. But is it possible to make nuclear power safe? This most fundamental of questions is dodged in your otherwise commendable June 15 editorial Nuclear Safety.

title: Connally Concedes Panel's. Ads Had Little Effect on Italian Voting
description: LOS ANGELES, June 27John B. Connally's Committee for Freedom in the Mediterranean, which took fullpage advertisements in several Eastern newspapers recently had no substantial effect on the Italian elections last Weekend. Mr. Connally cheerfully conceded today. For that matter, the ads got a very modest response in this country. he said.

title: Albany's Supplemental Budget Provides for Many Pet Projects
description: ALBANY, Monday, June 28In a year of the tightest fiscal constraints in memory here. the Leoislature this morning enacted into law a document containing hundreds of appropriations for pet projects and interests of its members, and a total of $126 million outright in appropriations that had the distinction of nobody knowing how much they would actually cost the state this year.

title: Caren Levine Has Nuptials
description: Caren Levine, daughter of Carl Levine of New York and East Hampton, L.I., and Adrienne Levine of Miami Beach, was married yesterday afternoon to Kenneth B. Stanley, son of Sydney Stanley of Miami and Mrs. A. D. Sperber of Great Neck, L.I.

title: Radio Contact Is Lost With Atlantic Balloonist
description: Ground crews lost radio communication with transAtlantic balloonist Karl Thomas yesterday but said they did not believe there was any cause for alarm.

title: Inner City Houses In Demand as Costs Soar in the Suburbs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 25The soaring cost of new homes around the country is stirring new interest in the neglected older homes in the heart of many American cities.

title: Sade, Matthews Win At Wrestling Trials
description: BROCKPORT, N.Y., June 27 (AP)Joe Sade of Eugene, Ore., and John Matthews of Flint, Mich., were surprise winners tonight in the United States Olympic GrecoRoman wrestling trials at Brockport College.

title: Cyclists Score Helmet Law
description: MADISON, Wis., June 27 (AP)Thousands of motorcyclists converged on the streets around the state Capitol today, to dramatize their displeasure with the Wisconsin law that requires them to wear helmets. States without helmet laws faced cutbacks in Federal highway safety and construction funds in the past, but that threat was eliminated by a Congressional amendment earlier this year.

title: Dr. Raymond W. Lewis, 87; Pioneer in SoftTissue Xray
description: Dr. Raymond W. Lewis, who for 25 years was the director of the department of roentgenology at the Hospital for Special Surgery in Manhattan, died Friday at the Pettipaug South Nursing Home in Old Saybrook, Conn. He was 87 years old and had lived in Madison, Conn., since his retirement in 1953.

description: Results of Nearby Yachting

title: New Prorain Seeks to Settle Disputes Out of Court
description: Nancy had been pestering Joanne with phone calls but promised to stop.

title: MIKE ROY, 63, HOST OF COOKING SHOW
description: Mike Roy, whose fiveminute, program, Mike Roy's Cooking Thing. was broadcast nationally six times a week over the CBS radio network, died on Saturday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Torrance, Calif. He was 63 years old.

title: Waterloo Village Meets Its Newport as Jazz Goes to New Jersey
description: WATERLOO VILLAGE, N.J., June 27Bessie N. Smith, a mid19thcentury resident of Waterloo Village lies buried in the Methodist Church graveyard. Until yesterday, that was as close as this peaceful little Sussex County hamlet had ever gotten to the world of jazz.

title: A Drummer Call to Worship
description: KENTON, Ohio, June 27 (UPI)A drummer boy in a Colonial costume called people to worship today at St. John's United Church of Christ in this west central Ohio community where Pastor Erwin Koch, in a Bicentennial celebration, patterned his worship service after one held May 23, 1776.

title: Texas Cattle Auction As Big as the Ritz
description: DALLAS, June 27  Joe Bachmuth grew up in a Manhattan apartment, made a fortune in children's clothing and gets his kicks playing cowboy.

title: After the Corporation
description: WASHINGTON  We Americans must begin to consider how we will replace the large corporation as the central institution of our economy.

title: Argentina Fighting Both Leftist Subversion and Counterterrorism by Right
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 27Terrorism by leftwing extremists in Argentina has provoked counterterrorism by security forces that the military Government here is trying to bring under control.

title: Nigerians Fear New Revelations in Cement Scandal
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, June 27The ships laden with cement that have paralyzed Nigeria's ports for the last 15 months are gradually being unloaded and sent on their way, but the scandal that brought them here may not yet have run its course.

title: A's Strike Averted
description: Charles O. Finley, owner of the Oakland A's, averted a strike by his players yesterday by permitting Joe Rudi, Vida Blue and Rollie Fingers to play, Page 35.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Ford, at a summit meeting of seven major industrial nations in Puerto Rico, yesterday said that Governments had overcommitted themselves economically in order to improve social conditions and raise their citizens standard of living. He told the other leaders in a private session that the industrialized nations must set more realistic social and economic goals that would be acceptable to the people of their countries. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Baudouin's Steady Reign Bolsters Belgian Throne
description: BRUSSELS. June 27In July 1951, a shy, nervous young man of 21 wearing eyeglasses and an oversized army uniform was sworn in as King of the Belgians, taking over a shaky throne from his disgraced father, Leopold III.

title: ;Life BeforetheMast Wasn't a Breeze
description: When the parade of tall ships churns the waters of New York Bay white on the July 4 weekend and the great square sails billow out in slow motion, the viewer ashore may find it hard to visualize the harsh life of the sailor who originally took those shins to sea.

title: SCHOOL DISTRICTS FREE OF DEFICITS
description: Twentyseven of New York City's 32 community school, districts will end the fiscal year. Wednesday with thair budgets on target: the very opposite of the situation two years ago when 27 districts lhad deficits.

title: Ali Punches More for Army
description: SEOUL, South Korea. June 27Muhammad Ali, who is supposed to collect $6 million for a few punches in Tokyo yesterday, earned a souvenir sweater for hundreds of punches at a United States Army unit today. The world heavyweight champion fought two exhibitions for the Second Infantry Division after receiving a hero's welcome in downtown Seoul from hundreds of thousands of Koreans.

title: The Opera: Two OneActers Are Sung in Spoleto
description: SPOLETO, Italy, June 27 Two oneact operas, one of them a world premiere, were presented last night at the Caio Melisso by the Spoleto Festival. Different as they were, the scores had a certain family relationship. They reflected a type of expressionistic composition all the rage three decades ago, and there was something actually nostalgic about their defiant modernism.

title: Crime Rate in Soweto Among World's Highest
description: JOHANNESBURG, June 27 The crime rate in Soweto, for which gangs of young thugs called tsotsis are in large part to blame, is among the highest in the world; last year 845 murders were reported there. A white doctor who has worked in Soweto's large black hospital says that during the weekend the injury wards were the busiest he had seen anywhere and, he noted, he has worked at Bellevue in New York.

title: Frazzled Legislators Pondering Lulus
description: ALBANY. June 27While legislative leaders struggled behind closed doors to resolve the weighty issues blocking their way to adjournnment, frazzled legislators stranded in the Capitol found themselves caught up today in something that affects their careers more directlythe dispensing of the, allowances, popularly known as lulus. that supplement their salaries. Like firstgraders opening up party favors after gorging themselves on ice cream and birthday cake, the lawmakers were winding up their long session by passing around sheaves of paper today that indicated exactly which jobs would be awarded which allowances for next year, and trading stories about which of them were getting shut out of the lulu market altogether this year.

title: Tire Retailers Doing Brisk Business Despite Strike
description: JERSEY CITY, June 27 We're not breaking any records, but we're doing fine, Jim DeLuna, the owner of SanDee's Firestone, was saying as he stood in the withering June heat watching his employees roll out new tires to waiting cars.

title: BERGEN BOROUGH PEERS BEYOND 76
description: BERGENFIELD, June 27This Bergen County borough's Bicentennial Committee took a look into the future yesterday, examining goals for America's third century in a Horizons Day 76 program at the Bergenfield Library.

title: Carolina Governor Doubts Most of South Backs Carter
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., June 27 (UPI)Gov. James B. Edwards said today that a majority of Southerners would not vote for former Georgia Gov. Jimmy Carter, whom he described as a man who wants to grant amnesty to the yellowbellies who were afraid to fight in Vietnam.

title: FORD SAYS NATIONS OVERCOMMITTED THEIR ECONOMIES
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., June 27President Ford, who opened a summit meeting of seven major industrial nations here, said today that Governments had overcommitted themselves economically in order to improve social conditions and raise their citizens standard of living.

title: N. J. Tennis. Titles Are Won by Siegel
description: KEARNY, N.J., June 27Steve Siegel of Teaneck won the singles and shared the doubles title in the New Jersey State men's tennis championships at the Arlington Players Club today.

title: Summer Programs Beginning In New York's Public Schools
description: Summer programs for New York City's public schools begin officially on Tuesday, July 6, but several programs financed by Federal grants will start this week.

title: Track Summaries
description: Track Summaries

title: Burke Fears Suspension of Teachers
description: Dr. Fred G. Burke, the State 2.commissioner of Education, said yesterday that 900 members of his own staff and up to 20,000 summer school teachers stood to be suspended, immediately as state officials were preparing for a possible courtordered shutdown of public schools this week.

title: U. S. Driver Injured
description: LEICESTER, England, June 27 (AP)Bill Dubelmann, a driver from Washington, was seriously injured today in a collision during a European 5000 championship auto race at Mallory Park, Leicestershire.

title: Ruth Bienstock Bride of Robert Anolik
description: At the Oakland Jewish Center in Bayside, Queens, yesterday afternoon, Ruth Bienstock and Robert Anolik, 1974 graduates of Cornell University, were married by Rabbi Louis Bernstein. He was assisted by Rabbis Paul Hait and Alvin S. Roth.

title: Korshak's Power Rooted In Ties to Labor Leaders
description: In October 1961, a c.nicago labor lawyer named Sidney R. Korshak unexpectedly checked into the Riviera Hotel in Las Vegas. The hotel was the site of a conference of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, the nation's largest union, and it was jammed.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Tigers, at Detroit. (TelevisionChannel 7, 8:30 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 8:30 P.M.)

title: Potomac Crew Wins in England
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 27The Nottingham International Regatta concluded here today, with the only American victory of the day by the Potomac Boat Club of Washington, D.C., in the Ellite II four without coxswain. Potomac beat Dublin University by 7.23 seconds in the winning time of 6 minutes 51.38 seconds.

title: Connors and Nastase Rated Likely Wimbledon Finalists
description: WIMBLEDON. England, June 27In steaming 90degree heat last week, unknown in this country since German bombers crossed the Channel in 1940, the old warriors in their 30's. Arthur Ashe, John Newcombe, Tom Okker and Tony Roche, faded away in the sun and dust, leafing the stage open to an almost inevitable meeting in the AllEngland Club final between Jimmy Connors and his friend and archrival lie Nastase.

title: Albany Passes Extension Of TenantProtection Act
description: ALBANY, June 27  The Assembly today gave final passage to a bill extending for a year rent laws affecting 1.2 million apartments, and moments later its majority leader observed that the coming year would bring a strong challenge to further extension and perhaps to the whole concept of government regulation of rents.

title: TRIAL OF HARRISES ENTERING 2D WEEK
description: LOS ANGELES, June 27As the trial of William and Emily Harris moves into its second week tomorrow, not one juror has been sworn in the state's kidnapping, assault and robbery case against the two members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army.

title: Yankees Rout Brewers, 62, 102, Before 41,2 4 9
description: It seemed not just like old times at Yankee Stadium yesterday. In many ways, it was better.

title: Coast Quake Measures 2.5
description: LOS ANGELES, June 27 (UPI) An earthquake measuring 2.5 on the Richter scale was recorded in the Los Angeles area today at 3:15 p.m. There were no reports of damage.

description: A special telephone number has been set up by the New York Telephone Company to provide information about Operation Sail.

title: Della Rodbart Wed to Morton A. Cohen
description: At the Westbury Hebrew Congregation in Old Westbury, L.T., yesterday afternoon, Della Rodbart, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Sol Rodbart of Westbury, was married to Morton Alan Cohen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Cohen of Lynbrook, L. I.

title: Darcy Lowell Becomes Bride
description: Darcy Ilene Lowell, daughter of Vivian Lowell of New York and Stanley H. Lowell of Scarsdale, N. Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Jay Lewis Meizlish, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan B. Meizlish of New York. Rabbi Yaakov Pollak performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's father and stepmother.

title: ASSEMBLY BACKS A CUT IN PENSIONS FOR NEWLY HIRED
description: ALBANY, June 27The Assembly early today passed its version of a bill that sharply reduces pension benefits for future public employeesmainly those hired after July 1.

title: 100 Plus 100 More
description: Johnnycomelatelies, runaway corporations and other shortwinded scoffers at Manhattan are not eligible for membership in this city's most enduring charmed circle the Hundred Year Association. For this is the organization of business enterprises, trade, industrial, professional and philanthropic groups that have flourished this city for a century or more.

title: JETLINER BLASTED IN BEIRUT AIRPORT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 27A Boeing 707 passenger jetliner was blasted by artillery and burned to the frame today during bombardment of Beirut Airport. The airport was immediately closed indefinitely.

title: Tourists in Plains, Ga., Learn Little
description: PLAINS, Ga. June 27There is a growing trickle of tourists flowing through this little south Georgia town of 6S3 people, the home of Jimmy Carter, who will surely be the next Democratic Presidential nominee.

title: Cup to Manhasset Bay
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., June 27  The Manhasset Bay Yacht Club defeated Seawanhaka Corinthian, two races to one, and retained the Glen Cairn team championship of Long Island Sound today.

title: Logical, $14.40, Wins at Belmont
description: Perhaps in a few days, Enoch Rea a 72yearold horse trainer will stop secondguessing himself.

title: People Listen to Steingut's No'
description: ALBANY, June 27Stanley Steingut said No the other day, which is pretty good proof that the state's continuing, experiment in selfgovernment, the Albany legslative session, is about over. The evidence rests on two absolute rules of state politics. The first is that Stanley Steingut, the Brooklyn Democrat who is Speaker of the Assembly, did not get where he is today by saying no to anyone except under the most dire circumstances.

title: Mrs. Rankin Leads
description: CHAGRIN FALLS, Ohio, June 27 (AP)  Judy Rankin shot a second straight 69 here today to take a three??? lead over JoAnne Carner ter the third round of the ??? Babe Zaharias Invitation tournament.

title: Soviet Hijackers Refused Asylum by a U. S. Embassy
description: ANKARA, Turkey, June 27 (AP)A Lithuanian father and son who hijacked a Soviet plane to Turkey six years ago made an unsuccessful bid for asylum at the United States Embassy, officials there said today.

title: in Aemoriam
description: AUGERRachel. Your first full year In elm.Mir. The sorrow of life without you deepens every day, but the ley of loving memories gives meaning to the lonely years that remain, May

title: Soviet Purchasing
description: Commodity experts say there has been too much emphasis on Soviet purchases of American crops and not enough on the overall supplydemand picture. Page 42.

title: NEW SOVIET DRIVE TO CURB GEORGIA
description: MOSCOW, June 27 (Reuters) The Soviet Union's top Communists today ordered an allout campaign against ideological deviation, corruption and nationalism in the Caucasian republic of Georgia, which has been disturbed recently by a series of bomb and arson attacks.

title: Deaths
description: BELI rvl no. Beloved husband of Anna, love In father of Jerry and Stanley. Cherished grandfather of Shari, Allyson and Julie. Uear brother. Services were held Sunday, Jolter Funeral Homes, Hillside Ave. al 188 St., Hollis, L.I.

title: Dr. Pearce Bailey Dead at 73; Neurology Institute's First Head
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Dr. Pearce Bailey, an internationally recognized neurologist and author and the first director of the National Institute of Neurological and Communicative Disorders'and Stroke at the National institutes of Health. died here Wednesday of cardia arrest. He was 73 years old.

title: Al Unser Is First In 500 at Pocono
description: LONG POND, Pa., June 27 Al Unser, ready to give up at one point, drove a faltering car to a 3.4second victory today over a driver who did quit once, in the world's second richest automobile race.

title: 6 Picked in Gymnastics
description: UNIVERSITY PARK. Pa., June 27 (UPI)  A United States gymnastics team composed of six young men, different in strengths but similar in overall abilities, will head for Montreal tomorrow hoping to gain an olympic medal in their sport for the first time since 1932.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Nassau County's Office of Community Development has applied to the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development for a $617,000 neighborhood preservation grant for the community of Roosevelt. The county Board of Supervisors will be asked today to ratify the action of Ralph G. Caso, the County Executive, in making the application. The supervisors will also be asked to approve two other resolutions to permit the county purchase of 15 residences in two communities to be resold and rehabilitated. Mr. Caso said the objective of the proposal was to provide a mechanism for the coordination of all present and future resources to stabilize and revitalize the community.

title: When Your Marriage Goes Into Receivership
description: Need cheering? A telephone call to DialAJoke gets you a recording of a wellknown comedian telling a story, complete with canned laughter. On DialAPrayer, the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church supplies spiritual inspiration, again recorded. Need sympathy? Try Dial A Shoulder and talk to a friendly, live voice.

title: New York City's Finances Examined As LaborPact Deadline Approaches
description: New York City's new budget, altered and approved by the State Emergency Financial Control Board, takes effect Thursday and represents the blueprint for the second and probably the harshest of three years of dollar slashing designed to put the city budget back into balance.

title: Warning From Israel
description: TEL AVIV, June 27Transportation Minister Gad Yaacobi warned today that Israel would take all necessary action both politically and in other spheres to protect the Israelis aboard a hijacked Air France plane flying from Tel Aviv to Paris via Athens.

title: F.B.I. Sought Cash Awards for Team of Agents That Broke Into Socialist Group']s Offices Here in 6465
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Federal Bureau of Investiga, tion's office in New York, City recommended commendations and cash incentive. awards for a team of six bureau agents who carried out 15 burglaries of the Socialist Workers Party's offices in the city in 1964 and 1965, according to bureau documents made public today.

title: Race Discrimination Found Pervasive In Rental of Marsha an Apartments
description: Racial discrimination in the rental of apartments is still widesprepd in New York's prime real estate marketManhattanand works to deny many choice apartments to blacks and other minority group members despite their ability to afford them, an investigation by The New York Times has found.

title: Embryonic Squid Calmed by Chemical In Fluid Inside Egg
description: The reason an embryonic squid does not wriggle so much that it hatches out of its egg prematurely, is that the fluid inside the egg contains a natural chemical tranquilizer.

title: Battle of Monmouth Is Commemorated
description: Battle of Monmouth Is Commemorated

title: PHEBE WHITSETT
description: Phebe Hoffman Whitsett, a graduate of Barnard College in 1912 and for many years a professor of history at Teachers College, Columbia University, died Saturday at a nursing home In Mill Valley, Calif., where she had been living since 1940. She was 86 years old.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: A Plague on Both Your Houses, by Robert W. Whitaker (Robert B. Luce, Washington, $9.95). Political alternatives to the future are explored.

title: CROWDING GROWS IN NEW YORK JAILS
description: New York City's Jail population has risen sharply in the last few weeks, apparently because of the termination of three programs aimed at keeping younger persons charged with lesser crimes out of the institutions, according to the Department of Correction.

title: Franchisers Show How to Succeed, but by Trying
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, June 27  Hundreds of believers in the American dream to do something of their own, to be their own bossconverged on the Ramada Inn like pilgrims this weekend for a fourday Own Your Own Business Expo.

title: Jankunis Winner At 75
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 27Bill Jankunis of Staten Island won the highjump competition today as the United States Olympic track trials ended. The only person as happy as he was his new parttime coach, Dwight Stones, the same Dwight Stones who finished second and also made the United States team.

title: Hearings to Begin Today on Extension Of Rte. 78 Through Watchung Forest
description: Public hearings are scheduled to begin today in the long dispute over the state's plan to extend Interstate 78, a sixlane highway, through part of the Watchung Forest Reservation in Union County.

title: Mets Win, 133, With 8 Runs in Second
description: CHICAGO, June 27  The New York Mets unloaded their biggest inning in six years, an eightrun second, and coasted to a 133 victory over the Chicago Cubs at Wrigley Field today.

title: Revival of Pal Joey No Friend of Original
description: With what must have been an almost audible sigh of relief from its producers, that apparently illfated revival of Pal Joey has finally made it to the Circle in the Square Theater. It made its official how yesterday afternoon after many birth pangs and much heartburn.

title: ARMY CHIEF WINS IN PORTUGAL VOTE FOR A PRESIDENT
description: LISBON, Monday, June 28Portugal's presidential election yesterday gave a solid victory to the lawandorder candidate, la surprisingly high vote to the radical leftist candidate and a defeat to the Communists.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: CobhamDuke Band Plays A Restrained JazzRock
description: Billy Cobham, the drummer, and George Duke, the pianist, are two jazz musicians who have crossed over, as the saying goes, about as far as one; can cross. Mr. Cobham who was a charter member of the Mahavishnu Orchestra jazz rock group, usually applies his awesome technique to thunder ruts, rockStyle drumming while Mr. Duke, who graduated from various jobs as a jazz sideman to a lengthy stint with the rock satirist Frank Zappa, manipulates an arsenal of electronic keyboards and sings.

title: Patricia Ellen Ginger Wed to Adam Snyder
description: Patricia Ellen Giniger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Morton S. Giniger of Atlanta, was married yesterday afternoon to Adam Charles Snyder, son of Mr. and Mrs. William L. Snyder of Larchmont, N.Y.

title: G.D.P. MAYORS BID FORD ACT ON JOBS
description: MILWAUKEE, June 27Republican mayors sent word to President Ford today that it would be to his political advantage not to veto the $4 billion public works act sent to him by Congress earlier last week.

title: Belmont Charts
description: 1976, by Trla Publication Inc. The Daily Racing Form Sunday. June 27. 49th day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: Airliner With 257 Is Hijacked to Uganda
description: Hijackers seized an Air France jetliner yesterday with 257 persons aboard, forced it to refuel at Benghazi in Libya and then flew it to Entebbe Airport in Uganda, airline officials said early today.

title: Pentagon Denies It Tried To Change Cuba's Weather
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) The Defense Department today denied a charge that the United States tried to change the weather in 1969 and 1970 in order to damage Cuba's sugar crop.

title: Westbury Polo Victor
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., June 27  Jeff Broderick and Alan Corey 3d scored three goals each and led Westbury to a 73 victory over Bethpage today in a Long Island Polo League match at Bethpage State Park.

title: ASSEMBLY BACKS A CUT IN PENSIONS FOR NEWLY HIRED
description: ALBANY, Monday, June 28 Weary legislators left the Capitol for a few hours sleep this morning after a marathon weekend session that failed to resolve a partisan dispute over a bill sharply reducing pension benefits for public employees.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: Israeli Officials Honor Longtime Zionist Leader
description: TEL AVIV, June 27  Dr. Israel Goldstein, who settled in Jerusalem in ]960 after serving for 42 years as rabbi of Congregation Bnai Jeshurun, a New York synagogue, was honored by President Ephraim Katzir today on the occasion of his 80th birthday.

title: Forest Fire Razes on Coast
description: RED BLUFF, Calif. June 27 (AP)A wildfire spread across 5.6 square miles of tinderdry brush and timber today, threatening two national forests and a wilderness area 27 miles west of this northern California town. About 300 firefighters fought to contain the blaze in 105degree heat.

title: Inner City Houses In Demand as Costs Soar in the Suburbs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 25The soaring cost of new homes around the country is stirring new interest in the neglected older homes in the hearts of many American cities.

title: C. A. Dubout Dies in France; Was Cartoonist, Illustrator
description: MONTPELLIER, France, June 27 (AP)Charles Albert Dubout, an internationally known cartoonist and illustrator, died today, his family announced. He was 71 years old.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an error in editing a dispatch from Santiago, Chile, in The Times last Tuesday, the meaning of a statement by Alejandro Orfila, the secretary general of the Organization of American States, was altered. A corrective article appears on Page 9.

title: Polish Aide, Speaking at Rally, Indicates Protests Hit a 3d City
description: WARSAW, June 28, (Reuters) The Communist Party today staged mass rallies to support national policy following disturbances last week that, it is now clear, were more widespread than officials originally disclosed.

title: Women Enter Coast Guard Academy
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., June 28Thirtyeight young womenswept along in a tide of parents, friends and baggage and looking for all the world like a gaggle of college freshmen  began arriving at the United States Coast Guard Academy here at o&clock this morning to become the first female cadets since the Academy was founded in 1876.

title: Mideast Mediation
description: Diplomacy of another sort was starting to bear fruit virtually on the eve of the Air France hijacking. After months of bitter exchanges, the Prime Ministers of Syria and Egypt have managed a tentative beginning to the long process of reconciliation. Whatever other tensions may grip the Middle East, this relationship holds the key to the future politicaland militaryevolution of the region.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The press has ably documented the immediate crisis that besets the body politic of Italy. Equally clear are the analyses of the shortterm causes of a malaise which, having fed popular unrest, had led to the challenge of the Communist Party through its drive to gain a voice in the national government.

title: Sharon Lipschitz Wed To Marc S. Sageman
description: Sharon Lipschitz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Lipschitz of Forest Hills, Queens, was married yesterday evening to Marc S. Sageman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Abram Sageman of Brooklyn. Rabbi Theodore Jungreis performed the ceremony at Temple Ohr Torah of North Woodmere, L.I. Rabbi Chaim Feierstein assisted.

title: Sir Stanley Baker, 49, Actor Known for Tough Guy Roles
description: MALAGA. Spain, June 23 (Reuters)Sir Stanley Baker, a British actor known for his portrayal of tough guys, died in a hospital here today of complications following an operation for lung cancer three months ago. He was 49 years old.

title: 20 Injured in Bus Crash
description: CHAMBERSBURG, Pa., June 2S (AP) Eight persons were hospitalized and 12 others injured early today when a chartered bus carrying 45 members of a Detroit gospel singing group had a tire blowout and crashed on the Pennsylvania Turnpike the state police sail. They said that the bus veered from the turnpike about 30 miles northeast of here, went over an embankment and landed upright in a wooded area.

title: Democrats Face Few Disputes Over Seating at the Convention
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The Democrats find themselves in the unfamiliar position of preparing for a national convention without having to resolve a long list of fierce political disputes over which delegates are entitled to seats.

title: Sex Barrier Falls as Women Enter Air Force Academy
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, June 25Looking no more nervous than any other freshmen starting college. Bonnie Schaefer, Jacqueline Ware. Mary Ann Oblak and 152 other women broke the sex barrier today at the nation's military service academies by enrolling at the Air Force Academy.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL. ASSEMBLY Committee on Peaceful Uses of Outer Space10:30 A.M.

title: Businesses in New York Over 200 Years Honored
description: A number of New York businesses and organizations were honored last night for having been in the city for more than 200 years. Some of them warned that they would have to leave soon, others said that they would never leave the city and a few have already, fled New York for less costly I domains.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAGAFJORD (Nor.Amer.). Left Aandalsnes June 21; dust 9 A.M. at W. 55th St.

title: Television
description: Morning 6:10 (2)News

title: Toll Takers Strike At Triborough Units Over Issue of Guns
description: The peace officers of the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority's seven bridges and two tunnels in New York City walked off their jobs during the homebound rush period last night after some the men were served with disciplinary charges for carrying guns to work in defiance of an authority ban.

title: Con Edison Seeks Right to Lend Funds To Insulate Homes
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York, whose main business is selling gas and electricity, asked the state's Public Service Commission yesterday for permission to make loans.

title: Pertamina to Renegotiate $10 Billion Debt
description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaIndonesia and its state oil company, Pertamina, have embarked on one of the most extensive series of debt negotiations in the history of the world petroleum industry in attempting to renegotiate $10 billion in debt that threatens the nation's development plans for the rest of this century.

title: It Plans to Reconvene TomorrowAccord to Be Sought on 2% Levy
description: TRENTON. June 28Amid confusion over whether an agreement had been reached on an income tax to head off an impending court order closing the schools, the Legislature put off a vote today and planned to reconvene Wednesday to dehate the issue.

title: Trenton Approves Atlantic City Casinos
description: TRENTON, June 28  The State Senate approved tonight a resolution to allow casino gambling in Atlantic City, the first on the nation's East Coast.

title: Books of The Times
description: Julia's Story is not the kind of book you would want to read before being admitted to a hospitalbut it should be. In a sense, it is a story that can be told by many patients, or patients families, after a serious encounter with modern medical are. Fortunately, unlike Julia's, relatively few such encounters have fatal consequences (although avoidable deaths among patients have been estimated to reach five figures each year). Many more come frighteningly close to tragedy and leave their victims scarred, if not physically, then emotionally.

title: Production of Steel Rebounds in Week With Gain of 1.9%
description: Steel production for the week ended June 26 rebounded from the preceding week's decline with a gain of 1.9 percent, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Curson and Braxton Add Up to Some Diverse Jazz
description: Three diverse groups performed at Carnegie Hall in the third day of the Newport Jazz Festival. The first, George Coleman's Septet, played arrangements of three standards and featured rounds of relaxed olos. The second, Ted Curson's xtet, brought the crowd to feet with a bright, brassy bund and arrangements that were considerably more enerzing, although the only exceptional solos were two gems by the group's alto saxophon??? Chris Woods.

title: FLORENCE KIPER FRANK
description: Florence Kiper Frank, a poet and author, died Sunday at her New Haven home. She was 90 years old.

title: New Message From Balloonist Raises Hopes of His Associates
description: Two factors  one positive one negativekept associates of a 27yearold balloonist from Troy, Mich., hopeful yesterday that he was successfully continuing his solo flight to Europe.

title: 2 Bald Eagles Begin DDT Test
description: ALBANY, June 28Two baby bald eagles flew into New York State yesterday  aboard a commercial airlinerto take part in an experiment to see if they can survive and propagate in what has recently been a hostile environment because of DDT contamination.

title: Prince Radziwill Dead at 62; ExHusband of Lee Bouvier
description: LONDON, June 28 (AP)Prince Stanislas Radziwill, forimer husband of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis younger sister. Lee Bouvier, died yesterday at the home of a friend, sources close to the family reported today. He was 62 years old.

title: Boston Professor Elected Presbyterian Synod Head
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J., June 23 (UPI)  Dr. Frances J. Johnston of Boston has been elected moderator of the Synod of the Northeast of the United Presbyterian Church.

title: Man Dies in Clipping Hedge
description: BROOKFIELD, Conn., June 28 (AP)  Joseph Koch, 49 years old, of Brookfield was electrocuted while trimming his hedge with electric clippers, the police said today. A Brookfield police spokesman said Mr. Koch was using electric shears at his home Saturday when he cut the wire and it apparently rubbed against his arm. He was pronounced dead at the scene by medical examiner.

title: Dance: Russian Festival
description: The diversity of Russian danceof its simple, and sometimes not so simple folkstepsis, of course its glory. Russians dance like Italians singbel canto becomes belle danza, or whatever would be its Russian equivalent. The Hurok presentation of the Russian Festival of Music and Dance, which opened its threeweek season at the Metropolitan Opera House last night, offers this diversity in abundance.

title: U.S. IS APPROVING MIDEAST JET SALE
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The State Department has given tentative approval to the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation for the sale to Syria and Iraq of civilian versions of the C130 military transports already approved for sale to Egypt, officials said today.

title: PAUL PIMSLEUR, 48, DIES IN FRANCE
description: Dr. Paul Pimsleur, a professor of education and romance languages at the State University of New York in Albany and an author, died last Tuesday of a heart attack in Paris where he was a visiting professor at the Sorbonne. He was 48 years old.

title: High Court Backs Nonlawyer Judges When Defendant Has Chance to Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, June 28By a vote of 6 to 2, the Supreme Court ruled today that it was constitutional for states to allow judges who are nut lawyers to preside over criminal trials, at least where the defendant has an opportunity through an appeal to get a second trial before a judge who is a lawyer.

title: G.A.O. Calls for Revision Of Beame's Fiscal Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The investigative arm of Congress, going beyond recent criticism of New York City's plans for financial recovery, today called on the city to refine its threeyear plan if it expected to regain investor confidence in 1978.

title: Polish Price Crisis Reflects Inflation Ills
description: PARIS, June 28The protests by workers against price increases in Poland have underscored the economic troubles in Eastern Europe.

title: YONKERS POWERS REDUCED BY STATE
description: ALBANY, June 28The Assembly reluctantly gave final legislative approval today to a bill sharply reducing the homerule fiscal powers of Yonkers in what its sponsors acknowledged was a distasteful lastditch attempt to rescue the troubled city from default and bankruptcy.

title: Oil Spill Cleanup Near
description: ALEXANDRIA BAY, N.Y., June 28 (AP)A oil spin that has plagued this Thousand lands resort village for five days should be cleaned up in time for the July 4 weekend, Coast Guard officials reported today.

title: Justices Restrict Courts On School Zoning Shifts
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 The Supreme Court ruled 6 to 2 today that courts cannot require school authorities to readjust attendance zones each year to keep up with population shifts even if the authorities have not fully complied with desegration plans.

title: Clayton F. Loosli, ExDean Of Medicine at U.S.C., 71
description: Dr. Clayton G. Loosli, dean of the University of Southern California School of Medicine from 1958 to 1964, died Sunday in Pasadena of a heart attck. He was 71.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Plans to Press Legal Action on Job Bias
description: MEMPHIS, June 28The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People says it will go to court in several states this summer in an attempt to force the Federal Government and private companies to abide by an executive order that forbids racial diseximination by companies supplying goods and services to the Government.

title: Pension Accord Spurring Albany Move to Adjourn
description: ALBANY, Tuesday, June 29 The Senate and Assembly leadership reached a compromise late last night on the disputed public employee pension bill, eliminating the final roadblock to adjournment. The houses recessed early this morning and will reconvene later today for what the members hope is the last time this year.

title: Tribute to Coltrane is a Mixed Blessing
description: The Newport Jazz Festival's ??? to the late John Coltrane, which was presented at Carnegie Hall on Sunday, was curious rite. It began believbly enough with an energetic nterpretation of Mr. Coltrane's A Love Supreme by the Elvin Jones quartet and a highflyingce by the new sextet of McCoy Tyner. Mr. Jones and Mr.

title: People and Business
description: The chief economist of the United States Chamber of Commerce, Dr. Carl H. Madden, is resigning to resume an academic career. Dr. Madden, who is 56 years old and who has been with the chamber for 13 years, will become a professor at the American University's School of Business Administration in September.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: Ruling unanimously in a Connecticut case, the Court held that if a state has been found to have violated the civil rights act's ban on discrimination in employment, the state can be required to pay both back pay awards and attorney's fees to the winning side. In 1972, Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 was amended to bring state government within the group of employers who are forbidden to discriminate on racial, sexual or other grounds. In this case, however, Connecticut contended that Federal court orders requiring states to make back pay awards as part of the remedy for illegal discrimination violated the 11th Amendment's limits on suits brought in Federal court against a state.

title: 5 Reach Olympics In Saber
description: Five fencers from New York qualified for the United States Olympic team late Sunday. night in the saber division of national championship competition at Cherry Hill, N.J.

title: Measure to Let Museum Build Apartments Loses
description: ALBANY, June 28A bill that would allow the Museum of Modem Art to build a combined luxury condominium and an $18 million museum expansion was voted down in the Assembly today.

title: Shipping / Mails
description: TODAY, JUNE 29 TransAtlantic

title: Corruption Again Election Issue in Mexico;
description: MEXICO CITY, June 28Over the last six years, President Luis Echeverria Alvarez has frequently attacked the traditional corruption of Mexican public life and has called for a thorough moralizing of society.

title: FundShort Clinics May Ask a Donation For Swine Flu Shot
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 28 (AP)  Public health officials who will administer the swine flu vaccine say they need more Federal help and may ask for voluntary donations from the public to pay for the nationwide immunization program.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: TOOT & ROOT With free outdoor concerts already under way in Rockefeller Center, another music series begins today in midtown as a warmweather tonic for visitors and office workers.

title: Paris: Show Recalls Delaunay's Variety
description: PARISIs there such a thing, in art, as injustice? The question may well be asked about Robert Delaunay, a handsome retrospective of whose work will be on view until Aug. 30 at the Orangerie here. Apollinaire hailed him as the restorer of a conception of art lost since the great painters of the Renaissance. Paul Klee called him one of the most intelligent artists of this time. Kandinsky, Tristan Tzara and Blaise Cendrars, among others, held him in high esteem. And yet today he remains, at best, a demigod among the gods of 20thcentury art.

title: That's the News. And Now for San Juan's Weather
description: MADISON, Wis.  Perhaps 1,000 years ago, a people settled into a valley between the tallgrass prairies and the shortgrass prairies of North America and established a culture known to archeologists as Mill Creek. The people were among corn farmers who spread across the plains to the base of the Rockies. The Mill Creek corn farmers are of more than archeological interest. Their history could tell us of our own future.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SLIGHTLY LOWER
description: Slightly lower prices prevailed on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday. The Amex market value index closed at 104.92, down 0.14, and the NASDAQ industrial index ended at 95.55, down 0.29 for the session.

title: British Industry Sees Gain
description: LONDON, Tuesdy, (Reuters) June 29Net overseas earnings of the major British indutsries shoud grow 14 percent in 1976, ompared with 1975, the committee on invisible exports said. The forecast is based on a survey of industries that last year accounted for about half invisible earning of 3 million ($5.431 million.

title: NORMAN TARNOFF
description: Norman Tarnoff, a former vice president of Macy's, of Robbins Mills, of Sidney Blumenthal & Company and of the Associated Merchandising Corporation, died on Saturday at Mt. Zion Hospital in San Francisco, near his home.

title: Breedlove: The Quest For Speed Burns Out
description: Four hundred  500  600 miles per hour. Only one harrier remained unchallenged by Craig Breedlove, the world's fastest man on wheelsthe speed of sound.

title: Major Corporations Eager To Seek Korshak's Advice
description: In October 1973, three of the most prosperous businessmen in America, each the chief executive of a major public corporation concluded a complex real estate and filmleasing transaction.

title: JURORS QUERIED ON HEARST VIEWS
description: LOS ANGELES, June 28Patricia Hearst's experience with the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army became the focus of detailed questioning today as the defense interrogated prospective jurors to determine whether their knowledge of the famous case would impair their fairness in hearing the trial of William and Emily Harris.

title: The Portuguese Election
description: Gen. Antnio Ramalho Eanes won a convincing victory in Portugal's presidential election last weekend. Having gained more than 60 percent of the total vote, Portugal's army chief of staff can legitimately claim to enjoy the confidence of the majority of the people.

description: Pe Stk. of Payriod Rate. Record able

title: FEWER IN MARKET FOR JOBS IN CITY
description: The unemployment rate in New York City fell from 10.7 to 10.1 percent in May, but most of the drop was caused by discouraged workers leaving the labor force rather than by increases in jobholding, the State Labor Department reported yesterday.

title: Business Records
description: Chapter XI petition for an arrangement by: HICO CORPORATION OF AMERICA, 600 E. 132 St., Bronx, N.Y. Signed by toward W. Lamorle, President. Also maintains facilities at Forbes Industrial Park, Chelsea, Mass; Graham Street.
