title: TEAMSTERS LOSE TAX EXEMPTION FOR PENSION FUND
description: The Internal Revenue Service has revoked the taxexempt status of the teamster union's biggest pension fund, citing mismanagement and questionable loan practices, Government officials disclosed yesterday.

title: Box Scores of Major League Games and Standings
description: Tuesday, June 29, 1976

title: Prisons Bureau Eases Rules for Interviews
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (UPI)The Bureau of Prisons announced today that for a sixmonth trial period starting July 1 it will permit news reporters to interview inmates of their choice in maximum security prisons.

title: Notables Aid Convicted Deep Throat Star
description: Initially it was seen vs a joke, ha, ha, porno star gets busted, but now people are going around seeing it as a eery serious issue, Alan Dershowitz, a Harvard Law School professor, says, of the arrest and conviction of his client, Harry Reems, who appeared in the sex film Deep Throat.

title: Dave Anderson; O. Is for ? and Other Baseball Trivia
description: What does the O. in Charles O. Finley stand for? No, not Owner, as so many like to think. It stands for Oscar. In the years to come, that will be among the trivia questions inspired by the Oakland A's owner. At the mnment Charles 0. Finley is too controversial to be trivial. Also too stubborn. For once he had most people on his side when Commissioner Bowie Kuhn nullified the transfers of Vida Blue, Joe Rudi and Rollie Fingers for $3.5 million. But by refusing to use those players for more than a week.

title: High Court Ruling to Ease Strip Mining of U.S. Coal
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The Supreme Court reversed today an appellate court decision that could have delayed development of federally owned coal reserves in the Western plains states.

title: Forest Hills Out to Alter PublicBeDamned Label
description: While Wimbledon approaches its climax. Forest Hills is preparing changes to do a good job for the public when the United States Open begins Sept. 1.

title: General Mills Net Climbs As Pillsbury Profit Eases
description: General Mills yesterday reported an earnings increase of 30.1 percent in its first quarter on a sales increase of 15.4 percent.

title: PAUL HERSHAN
description: Paul Hershan, a textile industry consultant, died Sunday at his Haworth, N.J., home. He was 53 years old.

title: Usery Joins Rubber Talks
description: CLEVELAND. June 28 (AP)Secretary of Labor W. J. Usery Ind Peter Bommarito, United Rubber Workers international president, met here today in an attempt to unlock stalemated negotiations between striking union members and the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company.

title: Rockefeller Bars Favorite Son or Any Candidacy
description: Vice President Rockefeller disavowed yesterday a threat by a top New York Republican ally to start a Rockefeller favorite son candidacy to block growing national Republican sentiment for a FordReagan ticket.

title: A Bogus Courier Takes $3.5 Million in London
description: LONDON, June 28 (AP)A bogus courier collected 2 millionabout $3.5 millionin currency at London's Heathrow Airport and got away with it, British Airways said tonight.

title: Mets Triumph, 54, on a Wild Pitch; Tigers Fidrych Stops Yankees, 51
description: Mets Triumph, 54, on a Wild Pitch

title: The Next President of Portugal
description: LISBON, June 28Antonio Ramalho Eanes, the Presidentelect of Portugal, is a stonefaced, sober, aloof army general who represents what most Portuguese seem to want order, security and strong leadership.

title: A U.S. Mercenary And Three Britons Doomed by Angola
description: LUANDA, Angola, June 28 An American and three Britons Were sentenced today to die before a firing squad for their, part in the Angolan civil war. One of the Britons had admitted ordering the massacre of 14 other British mercenaries who had refused to fight.

title: HIJACKERS HOLD 256 NEAR PLANE
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, June 28  Palestinian extremists allowed 256 Air France passengers and crew members to leave a hijacked plane today but kept them in custody at the Entebbe airport. They threatened to blow up the jetliner unless their demands were met.

title: U.S.G.A. Won't Let Grass Grow Under Women's Feet for Open
description: The United States Golf Association hopes to have fairway grass cut to about onehalf inch when it conducts the women's Open championship at Rolling Green Golf Club News in Springfield, Pa., July 8 of through 11. BitGolf ter complaints followed the first round of the men's Open in Atlanta two weeks ago because the fairway grass was threequarters of an inch long instead of half an inch. The rough at Rolling Green, however, will not be as long as the rough at the Atlantic Athletic Club course.

title: HIJACKERS HOLD 256 NEAR PLANE
description: KAMPALA. Uganda, June 28  Palestinian extremists allowed 256 Air France passengers and crew members to leave a hijacked plane today but kept them in custody at the Entebbe airport. They threatened to blow up the jetliner unless their demands were met.

title: Hussein Ends Visit To Soviet,Without Word on Missiles
description: MOSCOW, June 28 (AP)The Soviet Union and Jordan reaffirmed their friendship in a joint communiqu today concluding an 11day visit by Hussein, but there was no indication that the King had obtained the antiaircraft missile system he wanted.

title: 300 Denounce Police in the Death of a Black Man in New Cassel
description: MINEOLA, Li.. June 28About 300 black residents from New Cassel and Westburyi marched to the County Executive Building today to protest what they said was toe killing of a black man by three white Nassau County police officers, on June 19.

title: Nadjari, Leaving Office, Is Critical of Lefkowitz
description: Maurice H. Nadjari accused Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday of being hypocritical when he dismissed Mr. Nadjari as special anticorruption prosecutor last Friday.

title: Hadassah Dedicates Jerusalem Institute On Cancer Research
description: JERUSALEM, June 28An institute devoted to the study and treatment of cancer and allied diseases, constructed at a cost of $15 million, was dedicated here last night by the 350,000member Hadassah, the largest Zionist organization in the world.

title: A Fireworks Shelling Of Harbor Due July
description: A choreographed, pushbutton and electronically controlled fireworks display will explode over New York Harbor for about half an hour the night of July 4 in celebration of the nation's Bicentennial and the Statue of Liberty's centennial.

title: Mrs. Rankin Golf Victor, Sets Mark for Earnings
description: CHAGRIN FALLS, Ohio, July 28 (AP)Judy Rankin calmly rolled in a threefoot putt for a par on the 18th green today and walked off with a onestroke victory in the $100,000 Babe Zaharias invitation tournament and a singleseason earnings record for the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour.

title: S.E.C. Reported Blocked By Foreign Bank Laws
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) Bank secrecy laws in foreign countries often frustrate the Securities and Exchange Commission's efforts to uncover bribery, illegal campaign contributions, stock manipulation and other abuses Roderick M. Hills. chairman said today.

title: Newport Jazz Festival
description: Duke Ellington inspired and influenced countless musicians and bands, but his work resisted that sincerest form of flattery, outright imitation. He was always changing his arrangements, and the changes that took place in the 1920's, when he built his band into a formidable organization and discovered most of the arranging concepts that he would later exploit so ingeniously, are particularly well documented. Pieces such as Black and Tan Fantasy and The Mooche were recorded as often as a dozen times, and on almost every recording Mr. Ellington tried a little something new.

title: Mr. Keenan's Turn
description: With the dismissal of Maurice Nadjari as special prosecutor and his replacement by John F. Keenan, Governor Carey and Attorney General Lefkowitz have taken the step necessary to put the quest for a corruptionfree criminal justice system back on an even keel. Mr. Nadjari departed characteristically, with twin blasts at the Governor and the Attorney General. Mr. Keenan now undertakes the unenviable task of picking up the mission and the staff at a time of great turbulence and a high level of public skepticism.

title: Marine Is Acquitted
description: Marine Staff Sgt. Harold L. Bronson was acquitted yesterday on all charges in the fatal beating of Lynn McClure, a Marine recruit. Page 28.

title: Rooster Wins Event, Escapes the Stew Pot
description: ROGUG RIVER. Ore., June 27Hamlet, a scrawny mongrel, :owed 57 times in 30 minutes to win.

title: WEST POINT ADDS 42 ARMY LAWYERS
description: WEST POINT. June 28 (UPI) Faced with the possibility of litigation stretching into the winter, the Army has assigned 42 lawyers from other posts to handle the cheating scandal at the United States Military Academy, it was announced today.

title: Helping New York
description: Sonic teenagers in the West and East Village spend their free time hanging out together in local parks and playgrounds. They have very little structured activity and little guidance, according to a West Village artist, William Leicht.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: U.S. Coach: Track Team Very Strong
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 28Let's say you are the coach of the United States men's Olympic track team. How would you like to go to the Montreal Olympics next month with a team that includes such world recordholders as Steve Williams, Dan Ripley, Terry Albritton and Jim Bolding such 1972 Olympic medalists as Tom Hill and Ralph Mann such present and past national champions as Marty Liguori. Reggie Jones. Maurice Peoples, Tom McLean, Randy Smith and Tom Woods, and a Pan American Games champion and Ronnie Ray?

title: A Stubborn Buoyancy Marks Life in Border Area of Rhodesia
description: UMTALI, Rhodesia, June 28By midafternoon, dark shadows cling to the granite mountains around Umtali. The shops on Main Street close at 5 P.M. and within an hour the city is silent except for the rumbling of armored personnel carriers and the distant laughter of soldiers in their barracks.

title: William Walsh, 79, Retired As an Insurance Executive
description: William E. Walsh, a former vie president of the Equitable Life Assurance Society and former president of the New York Rotary Club, died on Sunday in Sarasota, Fla., where he lived in retirement. He was 79 years old.

title: Sex Barrier Falls as Women Enter Air Force Academy
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, June 28 Looking no more nervous than any other freshmen starting college, Bonnie Schaefer, Jacqueline Ware, Mary Ann Oblak and 152 other women broke the sex barrier today at the nation's military academies by enrolling at the Air Force Academy.

title: Morris's 69 Leads by Shot In 54th Westchester Open
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 28  Kevin Morris. an assistant pro at Mt. Kisco Country Club. shot a twounderpar 69 at Tamarack Country Club today for a onestroke lead after the first round of the 54th Westchester open golf tournament.

title: EVERETT L. WAID, 76, ART LEAGUE HEAD
description: Everett Leslie Waid, president of the Art Students League, 215 West 57th Street, from 1946 until his retirement in 1953, died last Tuesday in his home in Fort Myers Beach, Fla. His age was 76.

title: A U.S. Mercenary And Three Britons Doomed by Angola
description: LUANDA, Angola, June 28An American and three Britons were sentenced today to die be fore a firing squad for their part in the Angolan civil war. One of the Britons had admitted ordering the massacre of 14 other British mercenaries who had refused to fight.

title: Soviet Woman Sets 1,500 Mark of 3:56
description: MOSCOW, June 28 (Reutern)Tatyana Kazankina of the Soviet Union became the first woman to break the fourminute barrier for the 1.500meter run today. She ran the metric mile in 3 minutes 56 seconds in a preOlympic competition.

title: Viking Aides Study Three Landing Plans
description: PASADENA, Calif., June 28Viking I continued its photo graphic search today for a reasonably safe landing site on. Mars, while project officials and scientists, surprised and little dismayed by the rugged Martian terrain they were seeing, studied three alternative landing plans.

title: Big Red Sox Shuffle Pays Off
description: In an attempt to snap his team's prolonged batting slump and stem its slide downward in the Eastern Division race, Manager Darrell Johnson made sweeping lineup changes for the Boston Red Sox's opener of a three  game home series against the Baltimore Orioles last night.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold orlces Monday.

title: In Memorium
description: LEVENTHALJack. So sadly missed and lovingly remembered.

title: Byrne Appoints a Judge To Serve as His Counsel
description: TRENTON, June 28Governor Byrne today named a Superior Court judge, Alan B. Handler of Delaware Township, as his chief legal counsel to replace Lewis B. Kaden.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON. June 28Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Bridge Flag Falls Victim To the Wind
description: What was billed as the world's largest flag, a red white and blue expanse of nylon tafI feta sailcloth the size of a football field and a half, ripped apart yesterday in a trial test.

title: Rookie Hurls 7Hitter for 81 Record
description: DETROIT, June 28The Yankees got their first look at Mark Steven Fidrych the 21yearold righthanded rookie sensation tonight. And the hardhitting Yankees had to be impressed.

title: One of Our Republicans Is Missing
description: I got to the office at noon, downed a slug of bourbon, gave my secretary a kiss and a sock in the jaw and said, All right, sweetheart, who's the Republican waiting to see me?

title: Heads of 7 Nations at Parley Isolated in Tropical Splendor
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., June 28The seven heads of state and government and their ministers at the weekend economic conference were isolated in tropical splendor at the Dorado Beach Hotel, unreachable even by telephone, while 500 members of the internaational press swarmed like an anxious ant heap at offices 20 miles away in San Juan.

title: 2 PUBLISHING UNITS SETTLE LIBEL SUIT
description: Dow Jones & Company and McGrawHill Inc. have settled a libel suit that arose from an article in Business Week magazine in April 1975, the two companies announced yesterday.

title: CUNY's Future
description: Now that the imminent threat to the City University's existence has receded, the new danger is in a lost sense of urgency about the institution's longterm future. The emergency legislation that reopened CUNY's doors provides austerity support for the 197677 academic yearbut no more. Two issues must be faced: CUNY's governance and the even more crucial question of how the university is to be financed.

title: Card of Thanks
description: BROADMANEva wishes to thank those attentive friends and Cams Neda Service Gross who sent their condnlences on the passing of her son, Dr. Sylvan A. Broadman.

title: New Message From Balloonist Raises Hones of His Associates
description: Two factors  one positive, one negativekept associates of a 27yearold balloonist from Troy, Mich.. hopeful yesterday that he was successfully continuing his solo flight to Europe.

title: Extra Israeli Funds In $5 Billion Aid Bill Approved in House.
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The House approved a $5.6 billion foreign assistance appropriation by voice vote this evening, including a controversial supplement of $275 million for Israel.

title: Congressman Seeks Repeal Of Law in False Claims Suit
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) Representative William L. Clay, Democrat of Missouri, has introduced legislation that would repeal the 1863 statute under which he is being sued for allegedly making false claims for official travel.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Ford and six other leaders of industrial democracies announced yesterday that they had agreed to pursue the objective of sustained economic growth with policies that seek to avoid reigniting worldwide inflation. They pledged this in a joint statement at the end of their economic summit meeting in Puerto Rico. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: SENATORS HOLD UP F. E A. EXTENSION
description: WASHINGTON, June 28In an attempt to make the House and the Administration accept a multibilliondollar package of financial help for energy conservation, Senate Democrats are holding hostage legislation to extend the life of the Federal Energy Administration beyond midnight Wednesday.

title: Medicare/Medicaid: Tenth Birthday
description: Medicare and Medicaid are ten years old this week, but the politicians are strangely bashful about pointing with pride or otherwise claiming credit. When President Lyndon Johnson proclaimed his hopes for these programs back in 1965 and 1966, he obviously had no inkling of the very mixed emotions his crowning domestic achievement would generate a decade later. Certainly any belief that these programs to finance medical care for the elderly and the poor would usher in a new health Utopia vanished even before the 1960's had ended.

title: Radio
description: 7:308:55 A.M., WNYCFM. Symphony No 15, Haydn; Quintet in D, J. C. Bach; Petite Suite, Debussy; String Quartet No. 2 Mozart; Weiner Blut Waltz, Strauss.

title: $5.3 Billion Transport Bill Passed by House. 376 to 21
description: WASHINGTON. June 23 (AP) The House passed a S3.3 billion transportation appropriations bill today in a form that brought the threat of a veto by President Ford. The vote was 376 to 21.

title: INDUSTRIAL INDEX IS REVISED BY FED
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The 197475 recession was deeperand the subsequent recovery fasterthan earlier statistics, had indicated, revised figures for the Federal Reserve Board's industrial production index showed today.

title: Toll Takers Strike Over Issue of Guns
description: The peace officers of the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority's seven bridges and two tunnels in New York City walked off their jobs during the homebound rush period last night after some of the men were served with disciplinary charges for carrying guns to work in defiance of art authority ban.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Entertainment Events Today

title: Adolfo for the Fall: A Note of Fantasy
description: Women are used to following where Adolfo leads. A few years back, he beckoned with latterday Chanel designs, and 10, the Chanel suit, knitted and lighter than the original became the uniform of women who lunch.

title: RATES ON SAVINGS REDUCED QUIETLY
description: Savings institutions, faced with heavy cash inflows and falling yields on their investments, have quietly been reducing the rates they are willing to pay on time deposits.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A jury in Federal court in Brooklyn found a Brooklyn couple guilty of illegally transporting rifles from California to New York. The couple, Kenneth R. Chin, 29 years Qld, and his wife, Elizabeth. 33, of 925 Union Street, were arrested last October after a raid on their apartment by Federal agents who suspected a plot to assassinate Emperor Hirohito, who was visiting the United States.

title: Carter Stirring Democratic Mayors
description: MILWAUKEE, Tune 28Jimmy Carter is coming to MECCA, not to pay homage but to receive it.

title: New Appropriations For Utilities Fell By 67% in Quarter
description: By REGINALD STUARTNew appropriations announced by the nation's investorowned electric and natural gas utilities in 1976's first quarter dropped 67 percent from the yearearlier level, according to a report released yesterday by the Conference Board, a businessresearch organization.

title: An Island of Joy Starts Its Bicentennial Week
description: It was an island of joy yesterday. Manhattan began with music and danceand the clatter of constructiona Bicentennial week that will culminate when the big sailboats glide into the harbor.

title: Suits Seek to Halt Shutdown of Public Schools Thursday
description: NEWARK, June 28  The United States Attorney's Office and the 31member Republican, minority in the State Assembly filed separate actions in Federal District Court today challenging the threatened shutdown of New Jersey's public schools beginning Thursday.

title: FEWER IN MARKET FOR JOBS IN CITY
description: The unemployment rate in New York City fell from 10.7 to 10.1 percent in May, but most of the drop was caused by discouraged workers leaving the labor force rather than by increases in jobholding, the State Labor Department reported yesterday.

title: Leader Is Named For School District As 300 Back Him
description: Clinton Howze Jr. was approved as superintendent of District 3 on Manhattan's West Side last night after 300 parents demonstrated in his behalf at a public meeting in Public School 163 on West 97th Street.

title: BREDINEV MEETS TITO AT RED TALKS
description: EAST BERLIN. June 28 (AP)  European Communist leaders gathered in East Berlin today for a congress regarded as a victory for a stand of national party independence from the Soviet Union.

title: Concert: Mostly Mozart at Its Most
description: A riddle. What is it that gains stature by growing smaller? A Mostly Mozart festival, of course. Lincoln Center's admirable summer series, which began its 10th season last night, is housed in Alice Tully Hall because its once and future home. Avery Fisher Hall. has closed down for remodeling. No complaints will be heard from this corner on that account, or for that matter on any other. There may never have been a more thoroughly satisfying Mostly Mozart concert than the one led in Alice Tully Hall's soundflattering surroundings by Alexander Schneider on this occasion.

title: CORRECTION
description: A chart in The Times last Friday, based on a Times CBS News poll, gave an incorrect figure for Jimmy Carter in a hypothetical race against President Ford in the. Western slates. Mr. Carter's support was 44 percent, no 40, to 36 percent for Mr. Ford.

title: GOSLOW POLICIES URGED BY LEADERS IN ECONOMIC TALKS
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., June 28President Ford and six other leaders of industrial democracies announced here today that they had agreed to pursue the objective of sustained economic growth with policies that seek to avoid reviving worldwide inflation.

title: Lisbon Victor Vows to Bring Stability
description: LISBON, June 28Portugal's Presidentelect, Gen. Antonio Ramalho Panes, declared today that his immediate priority was the restoration of political stability.

title: Drill Instructor Acquitted In Young Marine's Death
description: SAN DIEGO, June 28  A Marine Corps drill instructor: was found not guilty tonight of involuntary manslaughter and all six other charges against him in the first of a series of courtmartial trials, stemming from the fatal clubbing of a mentally retarded problem recruit who was undergoing disciplinary training.

title: NEW STORES TO OPEN BY LORD & TAYLOR
description: Lord & Taylor, the 22store retail chain operated by the Associated Dy Goods Corporation, announced yesterday its entry into the Detroit area, whith three stores to be opened simultaneously in shopping centers located in greater Detroit on March 1, 1978.

title: Business Briefs
description: The net inflow of savings in federally insured savings and loan associations rose in May to $2.82 billion, up from an increase of $2.58 billion in April, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported. But the increase was smaller than the inflow of savings in the first three months of this year when monthly gains ranged from $3.7 billion to $5.1 billion.

title: Notes on People
description: George D. Aiken, a Republican Senator from Vermont for 34 years until his retirement in 1974, has published Aiken: Senate Diary, out today, and in it he has some things to say about his former colleagues and other notables.

title: 4 Who Were Condemned in Angola
description: A 34yearold United States Army veteran of the war in Indochina  Captured in Angola only four days after his arrival  A resident of Kensington. Md., he left behind four young children, a sickly wife and unpaid medical bills amounting to $30,000  Found guilty of having advertised himself as a mercenary in an American publication and of having made contact with the Wild Geese Club, a mercenary group in South Africa  Vowed during the trial that, if he ever returned home, he would bring criminal charges against the California recruiters.

title: Major Corporations Eager To Seek Korshak's Advice
description: In October 1973, three of the most prosperous businessmen in America, each the chief executive of a major public corporation, concluded a complex real estate and filmleasing transaction.

title: Bridge
description: The instinct of a declarer who sees an AQ or AQJ combination in the dummy is to avoid playing the suit until he can attack it from the closed hand. In a general way, this instinct is sound but it makes it harder to find the right play on hands such as the one shown in the diagram.

title: POLITICAL OUSTER FROM JOB BARRED
description: WASHINGTON, June 28Officials who win elections may not dismiss workers in the office merely because the workers belong to the opposite political party, the Supreme Court ruled 5 to 3 today.

title: Beer Truck Drivers Accept New Pact and End Walkout
description: ST. LOUIS, June 28 (UPI)Beer truck drivers on strike since early April voted today to accept a new threeyear contract and end their walkout, which has kept most major brands out of St. Louis stores and taverns.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rafts for Monday.

title: Class Action Filed on Drug By Mother and Daughter
description: JERSEY CITY, June 28  A mother and daughter have filed a class accident and damage suit in New Jersey Superior Court charging 14 major pharmaceutical manufacturing and distributing companies with responsibility for the younger woman's cancer that required It hysterectomy and made her incapable of bearing children.

title: Young Crops Are Reaped by Young Farmers
description: A harvest in June? Well, that's what the children were doing last Saturday morning at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden harvesting their crops.

title: 1970 Ruling Upheld For Desegregating Schools on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES. June 28 The California Supreme Court: ruled today that the Los Angeles School District must desegregate its schools, but it reversed an earlier ruling that said that each school must have substantially the same ethnic enrollment as the district at large.

title: Reagan Says Ford Is Playing With Fire With Tactics That Could Destroy G.O.P.
description: LOS ANGELES. June 28 (UPI) Ronald Reagan says President Ford's tough campaign tactics for the Republican Presidential nomination show he&d rather win a convention than an election and could destroy the party in doing so.

title: GOSLOW POLICIES URGED BY LEADERS IN ECONOMIC TALKS
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., June 28President Ford and six other leaders of industrial democracies announced here today that they had agreed to pursue the objective of sustained economic, growth with policies that seek to avoid reviving worldwide inflation.

title: Market Place
description: Shares of the Ampex Corporation, the oncetroubled producer of magnetic recording equipment, closed at 83/4 on Friday, a gain of 1.

title: May Trade Balance Is First 76 Surplus
description: WASHINGTON. June 28A temporary drop in the volume of oil imports and a pickup in exports pushed the nation's foreign trade balance in May into its first monthly surplus this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Second seeded Evonne Goolagong was pushed by the vastly improved serveandvolley game of Rosie Casais, but won, 7.5, 63.

title: Times Sq. Cleanup Sets Off Confusion Over Appointment
description: In an apparent case of the left hand's not knowing what the right hand was doing, the Mayor's office invited a landlord to join in the cleanup of Times Square and then followed the invitation with an indignant letter asking him to explain his alleged role as a major landlord of pornographic shops in the area.

title: Canadian Airline Pilots Strike Ended
description: OTTAWA. June 28 Airlines resumed flights in Canada today as Canadian pilots ended al nineday walkout following Government announcement that the question of extending the, use of the French language ati Quebec airports would be reexamined and ultimately submitted to Parliament

title: INQUIRIES SLATED OVER HOUSING BIAS
description: Two top state and city offi cials said yesterday they would investigate charges of widespread discrimination in the rental of apartments in Man hattan and take steps to elimnate the problem if the charges were substantiated.

title: House Bars Ban on SST AtKennedy and at Dulles
description: WASHINGTON, June 28By wide margins and amid some derisive remarks about New York City's sanitary and fiscal conditions, the House of Representatives defeated today efforts to bar the Concorde supersonic transport from landing at Kennedy and Dulles Airnorts.

title: Bicentennial Flag On the Verrazano Victim of the Wind
description: What was billed as the world's largest flag, a red, white and blue expanse of nylon taffeta sailcloth the size of a football field and a half, ripped apart yesterday in a trial test.

title: Court Reorganization Gets Pushed to Side in Albany
description: ALBANY, June 28Court reorganization, only a few weeks ago the darling of both parties in the State Legislature, has become a political orphan in the waning hours of the current session.

title: Household Finance Unit In Pact for Hamilton Life
description: The Hamilton International Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to sell the Hamilton Life Insurance Company of America, a wholly owned subsidiary, to an insurance subsidiary of the Merger Household Finance News Corporation for $26.75 million. Hamilton Life has life insurance in force exceeding $1.25 billion. The acquisition will be made by the Maryland Life Insurance Company, the Household Finance subsidiary.

title: Advertising
description: A recent night of watching the tube disclosed that while the programming may not have been provocative, some commercials raised a number of questions.

title: Lightning Storms Cause Bergen Power Failures
description: Lightening storms over northern New Jersey caused power failures in several thousand homes in Bergen County, the Public Service Electric and Gas Company reported last night.

title: Dow Off by 2.46 to 997.38; NuclearLinked Issues Up
description: Nuclearrelated issues moved higher yesterday while the stock market as a whole was divided about equally in its gainers and losers.

title: Marine Is Acquitted
description: Marine Staff Sgt. Harold L. Bronson has been acquitted on all charges in the fatal heating of Lynn McClure, Marine recruit. Page 28.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Tigers, at Detroit. (TelevisionChannel 11, P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 8 P.M.)

title: DEMOCRATS PUSH DISCLOSURE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, June 28Twenty  three Representatives today asked the House Democratic caucus to force the Judiciary Committee to report to the floor for action a Congressional financialdisclosure bill sponsored by 165 members.

title: TV: Nova Explores the Bermuda Triangle Case
description: Public television's Nova series offers an effective debunking demonstration tonight at 8 on Channel 13 with The Case of the Bermuda Triangle. Beginning more or less officially in 1945, the case has involved the mysterious disappearance of hundreds of ships and planes, carrying thousands of people. The 1945 incident featured the venture into oblivion off the Florida coast of five small Avenger planes and the large Mariner plane sent out on the search mission. By the mid1950's, the Bermuda triangle mysteries were becoming the surefire stuff of pulp magazines and sensational books.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Artificial Lures Defined
description: The incredible variety of baits that fresh water fisherman use is indicated in the recent order by New York State's Commissioner of Environmental Conservation, Peter A. Berle.

title: Volunteers Are Sought For Youth Programs
description: The Citizens Committee for New York City yesterday called for 1,000 volunteers to help staff small and large summer youth programs throughout the city, including sports, recreation, arts and crafts, music and dance programs.

title: Chess :
description: The outside passed pawn, situated on a wing and usually remote from the defending king and from the main body of pawns, is a fiercesome weapon. It not only ties down the opponent's pieces in a defensive blockade to prevent its promotion but it also converts each exchange of pieces into a threat to clear them all off, when it would romp in without anything to hinder it.

title: I'llmakeitup Wins Finale At Belmont
description: I'llmakeitup, a name that must be said in a hurry, was also the fastest horse in the closingday feature at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: A Warsaw Puzzle
description: WASHINGTON, June 28Poland's leaders apparently gambled and lost last week when they chose to solve a rapidly deteriorating economic situation in one dramatic move israther than by introducing modest reforms over a llonger period. The result, for the Communist Party's chief, Edward Gierek, is an even bigger problem  continuity economic strains compounded by a political crisis that will make the eventual solution if there is to be one  even more difficult.

title: ROBERT A. MacMURPHEY
description: Robert H. MacMurphey, a retired book publishing executive, died at his New Canaan, Conn., home yesterday. He was 81 Ivears old.

title: Miss Evert Easily in Semifinal
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 28If anything is predictable, it's women's tennis. In the AllEngland championships today, topseeded Chris Evert won from Olga Morozova, 63, 60, without strain. She has lost a mere 10 games in reaching the semifinals an uproar, blonde Sue Barker was serving for the match against fourthseeded Martina Navratilova when she suddenly tightened, legs going light and concentration waning. She was a victim of the English disease of being overwhelmed at doing well at Wimbledon, a malady associated with Miss Wade for 15 frustrating years.

title: Olympic Preview Reveals More Problems
description: MONTREAL, June 28 (UPI) Ready or not, organizers plunged ahead today toward the July 17 opening of the Summer Olympics following a confused weekend rehearsal at the main installations.

title: Cancer Study Backs PostSurgery Drugs
description: Injection of a drug after surgery for cancer of the colon or rectum has doubled the cure rate in patients who would, ordinarily face a threeinfour chance of dying of their disease, two Long Island physicians reported yesterday.

title: Garden Construction Delights Beame and Strauss
description: Mayor Beame and Robert S. Strauss. the Democratic national chairman, stepped cautiously through the sawdust and the construction clutter in Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: CORRECTION
description: A chart in The Times last Friday, based on a. Times/ CBS News poll, gave an incorrect figure for Jimmy Carter in a hypothetical race against President Ford in the Western states. Mr. Carter's support was 44 percent, not 40, to 36 percent for Mr. Ford.

title: Burlington Notifies S.E.C. Units Made Foreign Payments
description: Burlington Industries Inc., the nation's largest textile producer, disclosed yesterday that units operating in three foreign countries made questionable payments to foreign officials over the last five years.

title: Seychelles, Indian Ocean Isles, End 166 Years of British Rule
description: VICTORIA, the Seychelles, Tuesday, June 29 (Reuters) The Seychelles, a cluster of 92 islands in the Indian Ocean about 1,000 miles east of the African coast, became an independent republic early today.

title: Run in Eighth Tops Cards at Shea
description: Dave Kingman, who fell down once in right field and once rounding first base, finally stayed on his kingsized feet for 90 feet and scored the winning run as the Mets edged the St. Louis Cardinals, 54, last night at Shea Stadium.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Supreme Court of the Unite&States agreed to hear an appeal by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey bondholders attempting to stop the Port Authority from using bond money to finance rapid transit to Newark and Kennedy International Airports. The appeal by the United States Trust Company on behalf of the bondholders will be argued next term. New York and New Jersey authorized the Port Authority to issue, bonds in 1962 for the purchase of the HudsonManhattan Railroad (now PATH) and for the construction of the World Trade Center towers.

title: Pension Accord Spurring Albany Move to Adjourn,
description: ALBANY, June 28The Senate and Assembly leadership reached a tentative compromise late tonight on a publicemployee pension bill and prepared to try once again to bring the legislative session to an end.

title: Dance: U.S. Terpsichore, New Works
description: In addition to its resident choreographer, Daniel Levans, U. S. Terpischore has a puckish anonymous dance designer designated only as American Dancing School Traditional. Both presented new works over the weekend at the Theater of Riverside Church and both were mildly suggestive of other creative  voices.

title: SOYBEANS STEADY ON CHICAGO BOARD
description: Soybean futures showed little of last week's verve and closed virtually unchanged yesterday in most trading months on the Chicago Board of Trade. The July delivery, as an example, closed at $6.69 a bushel, the same as on Friday.

title: N.E.A., With Politics on Rise, Due to Back Carter
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 28i The National Education Association, a 18millionmember teachers organization that has gradually increased its political involvement, will take the final step into partisan politics this year with the almost certain endorsement of Jimmy Carter for President.

title: News summary and Index
description: President Ford and six other leaders of industrial democracies announced yesterday that they had agreed to pursue the objective of sustained economic growth with policies that seek to avoid reigniting worldwide inflation. They pledged this in a joint statement at the end of their economic summit meeting in Puerto Rico. l Page 1, Column 8.1

title: Millions in FoodShort Nations Held in Danger
description: AMES, Iowa, June 28 (UPI)The 1976 World Food Conference was told today that millions of people could die of starvation before a solution could be found to excessivei population.

title: Justices Restrict Courts On School Zoning Shifts
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 The Supreme Court ruled 6 to. 2 today that courts cannot require school authorities to readjust attendance zones each year to keep up with population shifts even if the authorities have not fully complied with desegration plans.

title: Cancer Study Backs PostSurgery Drugs
description: Injection of a drug after surgery for cancer of the colon or rectum has doubled the cure rate in patients who would ordinarily face a threeinfour chance of dying of their disease, two Long Island physicians reported yesterday.

title: Juvenile Crime Bill Voted By New York Legislature
description: ALBANY, June 28  Both houses of the Legislature early today gave final passage to a hill mandating a minimum of two years of confinement for juveniles who commit serious crimes of violence. They later passed bills requiring separate confinement of juvenile delinquents and youths who were vards of the state or court and stablishing separate Family Court parts to handle violent crimes by youths.

title: States Held Liable for Damages To Employees Subjected to Bias
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) The Supreme Court ruled today that states must award money damages to employees who can prove this they suffered from illegal discrimination under state employment laws.

title: Albany Goes to Rescue Of 4 Senate Candidates
description: ALBANY, June 28The Legislature last night passed a special bill to rescue three Democratic Senate candidates and one United States Senator, James L. Buckley, from the carelessness of their own state committees, which missed a deadline to validate the candidacies with the state's Board of Elections.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The B. F. Goodrich Company yesterday said that it was discussing with the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs the possible takeover of its wholly owned Dutch subsidiary by the Dutch Government. The subsidiary, IBFGEurope, B.V., employs 4,800 persons.

title: Miss Holtzman Assails End Of Free Tuition in City
description: Addressing graduates of Queens College, Representative Elizabeth Holtzman yesterday assailed numerous elected officials for the imposition of tuition at the City University. The action, she said, was a cosmetic gesture made by the city's managers to appease a linsrile Federal Government.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: BREZHNEV MEETS TITO AT RED TALKS
description: EAST BERLIN, June 28 (AP) European Communist leaders gathered in East Berlin today for a congress regarded as a victory for a stand of national party independence from the Soviet Union.

title: Lepers and Children Count the Days
description: ANYANG, South KoreaIt has been three years now since Chin Wu Bum, a leper, first decided to allow her daughters to be adopted by an American family.

title: U.S.  INDICTS EIGHT IN SLUDGE KICKBACK
description: CHICAGO. June 28 (AP)An Illinois legislator, three Chicago Metropolitan Santary District officials and four other men, including executives of a New Orleansbased corporation, were named today in a Federal indicetnent charging $1.3 million in payoffs.

title: Fete for Chilean Navy Ship Faces Protest
description: KEYPORT, June 28  The Keyport Yacht Club has decided to hold a welcoming dinnerdance Saturday night for the Chilean naval training vessel Esmeralda as part of the weekend's Operation Sail cele bration despite opposition by the borough's council, a legislative resolution denouncing the plans and the threat of protest demonstrations.

title: An Island of Joy Starts Its Bicentennial Week
description: It was an island of joy yesterday. Manhattan began with music and danceand the clatter of constructiona Bicentennial week that will culminate when the big sailboats glide into the harbor.

title: U.S. 5YEAR NOTES CORD YIELD 7,60%
description: Interest rates moved higher yesterday in several key sectors of the credit markets as Treasury security dealers and investment bankers sought levels that would attract investors. In this atmosphere, dealers in Government bonds predicted that the Treasury's fiveyear notes to be sold today would yield 7.60 percent or little more, and underwriters tentatively priced longterm World Bank bonds to yield 8.85 percent.

title: Parent Out of Series
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 28 (AP)Bernie Parent, goalie for the Philadelphia Flyers, said today he would not compete in the Canada Clip hockey series this fall on the advice of his doctors. He missed most of last season with a neck injury.

title: Measure Allowing Vote on Gambling Passes in Trenton
description: TRENTON, June 28  The State Senate approved tonight a resolution to allow casino gambling in Atlantic City, the first on the nation's East Coast.

title: BEIRUT RIGHTISTS INTENSIFY ATTACK
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 28Rightwing Christian militiamen, reportedly bolstered by reinforcements, demanded today that the two Palestinian camps they had been attacking since last Tuesday surrender at once.

title: SENATE APPROVES SOME TAX REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, June 28Tax reform advocates won a lopsided victory today when the Senate voted, 66 to 17, to remove from the tax bill a provision that would have conferred new tax advantages on persons with large amounts of income from investments.

title: Banks Employees Striking in Ireland
description: DUBLIN, June 28, (Reuters) About 10,000 employees of Ireland's four main banking groups went on strike today demanding wage rises that would exceed a proposed Government nay ceiling.

title: Open Interest
description: (In busheis, 000 omitted)

title: TEAMSTERS LOSE TAX EXEMPTION FOR PENSION FUND
description: The Internal Revenue Service has revoked the taxexempt status of the teamster union's biggest pension fund, citing mismanagement and questionable loan practices, Government officials disclosed yesterday.

title: Smith Says Vorster Will Resist U.S. Pressure on Rhodesia Issue
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 28Prime Minister Ian Smith expressed blunt confidence today that South Africa would, resist pressures from the United States to force Rhodesia to work out a political settlement with its black majority.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The National Football Foundation announced yesterday it had accepted an offer from the Taft Broadcasting Company to locate a collegiate football hall of fame at Taft's 1.600acre Kings Island amusement complex, 25 miles north of Cincinnati. Vincent dePaul Draddy, chairman of the board of the foundation, said that the board felt it would be best to locate the hall of fame at a neutral site in midAmerica.

title: Women's Five Gains Final
description: HAMILTON, Ontario. June 28 (UPI)The United States women's basketball team advanced to the finals of the Olympic qualifying tournament today with the only undefeated record by crushing previously unbeaten Poland, 8466.

title: Deaths
description: ADLERLeon. The Brotherhood of Temple Israel, Lawrence, Lt. extends its condolences to Dr. Melton Adler, Secretory, on the occasion of the passing of his beloved father.

title: Mercer Duo Wins
description: Toni Mercer and Dorothy Henry of the New York Lawn Bowling Club won the club's 50th anniversary doubles championship in Central Park yesterday. They defeated Mary McGowan of Scotland and Sylvia Radford of Australia, 133.

title: Strike or Default Possible Soon But Talks Lack Air of CrisisI
description: Negotiations are scheduled to resume this morning between New York City and unions representing most of its workers with little crisis atmosphere despite the possibility of a strike or default within 48 hours.

title: A Fireworks Shelling Of Harbor Due July
description: A choreographed, pushbutton and electronically controlled fireworks display will explode over New York Harbor for about half an hour the night of July 4 in celebration of the nation's Bicentennial and the Statue of Liberty's centennial.

title: Fanatics at Large
description: From Libya to Sudan, from Lebanon to Uganda, its onetime mentors seem to be cooling their enthusiasm for the fanaticism still stalking the Arab world. So far, at any rate, no Arab capital is heralding as heroes the Palestinian hijackers of an Air France airbus with some 250 persons aboard, originally bound for Paris from Tel Aviv.

title: BORGWARNER&S UNIT TO LIFT PRICES 4.5%
description: The New York division of the BorgWarner Corporation announced yesterday that it would raise prices on all unitary air conditioning products and furnaces about 4.5 percent, effective with shipments on July 15.

title: About Education
description: In 1968, when higher education in New York State was in a heady period of expansion, the State University forecast that its enrollment would swell from 100,000 students to 270,000 by 1980.

title: Reagan is Assured of at Least 25 Votes Out of 30 to Be Cast by Mississippi
description: GREENVILLE, Miss., June 29 Although Ronald Reagan will not get the solid block of 30 votes here that he once hoped for, Mississippi's unit  rule tradition remains viable enough to assure him of at least 25 of the state's votes at the Republican National Convention.

title: Connors is Upset by Tanner; Nastase, Borg, Ramirez Win
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 29Jimmy Connors has been beaten at Wimbledon.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The passage now of a substantial increase in real estate taxes in New York City is an act of suicide.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Bigar Wins Race in Title Yacht Series
description: HANKOE, Norway, June 29 (AP)Frank H. Tolhurst of Australia maintained his overall lead today in the 1976 world yachting championships for the 5.5meter class, but Claude Bigar of Switzerland skippered his Alphee VII to a clearcut victory in the third of seven races for the world title. Tolhurst, the helmsman of the Harunga, finished fourth today, but stayed at the top of the overall standing after having won twice in a row in the opening regattas Sunday and yesterday.

title: TAX LAW RETAINED FOR MULTINATIONALS
description: WASHINGTON June 29 (UPI)The Senate rejected today efforts to force United States multinational corporations to pay taxes on the profits of their foreign subsidiaries at the time for profits are made.

title: Europeans Linking Plans to Reduce Terrorist Attacks
description: LUXEMBOURG, June 29The nine countries of the European Common Market have agreed to increase cooperation among their security forces to combat international terrorism.

title: Carter's Speech Convinces Some Mayors
description: MILWAUKEE, June 29Jim my Carter managed today to convince some skeptics among Democratic mayors that he wa genuinely committed to correcting urban ills.

title: Casino Gambling Vote Odds Rated 5050
description: TRENTON, June 29In the early odds book, the chances that Atlantic City will be allowed by the voters to have gambling casinos after this fall's general election appeared to be at least even money.

title: HOSPITALS DEFEND INCREASING COSTS
description: The Federal Council on Wage and Price Stability yesterday heard hospital officials defend their sharply rising charges on the ground of humanitarian treatment and insurers who demand much tighter controls on how health money is spent.

title: HIJACKERS ORDERS CHALLENGE ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM. June 29The Government of Israel began urgent consultations tonight after receiving the demand of the hijackers of an Air France jetliner for the release of 40 Palestinians and proPalestinian prisoners from Israeli mils.

title: Dodge Site
description: The solution to the development of the Dodge site on Fifth Avenue at 61st Street is a far more complex and troubling matter. The second proposal for an apartment house and professional offices now before the City Planning Commission corrects some of the drawbacks of the first scheme and offers some distinctly better features.

title: Compromise Ends Coop City's Strike
description: Governor Carey and leaders of Coop City residents reached a compromise agreement yesterday to end the bitter 13month strike during which most residents in the mammoth development in the northeas Bronx had refused to pay a 25t percent increase in maintenance charges.

title: Cuba in Olympic Soccer
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, June 29 (AP)Cuba will replace Uruguay and play in the final round of the Olympic soccer tournament in Montreal, the International Football Federation (FIFA) announced today. Uruguay withdrew from the final round after a dispute between the federation and the National Olympic Committee over the selection of players.

title: Legislature Closing
description: The New York Legislature worked last night to bring its sixmonth session to a close. Page 48.

title: Food Funds Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (UPI)A $12.5billion agriculture appropriations measure won House approval today. More than half the money would be for food programs for the needy at home and abroad. The measure, passed 372 to 27, and sent to the Senate, would fund farm programs and spedal feeding programs for the 1977 fiscal year.

title: Report on Patents To Give Indications Of Developments
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 new report on the operation of the patent system, to be released this week, contain hints of trends expected in new patent development.

title: Premiere Film for Premier Actress
description: Jeanne Moreau runs fulltilt downhill for the sake of the wind and at the cost of having to struggle back uphill, puffing and in a temper. She has the air of someone spending, not saving, herself. Iii the summer she doesn't dress to look cool but to look hot.

title: Gimbels Head Expected To Resign Post Shortly
description: Robert R. Broadbent, who joined Gimbels New York as chairman and chief executive officer in October 1973, is expected to leave shortly and take a position as head of a (California retail chain.

title: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries
description: Horses listed in order of Post positions Letter designates OTB listing.

description: of requiring domestic refiners to make costsharing payments to heatingoil importers to keep the price of foreign oil from pulling up prices generally.

title: Hijackers Demand Israelis And Others Free Captives
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, June 29Hijackers holding 256 hostages and a French airliner they seized over Greece on Sunday demanded here today that Israel and four other countries release 53 imprisoned Palestinians and proPalestinians.

title: CARTER QUALIFIES PLEDGE TO CITIES
description: MILWAUKEE, June 29 Jimmy Carter warned the mayors of American cities today that, while he would try to be a sympathetic and responsive friend in the White House, he would also be a demanding partner who would expect them to endorse some of his own political enthusiasms such as reorganization of Federal and urban government.

title: AKOV ZAK IS DEAD; A MOSCOW PIANIST
description: Yakov Zak, a leading Soviet pianist and teacher, died in Moscow on Monday after a grave illness, according to a report by the Tass press agency. He was 62 years old.

title: HAWAII FOCUSING ON STATE RACES
description: HONOLULU  Presidential politics is far down the scale of political interest in Hawaii this year as an impending Senate vacancy is also creating vacancies in the state's two seats in the House.

title: In Airmoriant
description: HORROCKErwin Norbert. ??? for 20 years, but not forgotten by family or friends.

title: Kaufman Broad Profitable Again
description: Kaufman & Broad Inc., a major homebuilder and the operator of the Sun Life Insurance Company, reported yesteruay a return to profitability in the quarter and six months ended May 31, aided by reduced mortgage rates and imnroved consumer confidence.

title: Monday's Fights
description: NEW YORKEddie Gregory, 164 pounds. Brooklyn, N.Y., knocked out Otis Gordon, 172, Hartford, Conn., 4 rounds; Dave Huckahy, 155, Hartford, outpointed Tyron Phelps, 149, Brooklyn, 8.

title: Governor is Relatively Optimistic On Passage of Some Tax Plan Today
description: TRENTON, June 29Governor Byrne said today that he was relatively optimistic that the Legislature would act tomorrow to end the crisis facing the state's public schools, which will close at 12:01 A.M. Thursday if they are not fully financed.

title: Liu Wenhui, 82
description: HONG KONG. June 29 (Reuters)The Peking radio announced today that Liu Wenhui, a former Chinese Nationalist general who shifted allegiance to the Communist side in Szechwan Province in December 1949, died last Thursday at the age of 82.

title: Advertising
description: Quite a few comments were made yesterday in the WaldorfAstoria about the high cost of television commercial time. And why not? it was a radio industry party.

title: S.E.C. Charges Violations By the Chicago Milwaukee
description: WASHINGTON, June 29The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that the Chicago Milwaukee Corporation and four officials had violated numerous securities laws, including failure to disclose that the company's railroad subsidiary was being kept afloat through cash infusions generated by sales of timberland owned by still another subsidiary.

title: No. Amer. Soccer League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Washinglon 5 Pniladelohla 1. STANDING OF THE TEAMS ATLANTIC CONFERENCE Northern Division

title: CARTER QUALIFIES PLEDGE TO CITIES
description: MILWAUKEE, June 29Jimmy Carter warned the mayors of American cities today that, while he would try to be a sympathetic and responsive friend in the White House, he would also be a demanding partner who would expect them to endorse some of his own political enthusiasms such as reorganization of Federal and urban government.

title: France Will Send 47 to the Olympics
description: PARIS, June 29 (Reuters) France announced today it would send 47 athletes, 39 men and eight women to compete in track and field events at the Montreal Olympics. The best prospects for medals are Guy Drut, the world recordholder for the 110meter hurdles; Jacques Rousseau, a long jumper who has recorded the second best jump in the world this season at 27 feet 5 inches, and Chantal Rega, a sprinter, in the women's 200 meters.

title: The G. O. P. Nightmare
description: WASHINGTON, June 29The saddest characters in Washington these days are the Republican members of Congress. They are watching the FordReagan fight for the G.O.P. Ptesidential nomination with mounting alarm, fearing that whoever wins this battle will divide the party, lose the White House, and weaken their chances of recelection in November.

title: Officials in Washington Fear Wave of Killing if 2 Camps Are Taken
description: WASHINGTON, June 29Highranking United States, officials said today that the situation in Lebanon seemed to have deteriorated to the lowest point of the 14monthold civil conflict, with no solution of the crisis in sight.

title: Italian Cup to Napoli
description: ROME, June 29 (UPI) Napoli scored four goals in the last 14 minutes of play tonight to beat Verona, 40, and win the 197576 Italian Cup soccer title.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (AP)Prices farmers get for raw agricultural products rose 2 percent from May 15 to June 15. the third consecutive monthly increase, the Agriculture Department said today. The department's Crop Reporting Board said that higher prices for soybeans, corn and hogs contributed most to the increase. Lower prices for cattle, apples and hay partly offset the gain.

title: 7 Indicted by U.S. On Fraud Charges Involving $1 Million
description: The Federal Strike Force, Against Organized Crime obtwined an indictment yesterday against seven men on charges that they were involved in a $1.4 million stock swindle.

title: The Tasty Temptations Of a FancyFood Show
description: While the 22d annual national fancy food and confection show, which winds up today at the Coliseum, may not vie with Operation Sail or the Democratic Convention as one of this summer's main events, to food buffs, it may be far more significant. For it is to this show that buyers come from gourmet food shops and departments to replenish shelves for fall holidays and to introduce the newest and most lavish of comestibles.

title: Anthony Trentini, 46. Dies; Football Assistant at Tempt
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 29 (UPI)Anthony J. Trentini, assistant football coach at Temple University, died today while vacationing in North Carolina. He was 46 years old.

title: A WATERGATE BILL OPPOSED BY LEVI
description: WASHINGTON. June 29Attorney General Edward H. Levi has begun an 11thhour campaign to block Senate passage of a Watergate reform bill that has been under consideration more than 18 months.

title: Market Place
description: Shares of Dome Petroleum Ltd. reached 42 last week, marking up a gain of 30 percent in less than two months Four executives of the Canadian oil and gas developer who sold their stock in late April and in May received prices on their insider shares fairly close to current levels.

title: Mrs. Ford Helps Remember the Ladies of Revolutionary Era
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., June 29Three of Washington's most prominent political wivesBetty Ford, Nancy Kissinger and Joan Kennedy gathered on the steps of Pilgrim Hall here today for the opening of a major Bicentennial exhibition about Revolutionary War era women, called Remember the Ladies.

title: People in Sports
description: The money would be slipped under the door of Marlton Hilton's motel room while he visited the campus. Sometimes it was $100 and sometimes it was $150. I never knew who it came from, said the former Norfolk, Va. high school basketball star, who signed a letter of intent this spring to attend the University of South Carolina.

title: Arab Diplomats Skeptical
description: CAIRO, June 29Arab diplomats here conceded today that it was difficult to see what the Arab foreign ministers would be able to do tomorrow other than issue a twin appeal one to the Lebanese Christians to call off their attack on the Palestinian camp and another to reluctant Arab governments to join in the collective Arab peacemaking effort.

title: Arab Drive fo Arrange a CeaseFire Collapses Amid Rightist Attack
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 29Arab efforts to arrange a ceasefire and find a political solution that would end the civil war here have reached a deadlock.

title: MUNICIPAL UNIONS SEEN AS ACCEDING TO BUDGET TRIMS
description: New York City's labor unions were reported yesterday to have agreed in principle to comply with the city's budget for next year, which calls for a $24 million cut in fringe benefits.

title: C.A.B. Rebuffs 3 Airlines On Bid for Fare Increase
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (UPI)  The Civil Aeronautics Board rejected today requests by three airlines for fare increases ranging up to almost 5 percent on their heavily traveled North Atlantic routes between the United States and Europe.

title: Officials in Washington Fear Wave of Killing if 2 Camps Are Taken
description: WASHINGTON, June 29Highranking United States officials said today that the situation in Lebanon seemed to have deteriorated to the lowest point of the 14monthold civil conflict, with no solution of the crisis in sight.

title: U.S. College Nine Loses
description: SHIZUOKA, Japan, June 29 (AP)  The Japanese College AllStars gained their first victory in the United StatesJapan collegiate world series by beating the Americans, 21, today. The fifth annual fourofseven game series stands at 31 in favor of the United States squad. The game was called after 7 innings because of heavy rain.

title: Dow Up 3.27 to 1,000.65; Gold Stocks Are Down
description: A firmbut not flashytone to the stock market helped to push the Dow Jones industrial average above the psychological barrier of 1,000 yesterday fnr the ninth time since March.

title: Rhodesia Policies Criticized by ExLeader
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 29His onceburly physique is shrunken by illness. His gravely voice is softer now and he tires easily. But he clenches his fist when talking of Rhodesia, which he loves.

title: Is it Bigfoot, Or Can it Be Just a Hoax?
description: THE DALLES, Ore.Within the vast forest wilderness of the Pacific Northwest there may live a species of shy, furry manlike creatures, perhaps relict and declining survivors from a time before modern man evolved.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International Leaders of Communist parties from Eastern and Western Europe opened their longdelayed conference in East Berlin yesterday. Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, took conciliatory stand in his keynote address toward those seeking independence from Moscow's tutelage. The Communist leaders, including Enrico Berlinguer of Italy and President Tito of Yugoslavia, attending his first international meeting since 1948, assembled to ratify a new declaration of principles as the basis of solidarity. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Guardsmen to Help Fight Coast Blaze
description: RED BLUFF, Calif., June 29 (UPI)The California National (Guard was called out today to help fight the state's worst fire of the year as flames blackened more than 60,000 acres of brush and timber in the northern end of the parched Sacramento Valley.

title: Fran Reports Killing 10 Red Terrorists In Teheran Battle
description: TEHERAN, Tran, June 29Iranian policemen killed 10 purported Communist terrorists, including two women, in a gan battle near Teheran's airport today, Iranian officials reported.

title: High Court to Review Ruling On Probationary Patrolman
description: I WASHINGTON, June 29 (UPI) The Supreme Court has agreed to review an appeals court ruling requiring New York's Police Department to give a dismissed probationary patrolman a chance to state his case if the dismissal might hurt his chances of other employment.

title: Body Found on River Bank
description: NUTLEY. N. J., June 29 (AP) The drowned body of a 67yearold Nutley man, Charles Scheuch, was found yesterday on the bank of the Passaic River here, the police said. OfIficials said an autopsy would be performed or the body, which had no bruises. Mr. Scheuch's wife told the police that he had gone out to play golf and that she became worried when she discovered he had not taken his car or his wallet.

title: MARK T. SOUTHALL, LEADER IN HARLEM
description: Mark T. Southall, a former Asemblyman from Harlem who sought a greater role for minority members in state and city government, died yesterday at the New York University Medical Center. He was 65 years old.

title: Political Summitry
description: Inflation remains a serious worldwide economic phenomenon; but the conference at Puerto Rico among President Ford and six other leaders of industrial democracies may well have produced a sharp deflation in the value of summitry as a political device.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Ford Says Conference Strengthened Relations
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (UPI)President Ford briefed his cabinet today on the economic summit conference and said the talke in Puerto Rico strengthened relations among the seven nations represented.

title: U.S. Vetoes Resolution Asking Pullout of Israel
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 29The United States today vetoed a Middle East resolution in the Security Council, objecting that it stressed the interests of the Palestinians while ignoring those of Israel.

title: Mets Subdue Cards, 20, Behind Lolid
description: After defeating the St. Louis Cardinals. 20, on three hits last night. Mickey Lolich can stick his tongue out at the snake from Tijuana. Lolich, of course, has Dave Kingman to thank for avoiding that old snakebit feeling because Kingman provided the Mets runs with his 27th home run.

title: The Stage: Going Up
description: EAST HADDAM, Conn.We take air travel so much for granted nowadays that the glamour it had for people just 60 years ago seems mysterious. The idea of flight was literally fantastic, a sort of spacefiction concept that became a reality in a shudderingly short time. Going Up, the new and delightful musical resuscitation at the Goodspeed Opera House, is precisely about that notion. It was the modern and sudden concept of the aviator, taken with a proper and light skepticism due to the musical.

title: Bank Holdup Suspect Held
description: HAUPPAUGE, LI., June 29 (UPI)John H. Riley of Lindenhurst, L.I., has been arrested in connection with the $14,000 robbery of a West Babylon bank 11 days ago, the Suffolk County police reported. They said Mr. Riley, 33 years old, carried a black brief case into a Chemical Bank branch shortly before closing time on June 118 and told a teller he was carrying a bomb. The teller, the police said, turned over $14,000.

title: Life in Beirut: Dander and Discomfort
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 29 (AP)Until recently, Beirut's 1.5 million residents have managed to live almost normal existences despite inermittent welfare, but that has ended and people are facetoface with daily misery.

title: Pasco Plans to Pay $50.50 Per Share In Liquidation Plan
description: Pasco Inc. an oil producer in liquidation, announced yesterday that it would pay its shareholders a liquidating dividend of $22 a share on its 1,531,240 shares outstanding.

title: TAXCUT EXTENSION SENT TO PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (UNI)  The House passed and sent to President Ford today a twomonth extension of current lower income tax withholding rates. Mr. Ford is expeeted to sign the bill promptly, preventing taxes for almost all taxpayers from rising by, several dollars a week on Thursday. The Senate agreed yesterday to the extension.

title: PBS PLANS DRAMAS GEARED TO CHILDREN
description: A new series of childoriented dramas, described as a junior Masterpiece Theater, has been scheduled by the Public Broadcasting Service for next season as a result of a $2million grant from McDonald's, the hamburger chain.

title: Another 1Hitter By Boston's Wise
description: Rick Wise, who pitched a nohit game in 1971 as a member of the Philadelphia Phillies, was on his way to another last night in Fenway Park. But Paul Blair of the Baltimore Orioles broke up the Boston righthander's bid with a leadoff single in the sixth inning. Wise went on to record a 20 victory, his second onehitter in two weeks and his third shutout of the campaign.

title: Lawyer Asserts An Article Quoted Him Out of Context
description: Cregson Bautzer, a Beverly Hills lawyer, sent to The New York Times yesterday a telegram saying that he was quoted Out of context in a Times article Sunday dealing with Sidney R. Korshak.

title: Missiles to Arabia
description: American military sales abroad, fueling arms sates the third world, have soared from about $1 billion 1970 to more than $10 billion in each of the past three years. This shameful development has seen the United States become a major supplier to both sides in both Mideast military rivalriesbetween Arabs and Israelis and between Iran and the Arab states bordering the Persian Gulf.

title: Korshak Again the Target Of a Federal Investigation
description: More than 35 years after his activities in organized crime first came to the attention of the Government, Sidney R. Korshak is now the prime target of a major Federal investigation.

title: Firemen Injured at Fire In Brooklyn Fiber Plant
description: A smoky fivealarm fire burned stubbornly for three hours last night in a threestory brick fiberprocessing plant on the Gowanus Canal in South Brooklyn.

title: A Mood of Crisis is Missing in Trenton
description: TRENTON, June 29With the threatened shutdown of New Jersey's public schools only hours away, it was virtually impossible today to find a crisis in the State Capital.

title: Tabarly Wins Atlantic SingleHanded Race for 2d Time
description: NEWPORT, R.I., June 29Eric Tabarly, the 46yearold introverted and silent seaman from France, finished the singlehanded race across the Atlantic Ocean early this morning almost 24 days after 125 competitors set sail from Plymouth, England. Sailing his 4yearold, 73foot ketch Pen Duick VI alone, Tabarly thus won the most difficult of all ocean racesbut just barely.

title: A Classic Mixed Grill: Delight for All Seasons
description: Number among our other passions an English mixed grill, that inimitable assortment of lamb and sausages and mushrooms and bacon and broiled tomatoes with bearnalse sauce and straw potatoes on the side. Much we would give to know from whence it came; we doubt that it sprang fullblown from a single inspiration like Minerva out of the head of Jove.

title: WINE TALK
description: There is not a bottle of Chateau LafiteRothschild. Nor is there any RomanceCcnti. There are no 1955's no 1959's and not even a 1961. Nevertheless, Windows on the World, the new restaurant atop the World Trade Center, has one of the best wine lists in the city.

title: Keenan Rejects a Nadjari Offer of Help
description: John F. Keenan, who takes office today as the state'a special aticorruption prosecutor, said yesterday that he had turned down an offer from his predecessor, Maurice H. Nadjan, to help out during a transitional period

title: Miss Lynn Cards 77, Paces Trial
description: GULPH MILLS, Pa., June 29Susan Lynn, a 22yearold from River Vale, with professional aspirations, dominated a field of 40 from 11 states, England and Venezuela today in a sectional qualifying round for the women's United States Open golf championship. She scored a threeoverpar 39. 3877 at the Gulph Mills Golf Club.

title: Polo Tourney Put Of
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I. June 29The opening matli of the Northeastern (??? 12goal polo tournamer t between Fairfield, Conn. and Muttontown at Hickox Field was postponed today becatiqn of wet grounds and has been rescheduled for tomorrow at 5 P.M., following the 3 o'clock game between Bethpage and Aiken, S. C.

title: Korshak Again the Target Of a Federal Investigation
description: More than 35 years after his activities in organized crime first came to the attention of the Government, Sidney R. Korshak is now the prime target of a major Federal investigation.

title: J. P. STEVENS TOLD TO END JOBS BIAS,
description: RALEIGH, N. C., June 29 (AP) A federal judge has ordered one of the South's largest textile companies, J. P. Stevens & Company, to end racial discrimination in employment at its plants in Roanoke Rapids, N. C.

title: Judge Rejects Challenge To Hughes Mormon Will
description: LAS VEGAS. Nev., June 29 (UPI)A challenge filed by nine distant relatives against one of the purported wills of the billionaire Howard R. Hughes was dismissed today in District Court. The document is the socalled Mormon will.

title: Bridge:
description: The prime objective of the pre emptive bidder is to make the opponent guess wrong at a high level. In such situations, the experts guess wrong less often than their competitors, but it is well known that experts are born lucky.

title: Villard Houses
description: The time has come to stop looking for giveaways or ghosts under the bed in the matter of the existing Villard Houses and the projected Palace Hotel. The long and painful negotiations carried out by the city, the owner and the developer have resulted in an admirably workedout solution to the problem of landmark preservation on a prime commercial site in terms that balance the city's architectural heritage against present realities.

title: Jazz Events
description: Following is a schedule of today's Newport Jazz FestivalNew York events.

title: Bay State Union Chiefs Back Wage Proposal
description: BOSTON. Wednesday, June 30 (UPI)Representatives of the Alliance, the 50,000member Massachusetts public employees union; accepted early today a mediator's proposal raising wages by an average of about 9 percent.
